ttl1oitBgceM1Y05S5hSCw.text: Really delicious and quaint, with a unique draw in a very unusual setting. Negate the strange hotel/neighborhood and let yourself immerse in The Barrymore. Located just north of The Wynn/Encore properties, The Barrymore is worth the Uber or cab for a great dinner and great service. Check in on Yelp and receive a free glass of wine! I did. It was delicious.   1 caesar salad, 2 Steaks, fries, baked potato & a breadbasket later, we 2 patrons were STUFFED AND HAPPY. The waitstaff was attentive and got everything 100% correct and then some. The dining room was beautiful and quiet, a nice break from the woo-woo of Vegas noise without the pretentious price tag.

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet with Bernaise
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. NY Strip
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked potato

HozgkgPapUkbN0ZfE4Kb4Q.text: I dined at the Barrymore for my birthday and I cannot praise this restaurant enough. I love the intimate setting, large U-shaped booths, film reels upon the ceiling and mirrors hanging on the walls.  It was nice seeing the wait staff run their own food, check on their tables and pre-bus all of the dishes. This is not as common anymore in Vegas, particularly near the strip, and I appreciated knowing that my tip was going directly to the very deserving wait staff.  We started off our feast with the chilled seafood platter and roasted bone marrow. The bone marrow was as delicious as this meat butter always is and the pickled vegetables cut through the fattiness. The seafood platter was to die for; the lobster was cooked perfectly, the crab claws were incredibly sweet, the Washington oysters were fresh with that iodine flavor of PNW oysters and the prawns were massive. The only thing that left something to be desired was the tuna poke. I could have lived without and it seemed like an odd menu choice for this restaurant.  For our second courses we had the short rib, the chilean sea bass and the shrimp scampi with asparagus and corn with lobster to share. The short rib was perfectly decadent, the sea bass seared to perfection and shrimp scampi presented beautifully. The lobster was lost in the corn, due to the smoky bacon flavor, but was still delicious.  For dessert we shared the cheesecake coupe, which was essentially a deconstructed strawberry cheesecake. The hot strawberry sauce was poured over a white chocolate wafer and it melted into the sniffer glass to create the perfect ending to the meal.

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilean sea bass
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted bone marrow and grande seafood platter.

K4EYmrSa6UCWUv81LwgSOw.text: Gorgeous restaurant with amazing food! Our compliments to the chef and the incredible staff!

3f53ZpoNE6nXCQAHhuyGYQ.text: Don't be fooled by the location, this restaurant, with its old hollywood decor and a menu that would rival any of the big names on the Strip, is one of the best in Vegas. We've been to The Barrymore many times and I just realized I hadn't written them a review, so here goes...  First, the food is amazing! Don't get me started on the lavosh - I could literally eat a basketful. If you've read other reviews of mine, you'd know the bread basket is very important, lol. The grilled octopus is flavorful and cooked to perfection. Some of my favorite entrees are the cioppino, scallops, and sea bass. My husband always enjoys their steak.  Other notes: Service is great, but I do recommend making a reservation. The outdoor patio is a cool spot to enjoy drinks with friends. The area is off the beaten path, so I like that they have valet parking (most nights).  Definitely one of those restaurants that's a must try!

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon scented cheesecake (soooo good!)
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp scampi, added crab legs
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cioppino fettuccini

InTPzyEwFJeBS3fhkESoSg.text: Slow service, condescending waitstaff, food average at best.  Don't see what everyone else experienced. Will NEVER ever recommend or return.

wXKEEDnZ6qB2qoeHmOOU2Q.text: I attended this restaurant for a wedding last night. The food was absolutely amazing! Literally the best steak I've ever had in my life. Perfectly cooked. The service was fantastic.. very attentive with drink service. Would highly recommend!

hOsSRobYN061e8x2saWDFQ.text: I've been to a LOT steakhouses in my days. My belly unfortunately shows it. This was probably top 3 I've ever been to. Steak was cooked perfectly. The frio gras was awesome, and the artichoke appetizer I'm searching for that recipe as we speak. Was sooooooo good. Service was great. This is off the strip, but I would totally suggest eating here!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_n_OA8pNdlvYElkxIkuLLg.text: Always have a great time here. Brought clients of my wife here to dine. Always dig the cozy ambience and old school feel. I feel like its certainly a diamond in the rough, considering the neighborhood. We all enjoyed our meals however my NY strip was ordered charred medium-rare and came out black and blue. It was recooked but appeared to be thrown in a salamander as to not further char the steak, unfortunately it came out rare in the middle, but I ate the edges as to not make a fuss with our guests and enjoyed the leftovers with eggs in the mornin! The manager did stop by the table to do a passive table touch, but I always appreciate direct acknowledgment, I wouldn't have even said it came back rare, or mentioned the secondary prep. But we will be back. Tgis is the only time we've ever had a "hitch".

jypDpObrdHmtZVa7fMc7Jw.text: Looking for somewhere to have our anniversary dinner in Vegas, I wanted to avoid the usual suspects. After extensive research, I decided The Barrymore fit what I was looking for. To my surprise it was only 10 minutes away from our hotel. Driving through the street, I immediately spot the sign out front, illuminating with a fire that matches my hunger.   We walk in, our host greats us and we are seated. We check in and our waiter is more than happy to bring us our free wine. We know just what we want, filet mignon for her and rib eye for me. Both steaks are perfectly cooked, juicy, very flavorful and are slightly bigger than you usually find at a nice steakhouse. The mashed potatoes were amazingly creamy. The complementary bread was almost as good as the steak, I had to stop myself from eating any more of the pretzel bread.   I'm somewhat of a newcomer to the steakhouse scene, but after having dined at some pretty fancy steakhouses in Chicago and Los Angeles, The Barrymore will still be one of my favorites.

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our Mcallen 12 on an ice orb
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Free glass of wine with check in, it pays to yelp
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful signage out front, can&#39;t miss it

ei4ryfVmVSg1T50U7onljQ.text: What a great find!  The old school resistant a with old movie reels on the ceiling give off a cool vibe.  Ignore the facts that the hotel itself is a dump and need of tear down.  Food and service was great.  Not that crowded for a Memorial weekend in a Saturday night.  This place would be busier given how good lavish, steak, and salad was!  A great go to place if you can't get into your favorite Vegas eatery!

XjEXnAyRkwxrKY8QDU0Etw.text: Great place if you like to experience quality food and service in Las Vegas and go away from the tourist places! They have amazing wine selection !

-A42kmBz2aJFVz2oUnsd1g.text: I selected the Barrymore for a company event to host our top suppliers in the city.  The Gold Room was the perfect size and food and beverage service were exceptional.  The location is very convenient and the parking is free which is becoming harder and harder to find in Las Vegas these days.  The entire team from the Barrymore and gen3 Hospitality were very professional and a pleasure to work with.  I can highly recommend this venue for anyone looking for an Off the Strip eclectic venue with an excellent menu and friendly staff. I can't wait to go back with my wife for dinner.

11xAzWCQoJ5BvKkQuuCEXg.text: Recently dined at this restaurant located at the Royal Resort on Convention Center drive so just a short drive off the main Las Vegas Strip. What a cool dining venue and lounge! Nice selection of seafood options to go with Wet and Dry aged steak offerings. We started off with a nice bread basket and my guest and I shared the 14oz NY Strip (wet aged) - prepared perfectly - juicy inside (they were kind enough to slice it for us) - nice light char on the outside - seasoned perfectly! We also had the shrimp scampi and shared grilled asparagus and roasted Brussel sprouts (as with most restaurants - side dishes are good for 2 guests to share). Everything was great. We tried their version of ice cream sundae - which had 3 scoops of different flavored ice creams and then you are provided with different toppings you can add such as pistachios, chocolate & caramel sauces and a few others. They also have a nice wine selection and Heidi the Manager/Sommelier will help you pick out some great options and make sure you have a great experience. The dining area is not that large so if you're looking for something unique or maybe with an 'intimate' atmosphere - check it out! They also have full service bar/lounge I believe with occasional live music. Don't miss out on this hidden gem!

Gf8P3WWTQ8Jc7fsza-5HMA.text: I would never have found this place had it not been for the recommendation of a friend, who happens to be a Clef d'Or concierge...so she knows a thing or two about good places to eat, stay, shop, etc.!  This place is a hidden gem and if word gets out...it could ruin it for the rest of us!  From the Rat-Pack inspired decor, to the attentive service, to the sublime food....5 star all the way!  The manager, Kirk, was unbelievably gracious and made us feel like a member of the Barrymore family!  The Sommelier who created the sublime wine list provided us with such knowledgable information about the wine list, it was hard to make a decision.  So we didn't.  We let him do it and we weren't led astray!  I just can't say enough good things about this place.  Next time you're in Vegas, get off the strip and check out The Barrymore.  You'll be glad you did.

-AIc1DCozv9NroabA5y30Q.text: 3 stars for food, 3 stars for service, 3 stars for location.  Just didnt quite impress me enough for 4 stars

hssm_VPXk2pMbD4FHGB6nw.text: 4.5. Went twice in two days w/party of four; 5 star first time, 4 the second. Look, this is a steak restaurant. Don't come here for fish or vegetarian food; don't waste your $$$. We came for steak and foie gras, and seeing sweetbreads on the menu was a big bonus point. There are two dining rooms: you want the nicer, club-like one with semi-circular plush booths along the walls. The other is bland and opens off the bar, making it noisy. The waiter was also better the first night, altho waitstaff outside the SF Bay Area is almost always a level higher in training and professionalism.  We skipped the specials, which are priced very high, and stayed with basic steak. Good steak doesn't need sauces, either, so we skipped those too. We liked very much:  - Seared Foie Gras with Quince and Almonds. We love foie gras, and La Folie/SF used to make it best. This wasn't up to LF, but it was very good and cooked perfectly. Good size, too. No complaints, outside of the quince being slightly oversweetened.  - Sweetbreads: Served with sweet glazed onion shreds, arugula microgreens, and a lovely breaded and fried potato parsnip croquette. There was no real sauce with the sweetbreads, just a bit of au jus, and it was delightful. A great rebuke to SF Bay Area chefs who think sweetbreads always need battering and deep-frying to be acceptable - NOT!  - Endive and Green Apple Salad. Would have liked a bit more gorgonzola but I loved the refreshing bitterness after the two rich starters. Probably big enough to share; I had this as my entree.  - Crispy Pork Belly: served with a blue cheese mousse and root veggies. Excellent. Wiped the plate clean.  - Creamed Corn w/Lobster; also the Roasted Brussels Sprouts. Both excellent. Nice to see the sprouts cooked first, THEN grilled. That way they don't have to be cooked into charcoal to be edible.   - 8-oz Filet. This was filet of rib-eye the first night but filet mignon the second. The rib-eye is always better, but both were perfectly cooked and delicious. Yes, meat needs to be salted to taste good, something CA cooks seem to have forgotten.  - Bread pudding. The dessert of choice, far better than the others. Very soft, great with coffee.  Good not great: - 14-oz NY strip. I am not a NY strip fan, with beef getting so lean these days. Our friends split this, but they agreed the filet was much better and switched on the second night. It is okay, but not as thick as the filet so the pre-salting came off a bit heavy-handed.  - Chocolate Pear Tart and Caramel Apple Cheesecake. Good, but they tasted like commercial desserts, not really special but an okay way to end a meal.  Don't order: - Octopus. It was a huge portion; very tender but uninteresting. Octopus really needs the kiss of smoke to add some umami; this came off like imitation Spanish food for wimps. It needed to be bolder and better flavored; the piquillos were fine but there was no pimenton. The gigante beans were undercooked slightly.

hOg7bjtTXpv9R0E-ssy0PA.text: Came here for a romantic dinner and everything was perfect. The atmosphere, the food, the drinks.  The lobster Mac and cheese was my favorite, so creamy!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blueberry cream puff

sBvBCk7qsJl3NlQdEg5wbg.text: I am glad that I chose this restaurant for my wedding dinner but on the other hand I am disappointed. I never been there before but decided to trust my intuition and reviews. I love that the restaurant was empty by the time we came and we didn't have to rent it. It was Sunday. The interior design is beautiful and matched my old Hollywood theme. The menu was great. Service was good. Food was average. None of the guests were impressed that's for sure. Cocktails were bit disappointed for those who is not a fan of old fashioned ones. It felt they were more for gentlemen than for ladies. But bartender created for ladies a special cocktail which was perfect. Desserts were ordered in advance and looked fine matched the style but they didn't taste good at all. Maybe I am too spoiled but guests would eat the cake if it was tasty. Nobody touch it when they tried one spoon as it was plain with lack of berries. We had to give away to some people who needed it.. Cupcakes were not touched as they were not tasty according to the guests. The killers were chocolate macaroons. They were outstanding and eaten on the spot together with the white chocolate truffles.  I am such a foodie and very upset that food itself was not on the right level for the wedding dinner even though service was good and place itself was fantastic. I loved the flower arrangement it was perfect and beautiful. Communicating with managers were ok but nobody even asked how was the wedding dinner. Still upset with the desserts as I am a queen of delicious sophisticated desserts but at least it looked fine and matched the theme..

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wedding cake
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wedding desserts

hEAcC1MtuxWMFHYCv9XaTQ.text: The food was good. The waiter was friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable. My guest and I sampled each other's meals and enjoyed everything except the asparagus (quite plain and too crunchy). The surf and turf was very good, but the cheese that the waiter said would melt down over the steak when I cut into the pastry did not do so, it was re-solidified by the time it got to me at the table. The wedge salad and beet salad were both good, not extraordinary, but certainly good. The sea bass (that I was so excited about) was smooth in some spots, but had a bit of a chewy texture in some other places. It wasn't overly flavorful - perhaps it needs more garlic and butter? The sauteed mushrooms were nicely done and had a good flavor. The Pistachio crime brulee was done very well - solid sugar coating, very creamy, even texture. The Oscar fries were one of the favorites at the table. I'm honestly not sure how I feel about the fries being the best part of a $150 meal. My guest and I went there with a group and some of them were surprised by the $7 charge for a glass of water. So just be prepared, if you don't understand water terminology before you go, look up the terms "sparkling, still, and regular" so that you know what you're getting. (BTW, regular water is free.) I did feel that the lounge music was way too loud for the intimate environment, but the singer had a nice voice and looked quite beautiful.

0a1IexMTw-xUTZDkykGjqg.text: A hidden gem! Took my husband last night for his birthday. He loved it. It's an Old Vegas with a modern twist experience. Our server was Luis and he gave us an excellent dining experience. He was very nice and proper. Even the manager did a couple of rounds making sure that all tables were happy. Everyone was very attentive. I love their wide variety of wines. Their handcrafted cocktails list was awesome too. My husband went for the One Fall Evening. It was perfect. The food was delicious and the presentation was exquisite. We ordered the chef's specials for the evening. The hubby went for the Surf and Turf and I got the Surf and Surf. The dessert was amazing too. We chose the salted caramel mousse. To die for. Overall a great experience. The ambiance is nice and intimate, perfect for a romantic evening. Will be back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Surf and Surf. Jumbo shrimp, lobster and sea bass.
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Surf and Turf. Filet mignon, bone marrow and lobster. Delish.
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The One Fall Evening cocktail

ajUGvO6ODqnZNuor-V9quw.text: Oh Vegas, my second home :). I eat every meal like it's my last one and rage like I'm 21 when I'm here.  Always a good time, never a dull moment.  Unfortunately, The Barrymore was my first negative experience at a restaurant in Vegas.  It's located inside a hotel off the strip that I've never heard of.  I was part of the large party of 14 very unhappy people (see all 1-star reviews below).  It might seem like my friends and I are abusing our power as Yelpers but I rarely write 1-star reviews.  As an elite, I recognize the power of Yelp, it could make or break a business.  My point is that I try to be reasonable, so trust me when I say that The Barrymore isn't worth a trip off the strip.  The location, atmosphere, service, and most importantly food is just not up to Vegas standards.  I'm not going to reiterate my party's experience with their painfully slow and unprofessional service.  You can read all about that in the reviews below.  I'd like to just talk about how ridiculously overpriced and solidly mediocre the food was.  I had the sea bass special.  My dish came with risotto, jumbo prawns, and a lobster tail.  I know it sounds delicious but too bad it wasn't.  The sea bass was unseasoned and sat on a bed of oversalted pea risotto.  The prawns were big but were dry and flavorless.  Same with the lobster tail - dry, rubbery and flavorless. The only ingredient that tasted fresh in this dish was the sea bass.  I tried their Kobe flat iron steak and yet again it was unseasoned and bland bland bland.  It was not juicy, just a sad-looking, flavorless piece of steak on a plate.  I tried my friend's Brussels sprouts with bacon and I didn't even taste the bacon, it just tasted like oil.  By the time the lobster mac came around to me I already lost my appetite so I didn't try it.  I never turn food down so the fact that I willingly chose to skip on eating lobster mac n cheese just tells you how bad it was.  Not only was the food disappointing but so was the service.  There are just too many great restaurants in Vegas to even consider this one.  I forgot to mention that my dish was $80 and the steak was around that price range also.  What a waste, I would've had a much better time spending that at the craps table.

a3Jb4QQyuuOeNoN-bzuU1g.text: The Barrymore...finally!   A True hole-in-the-wall...you could drive by the Royal Resort everyday and never know this hidden gem was awaiting your arrival.  Steakhouse quality dry aged meat being served, like the 18oz Bone-in Ribeye that I destroyed! Even more delicious than it looks! It was cooked perfectly, with a nice char and rub. Fat was very tender and flavorful...great steak! And yes, it rivals some of the better steakhouses in Vegas at a much cheaper price!  They also had Pan Seared Foie Gras, which is served with Peach Cobbler, Candied Pecans & Creme Anglaise. This was great! Good portion on the foie gras with tons of flavor, and it paired perfectly with the sweetness of the peach cobbler! One of the better ways I've had this staple :P   The Lobster Mac and Cheese and the Lobster Cream Corn were good, but missing the lobster taste and chunks I've seen elsewhere in town.  Still good, but wish there was a bit more esp at the price point of the Mac ($16).  Heard they have a great burger here, so I know I will be back to give it a go!  If it is anything like the steaks, I am sure it will be very tasty.  The setting is intimate and romantic as well! Don't judge this book by the outside known as the Royal Resort...it's worth the trip!  Check out the pics...they make my mouth water :

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary French Macaroons! Mini bite size portions with yummy, crispy outsides and tasty insides.
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sorbet - 2 Scoops ($4.50): Lemon Olive Oil Sorbet and Apricot Honey Sorbet. Complimentary dessert for Cathy&#39;s Birthday :)
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Double Espresso ($6). Needed a pickup after the food coma!

URIIRXKsrnoUA-s1cCYrOw.text: So I was kind of excited to come here for dinner. Based on the pictures we assumed roof top bar before dinner. Wrong - street level looking g at a parking lot.  We had reservations for 4 at 6:30. Couple of drinks at the bar and then headed to the table. The other couple coming bailed on us/ so just us two.  Kirk  Perry (general manager) said (with a shumg look) we can't sit you in a booth- we said ok.  So we sat in the middle of the room and watch three booths go empty and one booth was set for a couple of two...  not a do over! Thanks Kirk Perry - you set the mood we are locals born and raised here lots of better choices to spend your money on.

4kI-pPMSfX56hsDg8hZJuA.text: My girlfriend chose the Barrymore for her birthday celebration given the great reviews and promise of a fine dining experience. Once arriving in Vegas, we got ready and excitedly headed to the Barrymore for dinner.  Daniel introduced himself as our server. One of the 13 guests handed him a bottle of wine that he had purchased in celebration of our friend's birthday. Daniel offered to waive the $35 corkage fee with the purchase of a bottle of champagne. We chose a Rose, toasted the birthday girl, and began to order.  Let me start by saying that my favorite food is steak and baked potato. Daniel had told us they were a steakhouse known for their delicious steaks and seafood. The menu to my last supper would definitely include a rib-eye steak cooked medium rare and a baked potato with all the toppings! Of course when it came time for me to order, this is exactly what I wanted. My friend and I were sharing and she ordered the seafood special which included sea bass and lobster tail. We added a side of Brussels sprouts to keep it healthy.  When the food came out, my mouth was watering. I cut into the steak and it was seemingly cooked just as I had asked. I was met with disappointment when I tasted it and it seemed like a steak I could get from the Outback but double the price. It was simply seasoned as I like it, but it wasn't juicy and flavorful as I had imagined. The seabass was delicious as well as the risotto with green sauce. Simple, cooked well, and tasty. The lobster tail was terrible. It was rubbery and wasn't cooked well. The baked potato was just as disappointing. When I imagine baked potato at a restaurant like this, I get excited at the thought of a loaded fluffy potato with all the toppings! They must have threw "fine dining" out of the window because it was presented simply as a potato cut in half from the grocery store. No embellishments, no plating. Just the potato all by it's lonesome. It's friends sour cream, chives, butter and bacon came on the side on a separate plate. It just wasn't appetizing. The Brussels sprouts were oily and overpowered by everything else it was cooked in. All in all, the food was mediocre at best. This means a lot coming from someone who is always on a diet and is looking for a place to splurge and indulge in. I was disappointed.  Everything came out so slowly that we started to get impatient. Daniel brings us the bill instead of offering us dessert. When we asked for the dessert menu (birthday girl gets a free dessert!) Daniel said he didn't offer us dessert since we were in a rush. Really? So we don't even sing happy birthday to the birthday girl?  Once the bill finally comes out, we notice the $35 corkage fee on the bill. We inquire since Daniel told us the champagne would waive the fee. He then gets defensive and replies, "I said if you got a FEW bottles of champagne I would waive the fee. Not just one bottle." We tell him we are upset since he told us otherwise and we ask for the manager.  The manager, Paul, tells us it was impossible for Daniel to have said that since he does not have the power to waive the corkage fee because that's just the way they do things. I have a few problems with this. One, why the heck would Daniel even make such an offer when he doesn't have the power to do so. Two, why wouldn't an exception be made since this is what we were promised? Three, it's not like we were given a free bottle of wine. It was the service of pouring the wine that consisted of the fee. It literally was of no cost to the restaurant!   We then decide that we would take the fee out of Daniel's tip since he clearly didn't deserve one after lying to us and refusing to take responsibility for his words. Paul with his poor management skills and inability to make thirteen customers happy also didn't help. We didn't want to leave a tip at all. Paul then threw in his two cents and states that the gratuity is listed on the menu and that we were required to pay for it since our party was greater than six. Therefore, after the terrible service, an unhappy birthday girl and 12 other angry customers, we are forced to pay tip on a $1400 bill. Seriously, $35 is nothing, especially split by 13 people, but not when we were lied to and tricked into buying a bottle of champagne. Then Paul steps in and says he will try to make us happy. Yet, the $35 corkage fee is still sneakily placed on the bill. Still refusing to tip an exhausting and terrible restaurant experience, we calculate the bill without the tip and ask the waiter to charge our cards accordingly. He then pulls a card at random and tells the owner of the card he will have to charge hundreds extra to make up for the rest of the group. Daniel wanted his tip and took it however he could!  I am appalled by the service at this restaurant. Thanks for nothing, except ruining our first night in Vegas and the birthday girl's dinner over a $35 corkage fee at a "classy" restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib-eye steak
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sea bass and lobster tail

4PZ17Tllx86Hjna-iedCOA.text: You may have heard this story already, but here it is from my perspective.  I say one star, but it was actually five stars. I went with a large group and the service was impeccable. It started from when our server, Daniel, proclaimed that corkage would be waived with the purchase of one bottle, only to charge us anyway. It was an honest mistake he quickly rectified by bringing the birthday girl a slice of cake before then leading us in a rousing rendition of Happy Birthday. And my, what glorious cake it was!  We were ready to forgive; the corkage remained, however. The guilt Daniel felt was evident as he quickly brought his manager, Paul, over to calm the situation. Paul was a fine man who appeased us by listening to our complaints with great patience. He nodded, shook his head, and even adopted a quizzical look once or twice, before telling us 'no' and slinking away. There was literally nothing he could do. I mean, what could he POSSIBLY have done? His  honesty was refreshing and it showed him to be a gentleman of the highest order.  Being the deviants we were, a discussion ensued within the group to withhold the mandatory 20% gratuity that had been added to our check. Paul, with his refined sense of intuition, immediately marched back, grabbed our check, and sacrificed his own moral core by waiving the corkage. It was a grand gesture that was wholly unnecessary -- it made me feel very warm and mushy inside. For a brief moment, I considered clapping him on the back, telling him what a fine chap he was, and purchasing another bottle of Rose from him to uncork for us. Truly, I did not want the moment to end.  By then, we realized we had acted out of line, made a conscientious effort to get ourselves together, and paid. It was then discovered that, because they feared they would lose our tip, (without a word to us) Daniel and Paul had devised a lovely plot to pre-charge the entire amount of the tip to one of our credit cards to save us the trouble of having to approve it ourselves. This was quite considerate of them as it wasn't something I had ever experienced at any other fine establishment I have ever dined at.  All in all, it was a wonderful start to the evening. Thank you, Barrymore. You outdid yourselves. I will tell all my friends about my experience and will definitely be back. A++!!

LkPdNAHoZoLHI_gx94mqRw.text: This modern styled restaurant is a hidden gem inside a hotel that is tucked away off the strip. At first pulling into the parking lot I thought that I was going to regret going there and had made a mistake but I was wrong. The Barrymore is very stylish inside and you can sit in the bar area for a great happy hour. The cocktails were amazing, the bartender knew exactly what he was doing and dinner was great. I will definitely be back this may.

Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2a4r6N7ngejvjfQTWPpj-g.text: We went here for my birthday and the food and service were incredible! Thanks to Danny for making our dining experience excellent! We will return when we visit Vegas again! Oh and definitely try the lobster Mac and cheese...you won't regret it!

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8BmokOO4v8w2XpLbsZDuCg.text: This is not the least expensive place to eat in town, but it certainly ranks among the best when it comes to the food!  We ordered several dishes and sides to get a range of testing, and each dish was one of the best we've ever had.  Old Vegas, at its best!

n1qgzStYnEtb5f4POPte8A.text: Swanky, dark and sophisticated, the Barrymore oozes old-school Las Vegas charm!  Tucked away in the Royal Resort, the lobby bar and glowing B up front set up the scene.  In back there are a couple of rich, well-decorated dining rooms with half-circle booths, perfect for a little bit of romance and a lot of great food.   We order up a lobster mac n cheese (per Yelp recommendations) and I go with the beef bourguignon.    The lobster mac n cheese is well done but yes, could use a bit more lobster.  But isn't that always the case?  The beef is tender and full of flavored, it paired up nicely with some potatos.  And the side of asparagus gratin made for a great change of pace.  Service at the Barrymore is excellent, this is definitely the type of place you bring a date to impress.  All in all I really enjoyed my meal here even though it's a touch over-priced.  But it's all good if you want to impress somebody, viva Las Vegas!

9AR5QVF8FgbqHF-nHN5qxQ.text: Excellent quality and customer care all around and delicious crafted drinks.

fPwN1jO7Jb8lYEBG3qG0Ug.text: Went here on a whim after reading some decent reviews.  I was very happy with the overall experience.  Server was very attentive, but not overbearing.  We had two appetizers, two entrees and a couple glasses of wine and the bill was just shy of $100.  It's definitely tucked away and probably won't get the attention it deserves, but a great spot nonetheless.  I thought the food quality was great, portion sizes were spot on - not too large, not too small.  I thought the duck dish was a little salty, but it was also confit...  Anyone who is looking for a nice, quiet place to enjoy some good food, give this place a chance.  Wished the hotel offered valet but parking out back isn't terrible.

9U0hrnH63Nd_ZxEeTMH7-g.text: I wanted so bad to like this place but the reality is that the finality of the experience was horrible.  It is a really nice place in a very unusual location.  The interior is nice, old Vegas style and the booths in the main dining room are great.  The only downside is that because it's in Vegas, and despite the "please dress classy" code, the date with my wife was marred from the start with the ripped tank top + shorts gentleman seated right across from us.  The food....the foie gras was spectacular - very tasty.  The chopped salad was weak - the dressing had no flavor which made the iceberg+chick pea combo taste like water and sand.  The NY Strip was, well, a strip and its hard to screw that up though a bit salty. The sides were fair. My wife ordered the Short Rib.  It came cold.  As in room temperature cold.  The only thing was that the one they gave her had a lot of meat on it and when we sent it back, they replaced it with 1 that had almost no meat.  When we called the manager over, he apologized but then went on to say that it was a "naturally fatty cut" and that "5oz of meat was to be expected" but having been a cook, I can tell you that there was no 5oz on this piece.  The manager offered to switch it out but the problem with that scenario is that in the attempt to save revenue, they forgot that the meal was already ruined and waiting for another plate on an already upset timeblock was not going to fix anything.  At that point, just offer a discount and end the evening.  But even after 2 discussions with the manager, there was no such offer.  I am sure there were good plates but for the mediocrity of the food and more than that, the crappy service from the management (the waiter was fine), I just can't recommend it.  And a small note to management - learn to wear suits that are cut the right length.  Otherwise it just looks silly.

lMsYoummRiLu8WuILnB6fQ.text: Great service and a hidden gem. Food was above average and a great wine list

mKi1v0XapeFN4_Xvqvkjxw.text: Celebrated my 30th birthday with the family at The Barrymore and it was wonderful. Started off our meal with a few apps consisting of frog legs (delicious, and yes they taste like chicken),  and lobster Mac & cheese. Everyone's meal was so flavorful with simple ingredients. Our waitress was also very personable and accommodating. Cocktails were creative & refreshing. Even though I didn't get a birthday candle in my dessert I would definitely go back lol ;-) !!

ydSdshoYKZ02r2gUnjQNww.text: Coudln't agree more with the other review here on Yelp...I saw the article in Vegas Weekly about this new restaurant and on a whim 4 of us ventured out last Sunday evening...all I have to say is WOW. We joked about reserving a table for every Sunday it was that good. Service was off the charts, prices were probably 30% less than Strip but the food did not suffer in any way, even the wine list was remarkably affordable. The Decor was also very old Vegas but with a new feel and twist to it...Great background music too...This place is sure to be a hit and I for one will not be a stranger!!!

rJQLiQJp-eHKCE-Q1lll-Q.text: We booked The Barrymore for my husband's 50th birthday party sight unseen and based mostly on the yelp reviews and I have to say we were not disappointed at all! We had a group of 18 and every single one of our guests loved the restaurant, the food, the staff and the environment.  We worked closely with Chastity to book the reservation and make our menu choices and she was amazing! She was so helpful and made the evening run smoothly.  We loved The Barrymore, our night was perfect! Absolutely perfect!!!!

G8zeaMro7gQffeoq2qT4pw.text: AWESOME!  All around amazing.  my new favorite spot.. makes great for a celebration dinner or even just cocktails.  Service was 5 stars.  Met the general manager Chad who really made sure our evening was perfect.  Can tell they really care about what they're doing there.  HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!! oh and get the lobster mac and cheese you'll thank me later

5s7lMccETVe2cqJpDgqROA.text: If you want to get away from the resort casino resturant for great food and great atmosphere this is the place. Close to the strip but a world away. We all had steaks and they were, top quality, cooked perfectly and delicious eating. The sides are big enough to share. Only negative was the first bottle of wine we selected they were out of.

oECVYr8gX2zlNb-wer-r1Q.text: Absolutely excellent. The food, the wine, the service, the ambiance, the free video games and shuffleboard in the lobby. Dont let the Royal Resort exterior fool you. We loved this place so much on our first visit that we went back 7 days later. Its become our new date night dinner out place and its only been open for less than a month. The grilled octopus appetizer is great, the Filet with Foie Gras was incredible, and about half of what you would pay for it on the strip, and the Diver scallops with oxtail stew was delicious as well. Its been 5 days since we were there the second time and its about time to head back for our third visit.  HIGHLY RECOMMEND.

_xQszfS3OjGBqL0eOUeFbg.text: Good quality food without the outrageous Las Vegas strip prices.

-G6kUhvsRyL-CZY7xeCDlQ.text: I had dinner here with a large group of people so i was able to try many items. The food was very disappointing. Foie gras app was overcooked and so were my scallops. I ate one bite of my scallop entree and left hungry. The only redeeming quality of this restaurant is great cocktails and service.

kCJYEbbqrr3V9xtAyYTeyg.text: I terrific steak place!  If you go, ask for Emily as your server....she is sweet and is a great waitress.  I would go again!

dOdi8Lbxfqx7vk0zHLMbtg.text: The Barrymore is a must visit restaurant and bar just off the strip in Las Vegas. The patio is amazing. The vibe is old school Vegas with a new twist. The bar area is fun and the staff are knowledgeable and super nice!  The Kale salad is a MUST on the spring menu. So good and great size too. The shrimp cocktail is huge. The lobster mac and cheese is delicious and the octopus appetizer is amazing too. Great wine list. Larry Liso performs in the lounge every other Saturday.  You must go to The Barrymore if you live in Vegas or visit. You will be back! - Dayna Roselli

Xb5CipmGUmi-yodOsraaXQ.text: After researching places that had traditional Thanksgiving meal, we decided to try this place. Only one of us had that but he gave the meal rave reviews . Short ribs, filet and salmon were also excellent. Rock shrimp and lobster mac and cheese were terrific as well. The stuffing was not great but I wouldn't ding anyone for that. Our server was excellent. If not for thanksgiving, we probably would never have found this hidden gem but now it's on our foodie list. Don't let the lackluster location scare you , it's different.

C2Y0mnrKmV48TeJw5ZcOSg.text: In his long day, John Barrymore was considered by many to be the greatest American actor ever. If, Indeed heredity is a factor in the mysterious art of acting, his credentials were impeccable. The Barrymores were the Royal Family of the American theatre along with his older siblings, brother Lionel and sister Ethel. Their father, British player Maurice Blythe, gave himself a name likely to impress the natives-and chose Maurice Barrymore. John Barrymore who acted in "Hamlet" had a liking for martinis and he would have six of them before dinner..never eat on an empty stomach was his saying. Christopher Plummer, who is most known for singing "Edelweiss" in the Musical  "Sound of Music," portrayed John Barrymore, in an one-man play at the Elgin theater, in Toronto, that was later made into a feature film. I saw the DVD, the performance which won a 'TONY'  for Plummer, is most riveting one man performance ever. So much so, his co-star in "Sound of Music' Julie Andrews, claims she saw it twice.  This eatery is named after the Barrymores and the ambiance is befitting of the name. It is located on a road that is less traveled, but made famous by the hyped up, high priced and snotty-Pieros (I had the worst Osso Bucco in this place, when I was naive and nerdy taking my romantic interest and shelling lot of dough to impress. I should have taken her to In and out burger,) on one end of the stretch.   There used to be a make shift theater-home to the people who had talent but no money for four walling in a casino-in the lobby of this Royal hotel, which is the official hotel for the Airlines flight crew I was told. One fine day the fire marshals came and took the whole place down and that was the end of the make-shift.   This place is jammed when the conventions are in town and rest of the time a decent  local crowd that frequent this joint not to mention attractive women sipping pina coladas at the bar and the tenders of male gender were openly flirting and ignoring the other customers. Flirting is a temptation but ignoring other customers is SIN ! punishable by one minus rating..  The lounge is tiny and you expect soft piano music, instead there were two burly guys in the corner making some loud music, which was distracting and not in line with the ambiance-one minus rating. The little patio is fire lit and there were too many fluffy cushions that took up the sofa we had to sit down on the floor cross legged ! We looked like two Hairy Krishna's!  The main room is tucked away for the classy clientele and this is probably the only elegant and private dining room outside a casino. The menu is short but eclectic. The burger I tried was the best I had in Vegas. It was neatly presented. You better ask for a table near a waiter, since the service is scant . This place is here to stay since the pricing and quality and ambiance can't be beaten and it is the best place East of the Strip but not far from the Strip.

pVpwpiSBatMEVrEzCJiwqg.text: A hidden vegas gem. If you're able to get of the strip for a hot second go here! Beautiful restaurant, delicious food, amazing service and not super expensive (especially compared to the rest of the restaurants on the strip).

4-0VKD2N3E-NZS5uReJrRQ.text: An amazing gem hidden away from the craziness that is the strip. The restaurant has an equisite setting reminding you of the old 1940's of Las Vegas.  The ceiling is decorated with film reels, low lighting with a view of the wine tower which then goes on out to the bar/lounge area (and if you looked hard enough you could see out to the balcony where the fire pit was). The ink blot paintings on the wall were a treat to look at and although small, with a good group of friends made it just perfect.  Service here was truly jaw dropping, the friendliness of the staff and the attention to detail they provided for you is something to not over look, they take very good care of you.  Our food was delicious, everything was devoured and enjoyed bite by bite and I am excited to make my way back here very soon!

qfUg8bQc2RtWkvW3p8erZw.text: The Barrymore is a sparkling  gem, nestled in a prime location just off Las Vegas Boulevard.  It neighbors many of the old Las Vegas haunts and legendary watering holes. When you first enter this boutique restaurant, you are greeted by a romantically-lit ambiance and taken back to a more elegant era.  The staff is warm, well-informed on their offerings, and willing to extend their expertise and hospitality.  If you are looking for a gourmet experience with an excellent value, the Barrymore provides an affordable menu showcasing exceptional fare.  Drop in on Jesus at the marble-top bar and order yourself up a "Barrymore," or one of the other specialty drinks.  Before you leave, make sure to ask Chad, the general manager, about the vintage, etched mirror that graces the bar.

txweEwnqjktcACgcl6niog.text: Really good food, but the wait staff wasn't what I would expect from a fine dining restaurant.

nEhxW_KtYCvBkSHUgNSnJA.text: The Barrymore is exceptional! Great romantic environment and the food is GREAT! Nice hidden place and great for couples. Congrats to Chef Francisco he surely knows what he is doing! awesome experience.

G3C9RbGEPpQiAV_U9u0zXg.text: Holy moly this restaurant is the bomb.  The dining room is beautiful, movie reels on the ceiling, tufted royal blue booths, subtle and sexy lighting, and a small but stylish bar.  The decor harkens back the days of old Hollywood when glamour, tact and elegance were the rule of the day, not plunging v-necks and teenie boppers driving Lambos.  The patio beckons for an after-dinner cigar expertly paired with a glass of Willett rye.  Great cocktail menu and wine list curated by a well-informed and personable somm.  Don't even get me started on the food, you should just go see for yourself.  A perfect end to a long day at the Nightclub and Bar convention.  I'll definitely be back.

uy90mTEIn3s0saAxNIF2og.text: My husband and I came to The Barrymore based on all the wonderful Yelp reviews. We made reservations for 7:30 on a Saturday night but ended up arriving an hour early. So we sat at the bar. Very nice bar. We sat and had drinks made by Kendra and her tattooed buddy Cody. Very cool. Great glass of Pinot Grigio.  Tried a few of their bloody marys. We were so early that we had an appetizer at the bar. We ordered the octopus and it was phenomenal. We also ate an entire bread basket and the warm salted butter it came with was delicious. At 7:30 we moved to our table. Unfortunately, that's when things kinda went down hill. First it was freezing but immediately the hostess said something to the manager and he turned down the air con AND he checked back with us to make sure the temp was good. We then ordered the soup of the day - Barrymore's special matzah ball soup and my husband and I ordered a rare filet mignon and their lobster Mac & cheese as a side. Our service changed dramatically after we moved from the bar. We went from cool attentive Kendra and her laid back pal Cody to totally cheesy yet non attentive main waiter Louis. Louis was the kind of waiter who was like "yes, yes anything you want" but you ended up sitting there waiting for a piece of bread and a glass of water. Our filet came and it was completely overcooked.   We had asked for it rare and the steak we got was at best, medium ... at best. And you know that if you like your steak rare getting served a Medium steak filet is an abomination.   And the lobster Mac and cheese was bland and flavorless.  S**t happens in the restaurant business. Sometimes food doesn't come out the way you want it to. It's what the management does and how they handle things that matters. I can tell you that despite all the things that weren't perfect with our meal it was the way Chad, the manager on duty handled everything that really made Barrymore's worth going back to. Less than 4 min after our steak went back Chad was at our table. I explained to him how great everything was when we were served from the bar area and how things sadly just went downhill when we went to the main dining room. He cared!  He immediately asked what he could get us while we waited for our new steak. We swapped out the lobster Mac n cheese for corn and lobster and that was delicious. He came over and poured me another glass of wine without me asking. Then he suggested that after dinner we have dessert back up at the bar with Kendra. Chad just made you feel like he cared!  He really wanted you to enjoy your meal and experience at Barrymore's. This is THE GUY you want as your GM if you own a restaurant. He turned our experience around 180. We ended up having coffee and dessert up at the bar (totally comp'd) and spent time talking to Kendra and Chad. So ultimately, you should go The Barrymore. When you do, say hi to Kendra and Chad and have a good evening. We did.

4i5ZbfLeVxkJtMufmZI6CA.text: We were visiting Las Vegas for the weekend, and decided to try The Barrymore based on all the great Yelp reviews. It definitely lived up to the hype. The decor, service, cocktails and food were all fantastic! Our server told us that they don't advertise and rely solely on word of mouth, and that 60% of their clientele are locals, so you know it's good and also very reasonably priced for being just off the Strip. We had the rock shrimp, shrimp cocktail and crab cake to start - all were delicious. We ordered steaks and fish for our mains. The sides were all great, but I have to give a special shout out to creamed corn with lobster and bacon - wow! I will definitely be telling all my friends about this place.

WCUad8v2jftr4ZVxiFt-7g.text: The service was impeccable.  The food was exquisite. It was the second time my boyfriend and I had gone to the restaurant. The menu was different from the last time we visited and we enjoyed trying new things.  We will definitely be going back and we recommended the restaurant to our friends.  The atmosphere is chic, sophisticated and intimate.  There is definitely no other restaurant in vegas that has a similar cool vibe. The music- a little Ella Fitzgerald, Billie Holiday, Louie Armstrong- adds a romantic and jazzy feel that makes it a lovely experience.

MEqyDFikjgt3K21bCOkgHA.text: We came here for breakfast and were very tempted by the omelets and eggs benedict. The champagne flights are endless. We could not bypsss the lobster benedict.  A note of caution for special diets you must inform the kitchen, however they are quite acccomidating. All in all an intimate atmosphere with world class cuisine.

Gx-8XmelLDPM35eMDXVp-A.text: I'd give The Barrymore four stars for the cute decor/vibe and two stars for the food (which I surprisingly wasn't impressed with), so three stars overall.  What I did love about this place was that parking was easy and off the strip, no hassle for a nice and stress-free date night.  And the food wasn't *bad*, I just didn't think it matched the niceness of the decor.  People's comments about the building's exterior were spot-on...dumpy from the outside but chic on the inside.  Loved the fireside patio, even though we didn't use it (in 100 degree heat haha). Have fun!

qk_VjIVmVn7aiQBP8t40SA.text: Well.......not great but not bad either. This place was highly recommended from a friend who lives here in Las Vegas. We split time in both Las Vegas and California and we are always on the quest for the perfect steak house. The ambiance, service were excellent. The steaks were a bit disappointing. We had 4 in our party and not one of the steaks were cooked properly. The group was a bit tipsy and no one wanted to complain. So, we slinked out the door without a complaint. The appetizers were great tasting , but extremely small. I had the Foie gras and it was about the size of a silver dollar. Disappointing for what we paid. We might give this place another try. Maybe it was a bad night for the chef.

4goh8hR3mAkTJQrA88oJJA.text: 2 stars for the atmosphere! 2 for the food. Pretty typical steak house fare. The best part of the meal was the dessert!

2XanSx4nqv-eY0Q4tZCwzg.text: I was excited to try this place after reading all of the positive reviews here.  Sadly it did not live up to the reviews that I had read.  First, the location.  This is located at the end of the strip in a bad area and in an old hotel.  While the restaurant decor is very nice and fun inside, we almost got back in the cab and went elsewhere.    The food while overall pleasant, was just pleasant.  My dish was the Duck Confit which was nice but nothing exciting or different.  The couple that we went with ordered the 2.5 lb Lobster Thermador.  The description of the idem did not include mushrooms but what they received was a lobster shell filled with  80% mushrooms and almost no lobster.  They ended up sending the dish back and the staff was embarrassed at what they had served.   Our waitress was great and very attentive and the food on the whole was fine but I would not go back to this place.  There are too many other great places in Vegas.  This was the worst meal we have on our 4 day trip.  To us is was slightly above average food in a sketchy neighborhood.

IAYcmx0R65D2TVGbXw-pTA.text: Perfect. Four Hours Of Pure Pleasure With Great Friends, nice little lounge outside of restaurant at the royal resort to hang at also.  Consider this a must stop when in Vegas and you want a little different than that of the strip!

GShSzw8G1nyQeeqkmGj2-A.text: Way overpriced @ $14/cocktail.  All of the drinks we ordered with one exception were just whatever despite fantastical sounding descriptions.  The one exception was the Bloody Mary made with mushroom truffle infused vodka, which is no longer going to be on their menu.  Meh!

cCUCBQtacQezavdL7pGMuA.text: My first time at The Barrymore last night with my fiancee and we loved it.  Don't let the outside fool you, the food and service were excellent. We ordered the Lobster Mac and Cheese and Grilled Octopus for starters. They were both very good, but the octopus was definitely a surprise. Extremely tender and not at all chewy as I come to expect with octopus. For our entrees we ordered the Pan Seared Salmon and the Pan Roasted Duck. The sauces for both were delicious and the serving size was just right. For dessert we had the creme brulee and chocolate gelato. The creme brulee was one of the best I've ever had. Excellent presentation of each dish, it looked good and tasted even better.  The service was amazing and  we will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The best creme brûlée
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan seared salmon with okras
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Mac n cheese

jNirQBK4WyKNSxHMc95Shw.text: Love this place! I read about the restaurant in a SoCal magazine and knew I had to try it next time I was in town.   The service was excellent, Israel rocked!!  He provided great recommendations on wine, apps, and entrees, he even called my BF and I a cab following dinner.   Everything we ordered was good.  If you get the lobster mac and cheese, I recommend splitting an entree with an extra side.   I had the burger, which I never order anywhere and it was amazing.  It's served with an english muffin rather than a typical burger bun, it's lighter and allows you to get the full flavor of the beef patty and chutney.    You defiantly feel like you stepped back in time with the old Hollywood feel.  It's a classic restaurant I could see the Rat Pack hanging out at.  Highly recommended for date night with that special someone!

RUIFRIeunFeyM1hWuAwBow.text: The most amazing place!!! Romantic, intimate and very "speakeasy-ish"...The staff was amazing and the managers floated all night to make sure everything that came out of the kitchen was to out liking...The food was amazing, everyone at our table had a different plate and there was no complaints :) If you really want to feel like you have an "in" to Vegas this is a place that should be visited!

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Las Vegas blvd.  cocktail...amazing...
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3N1ULOcBVMypRS68u1D5wQ.text: Atmosphere - 5 stars Service - 5 stars Apps - 4.5 stars Entrees - 3.5 stars Drinks - 4.5 stars  We had the calamari and steak tartare for apps, both were excellent.  The breads were very tasty as well, especially the cherry/bacon bread.  Wine was reasonably priced as well as beer and mixed drinks...I like to party, JK.  The entrees were a bit of a miss.  We had the burger and the diver scallops with ox-tail stew.  The burger was good except the caramelized onion/bacon "smear" overpowered the entire burger...scraped it off, was better without it.  The scallops were good but the pairing with the ox-tail "stew" was strange.  Either item on its' own would have been good but they were just weird together...like putting BBQ sauce on a scallop.  Overall, I definitely want to come back and try some different entrees.  The place is reasonably priced considering the quality of ingredients and atmosphere.  Me and the date had all this food plus several drinks, and a few glasses of wine for $120...not bad.

cL-6-atDHziFPxT8wLGBQg.text: I've been drooling over their menu for months and finally got a chance to dine there...I was completely satisfied. Try their braised short rib and lobster mac and cheese!!! Great place for a romantic dinner as well!

YrFUHr7FpOlkchF7lYRU4A.text: I absolutely loved celebrating my birthday at The Barrymore. I was there on a Saturday night and it was the perfect escape from the busy strip. The service was friendly and very knowledge about the menu. If you go, you must have the lobster mac and cheese and the ox tail and scallops. Their wine list was extensive and I enjoyed what I had. I can't remember the names. Sorry! The overall experience of being back in the 1920s was amazing. It was a very intimate setting. I highly recommend this restaurant.

nDm5jVD4LGD0_urY45IZeA.text: The Barrymore left something MORE to be desired.  After frequenting the Royal House (the hotel bar) and appreciating the ambiance and style, I thought it would be nice to try the restaurant especially with all the rave reviews.    It was a serious disappointment!  The food was mediocre, the service was lacking, and the decor was the only redeeming quality.    The aged cowboy steak didn't have much flavor and was too fatty (the addition of the steak sauce was a minor improvement; unfortunately, it finally made its way to the table when we were almost finished eating) .  The steak sandwich was blah, and you can get a better burger at fuddruckers or smash burger.  The other food was really nothing to write home about.  The service was slow considering there were only six parties and the restaurant appeared to be at half capacity. The managers/owners(?) introduced themselves to every other table except ours (there were only five other tables in a small dining room). It took ten minutes for everyone at our table (of five) to be served their entrees, so half the food was cold by the time we could eat it.  If this restaurant is supposed to be nostalgic of old vegas, it really missed the mark!  Old Vegas is about good service, good food, and a good time!  If you're looking for a classic vegas steakhouse, go to the Golden Steer.  If you're looking for a similar style, go to the Artisan.  If you're looking for a good time, stay at the bar.  All in all the experience left a bad taste in my mouth!

xKGVdvHYHZfzQx48j0pOGQ.text: Nice atmosphere, great drinks at the bar and the appetizers were good especially the calamari and lobster mac n cheese. Food was good, not terrific. I'd recommend this for a nice evening out.

HkfnzeTUU60r6oQb7xFnYQ.text: To start off the experience, an employee personally called noticing the out of town reservation to ask if there was anything he could to make our experience easier.  He left his personal cell to ensure that if we ran into trouble we could contact him.    Walking in the door, we were greeted immediately, shown to our seats and Luis our server was witty, knowledgable and on point.  The food was perfection.  The wine suggestion to go with the Wagyu Beef was excellent.    The macchiato and creme brulee was the perfect end to the perfect meal.

mlZFCfqeBFf1rhTJ5J5MFQ.text: We returned to the Barrymore again this time.  The food is very good (warning, if you get the cold seafood platter, it's a bit skimpy - even with an appetizer and dessert - might want to go to the large portion even if there are only 2 of you).  Really great decor.  Such a hidden gem (the Royal Resort hotel is a simple, out of the way place).    While the food is definitely good, it's the service that really grabs you at this place and pushes things to 5 stars.  My wife and I really enjoyed talking to the General Manager last Saturday night.  He was VERY attentive and made sure everything was perfect.  He even took back a whole bottle of wine just after we ordered it because it wasn't to our satisfaction.    Small and quaint.  Just very different and a great place for couples.  Thank you, Barrymore.  Two for two!  Keep up the great work!

NmNUVGRz-jKfehZkio8nDA.text: First when our car pulled up to the front of the hotel, my husband and I thought about bailing. Than we decided to give it a try and walk-in and the place was amazing! Its a hidden gem for sure!   We had a great waiter-Danny-who was happy with his job which made our experience better. Food was amazing! I had a aged steak and it was very delicious!   I would recommend this place to everyone.

giQQKN2La35GeFQIc0fA1w.text: When trying to decide on a restaurant for my birthday dinner before seeing a Cirque show, I was torn. After talking to a bunch of people on TripAdvisor, the Barrymore seemed to be the place to go. I was excited to try out their menu and had high hopes.  We arrived on time for our reservation and the restaurant was empty. Completely empty. I guess we were fairly early (our reservation was for like 5:30, to allow time to eat and to get to our show) but it was a bit surprising. Our waitress was friendly and prmopt with service, chatty when it was appropriate and left us alone while we ate. I had a white russian to start (very good) and tried the foie gras appetizer and the scallops for my main. My boyfriend ended up getting the special 14 oz steak (the thing was at least an inch and a half thick, if not more.  I love foie gras and I was really looking forward to trying the appetizer. I was underwhelmed, at best. Not only did I find my foie gras undercooked, but the spiced french toast that was served under it really didn't do anything to complement the richness of the foie gras. There was quite a bit of cinnamon and for me, it completely overpowered the foie gras. I wasn't a fan of the treatment of the dish here so I wouldn't recommend it if you're looking for something more savory.  I think my main was a special for the evening because I don't see it on the menu, but the scallops I had were good, but not great. They too were slightly underdone and were way way way too salty. Shellfish doesn't usually need THAT much salt to get it where its going but it was salty to a point where I stopped eating after a point. Disappointing. My boyfriend enjoyed his gigantic steak, said it was the most tender steak he'd ever eaten but not the best steak he'd ever had.  We were all too full for dessert but our waitress did bring over some pistachio and raspberry macarons for my birthday dessert. These were quite good, but by this point, I was fairly disappointed in what was a relatively reasonably priced meal.  Overall, this was an okay restaurant but for a special occasion, it really fell flat for me. Next time I'm in Vegas, I'll steer clear of the Barrymore and try something different.

71Xc7Ej3aowZap7SkxVYUw.text: I'm in Vegas for the APA Poolplayer Championships and decided to take the wife out to a nice dinner. This place is almost easy to miss, however once we were in we were greeted quickly and very politely, we were seated fast in a nice secluded and romantic booth. Our waiter was polite and enjoyable. He was knowledgeable in the menu and explained with great detail the specials that were not on the menu and was well versed in the steak selection and curing process of each. We ordered appetizers and drinks. The sour mash old fashioned was very good and similar to how I make them at home. We both orders the 45 day dry aged 18 oz bone in ribeye. I ordered a baked potato as well. It came with all of the sides, bacon, sour cream and chives. The steak was cooked perfectly medium rare with a nice burnt crust on the outside. The meat melted and was perfect. The wife had hers cooked the same way and said she will never have it cooked any other way now. This place is also price conscious. The steak was 50 something and the baked potato wasn't much. It was a wonderful experience and we will be back

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone in Ribeye
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone in Ribeye
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone in Ribeye

kGoGq4aDSPl3OJOCjISwvA.text: Maybe a 3.5. I would say better than okay, but with a big setback. You'd never expect a restaurant at this hotel.  It is located inside the Royal Resort, which looks like an old run down hotel.  Go inside and there is a bit of this old school swanky decor. The ceiling decor was a bunch of big old school looking movie reels. The table shared a bunch of appetizers. We got the steak tartare, foie gras, veal sweetbreads and lobster mac and cheese. All were tasty. For drink, I got the moscow mule which was good too.   For the main, I got the bone-in ribeye* with a side of sauteed spinach.  *I was told the meats were all grass-fed  The sides don't actually come on your plate, but a seperate dish so that makes it easy for sharing and each side is large enough for 2-3 people. More if you have a big party and just want a taste of everything. I also go to taste the creamed corn, mushrooms, and brussels sprouts. Sides were all good. Creamed corn stood out.   The rib eye was cooked to the right temperature, but the one thing that was dissapointing was the crust. It was too salty. It wasn't just mine. The table consensus was that the crust of all the steaks were too salty. I found myself having to eat the steak with something else to help counter the saltiness. I finished about 3/4 of the steak and had to quit. With all the sides and appetizers, I couldn't hang anymore.   Service was friendly and they cracked a few jokes as well. Besides the salt issue, I found everything else to be good to great.

tZRKFM7b3HK03pyNXASsAQ.text: Yum yum yum! I've been here for dinner a couple times and for drinks as well. Never had a bad experience. The food is always amazing and I've never been disappointed with the drinks. Service is always great. I love the atmosphere here.  Nice hidden gem off the strip. A must try!

dG9z-3dMsjkouy9aUfScfQ.text: We visited as part of Restaurant Week and were blown away with the beautiful elegance of this restaurant!  The escargot for appetizer was a very novel presentation and tasty as well.  The bacon was a bit overwhelming but interesting and tasty. We both enjoyed the Surf and Turf, the lobster was delicious and the Filet perfectly prepared...the best part was the marrow bone which we would've gladly traded the entire meal for a plateful of those...decadent, delicious, rich, just plane excellent! Wine selection by the glass was fine and nicely complimented the meal. Service was very nice, spot on and always available without being overbearing. It was also nice and quiet and we're glad we were in and out early, two large parties were to be seated in our room which definitely would've changed the whole ambiance, though! We will definitely return with friends, this is a place we will keep in our favorites list!

0ZrDLHjz4hd-KVFgprThzA.text: Friendly service and good food in what feels like an old hollywood glam restaurant.  Great wine selection. Be sure to ask for their vegetarian options, the roasted veggies are delicious.

41tckiHappNV_SzOD2u7xw.text: good food from a classic old Las Vegas steak house.  I was pleased with the meal.  The octopus was fantastic.  Stepping into the place feels like the Rat Pack themselves should be here eating dinner.

x4kCFVUDLrJ6eGq-FFURPQ.text: I had not heard of the Barrymore before, but I was perusing the various prix fixe menus being offered for Restaurant Week and my attention was grabbed by the "Surf, Surf & Surf" (Chilean Sea Bass, Lobster, & Giant Grilled Shrimp).  Well, that sounded yummy.  The associated choices for the the first course (Grilled Octopus and Slab Bacon) were less appetizing to me, but you have to get adventurous sometimes with a prix fixe menu, so we were in.  Both my wife and I thought the Surf dish was fabulous.  One of the best pieces of Chilean Sea Bass I have had, an excellent and meaty lobster tail, and huge flavorful grilled shrimp.  It was too much to finish, especially after the rich, fatty bacon appetizer.  If the dessert course had not been part of the menu we probably would have passed on that, but as it turned out the deconstructed cheesecake was quite good.  The chocolate layer cake, not so much.  At $80, the meal wasn't quite the good deal that Restaurant Week meals sometimes are, but it certainly wasn't anything to gripe about.  Our server was attentive, and made an effort to be chatty and pleasant.  The portion of the restaurant where we were seated was pretty empty, so everything moved along at a brisk pace.  The one thing that just didn't seem to work for me was, for lack of a better word, the "vibe."  When you walk into a hotel/motel that looks like the Royal Resort, you expect to see a coffee shop off the lobby.  The Barrymore is someone's effort to replace that coffee shop with a really high end restaurant.  But I never really got past the feeling that I was eating in a coffee shop in disguise - a vibe that was intensified by the retro 50's interior design elements.  I would say that if you go to the Barrymore, go for the food rather than the romance.

ZP5pXqC9TQyz5hsKmfNT7g.text: We had a hair in our lobster Mac and we had to ask to comp it and when they did they added a mandatory 20% gratuity for a table of two!  No apologies or any concern from the service side and management!

JPWYtpRvXd2HMEpThRqyVA.text: You will find a happy hour menu and drink specials at The Barrymore ,located inside Royal Resort Hotel.  My sister and I decided to stay in after a long day and sample the happy hour menu and a couple of drinks.  Our "private" mixologist, Corey, is a brilliant bartender with  knowledge of "adult beverages" that please the tongue.  We shared a variety of his own recipes that would make any bartender on Taffer's BAR RESCUE jealous!  All were delicious, without any residual effects the next morning.  The food on the Happy Hour menu is creative and delicious, including the grilled octopus as well as the Oysters Rockefeller using Baja Oysters. Nice surroundings, nice music and of course, nice employees...of course everything is first class in Las Vegas.

ZIFLQu9Xme9EAbFEpamZuQ.text: I have a new favorite here... The bone marrow!!!   You don't be disappointed .   I feel like the fois gras got smaller than the last time we were there.  Way too small for the price.

GURH7L2RxaNyLX_cHU3QSw.text: I sat at the bar just so I could order some foie gras. Lucky for us, it was happy hour. I believe it is opening to 7pm? Half off appetizers and some drinks.   Lobster mac and cheese - Good but seriously where was the lobster? They should have just named it mac and cheese. (HH menu)  Grilled octopus - Too salty. Octopus texture was okay. (HH menu)  Foie gras - Brought on the colder side of lukewarm, which made it very unappetizing. Decent quality though. (Not on HH menu).   Hubby ordered a drink.   Hubby liked his drink and would return. I don't drink so I probably would not return.

u5B4bjuBSCdxo0zpLlcHGA.text: The atmosphere at the bar is great and they had a lounge singer playing.  We had a few drinks and a smoked bacon appetizer which was very good. The happy hours prices are extremely reasonable. Great spot.

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smoked bacon appetizer is so good.

LdaIWm3C3aZy3lwBUngavA.text: Israel. He was a wonderful server and made our night absolutely exquisite. I hate to say it but he talked us into several menu items just by his knowledge of the way the items were cooked, what they were served with and how they were displayed. He knew what he was talking about and everything that came out was delicious.   We ordered the lobster bisque, lobster mac and cheese, and pork belly to start. The bread basket was delicious as well. I enjoyed a Porn Star, while my husband ordered a Manhattan. Both drinks were delicious, but the Manhattan was so smooth we ordered two more. Israel recommended a wine that paired perfectly with my husbands meal.  On to the entrees! I ordered their special sea bass, while my husband picked the Rib-eye. My sea bass was a little fishy but the flavors surrounding the fish helped drown that out quite a bit. The asparagus was on point though! My husbands rib-eye looked amazing & according to him tasted amazing.   All in all the best part of our dinner was the service. Thank you Israel for making our evening that much more special! We will definitely come back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Manhattan, smooth like buttah.
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sea bass. Asparagus. Yumm.
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheesecake mousse. Caramel apple deliciousness.

KsCVx1Rzax7d9KChh0Twhg.text: Tucked away in a small humble hotel, this place is so cute and classy! Love the retro-inspired design.  Their starter bread basket was delicious and with a nice variety. We shared a lobster bisque appetizer and unfortunately, it was probably the worst part of the meal =/ It was terribly salty and they were very stingy with the lobster -- it actually came in tiny stringy bits rather than the typical pieces or chunks.  However, their 14 oz. New York strip steak redeemed the meal!! I also ordered a side of their grilled jumbo shrimp. Both the steak and the shrimp were delicious and perfectly cooked. I was pretty sad that I wasn't able to finish my steak =( it was THAT good.  Husband ordered their duck and we shared a side of sauteed spinach. Both were also very good (but spinach was a bit too salty)! Their portions are very generous, if that wasn't obvious enough.  Service was very friendly and attentive. This was a great steak dinner and I'll definitely be visiting again when I need my meat!

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 14 oz. New York strip steak with side of grilled jumbo shrimp

XaazJMdcl3r6MaZ_AEtHMw.text: I'd just like to start by saying that it pains me to give this place 2 stars because I was hoping for so much more! We took a little getaway to Vegas this past weekend. I wanted to eat some place local, not a big chain in a newer casino. I saw awesome reviews for the Barrymore and booked a reservation for Friday night.   We were seated in a tiny little room to the side of the bar with a few tables. For some reason I was expecting a much larger dining room from the pictures online but whatever. Our server was excellent, very professional and knew her stuff. After explaining to her that my husband doesn't eat onions and gags at the flavor we opted for the morel risotto with no onions. From the moment the dish hit the table my husband's face fell. We could smell the onions a mile off. The first flavor on the palate once we took a bite was straight onion. I felt so bad for the hubs - he was as excited as I was about this place.   We ordered the steak special for 2 (a 30 oz steak with 3 sauces), the creamed corn and lobster and the brussels sprouts with bacon.   Steak: Ordered medium rare and it was definitely rare - almost raw. The flavor was good so we ate it as we were starving and didn't feel like waiting for a new one.   Creamed corn and lobster: NOPE. Couldn't taste an ounce of seafood in this dish.   Brussels sprouts: Way undercooked with no flavor. This dish needed more time and salt.   The cocktails were good but this was the most disappointing $200 I've ever had. We had to stop and get a snack later because my husband was so hungry when we left. Such a sad, sad experience - we will never be back.

nZwagPvKxRMqhEZHqiq3yA.text: We left our hotel, where there were plenty of great dining options, to this random hotel out by the Convention Center. And let me tell you...those couple of miles puts you in a very different atmosphere. This was old school Vegas. Which I normally don't mind. In fact, I prefer old school Vegas, the local's Vegas, off-season Vegas...you get the idea. But if you're at a restaurant, all you're going to care about is the food. And nope...this restaurant was not worth the effort it took to get here.  In short, most of our entrees were overly salted. One rib-eye was undercooked, one filet was overcooked, one duck was chewy. When you're paying around $50 for a plate, it better be pretty effin good. Unfortunately, it was just okay. The service was great - at both the restaurant and the hotel. (Thanks Tyrel for trying to help me locate my phone!) But I would be hesitant to recommend this restaurant when there are so many other options around and much closer to the strip.

oCu2kGUjnI7afgkV8rFoVA.text: Let's not waste any time here on this review. My wife and I were vacationing in Las Vegas and decided to pick The Barrymore Resturant to celebrate my birthday and have a last night in Las Vegas romantic dinner. Our Uber driver dropped us off in front of the Barrymore and we have to admit we were a little apprehensive about going in although it has a 5 Star rating. The Barrymore is not located on the main strip, it's not part of the big chain hotels. and it's not on the food channels famous chefs list. As we approached the entry of the dinning room we were met by Brian the  Maitre D and beautiful live music  entertainment. Brian greeted us so professionally and brought us to our dining room table where he took the time to explain the menu and specials for the evening. Brian also answered any questions that we had about anything we wanted to know. As an appetizer we ordered the Lobster Macaroni and cheese, for the main course my wife ordered the salmon and I ordered the 8oz Rib eye steak, for side we had the sauteed spinach and mashed potatoes. All we can say was Oh My God. The food was absolutely amazing,  for desert we had coffee and the Japanese version of cheesecake. I have to also give credit to the service we received as well. I'm not sure who the Chef is but, they also deserve a huge shout out.
