So if you're ever in Las Vegas and want get away from all the nonsense check out The Barrymore for an enjoyable evening of food and fun.

KSwp1MXMwY7dWKfQLkhXkw.text: Fantastic. The decor, live music, elegance sets you back to the 50s. Service was excellent! Our party enjoyed the shrimp scampi, rib eye, and the 8oz sirloin. It was delicious.

TyldnIL-0qDVDvlN2A439A.text: Found this place by accident. Super cute and cozy. Not pretentious. Free wine with yelp check in. Great table bread.

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread basket
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone in ribeye. Had a good crust outside.  Lobster Mac n cheese.  Lobster was a little dry but the rest was good.

8qK6gysEGNkxHWCtCBEgAw.text: We held our wedding reception at The Barrymore over a year ago. Everything was perfect. The steaks and scallops were delicious.   If you're getting married in Vegas and need a small (50 or less) reception, then go to The Barrymore. You can't beat their care, expertise, and value.

Xs6YVryqMFNEwiWV-_y3NA.text: Love this bar! Such a retro classy feel. Their Happy Hour is wonderful. Must try the Bacon appetizer and their Wedge Salad

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oyster Appetizer
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wedge Salad with Bacon Bits! So good

D325XOaKn3-639YY1ASgkw.text: Has the time come where I am so jaded from such amazing restaurant experiences that I set my hopes too high when going to other high end restaurants? The Barrymore was chosen from a Yelp search while spending a couple nights in Vegas for my brother's birthday. I had reserved a table online and was easily able to push the time back an hour and a half when we realized we would be late (time flies when you're gambling...I mean...having fun). When we arrived at the hotel we noticed that the hotel like most other Yelpers have mentioned on the reviews is quite boring and weird. It was really quiet that you almost wouldn't expect to have a nice steakhouse inside and the woman at the front desk just looked as us when we walked in. When you're in an empty lobby and there's only one other person, usually a "Hello" or "Welcome" is nice.   Anyways, we walked into the restaurant and were greeted by a very nice gentleman who showed us to our booth. The restaurant was pretty empty for a Thursday night but I know it was 9pm so I didn't think much of it. There was one giant table finishing up but when they left we were the only ones inside. The interior of the steakhouse is beautiful. Very old classic Vegas with leather booths, smoked mirrors on the walls, just the right amount of dim lighting and  of course a nice full bar. We were greeted by our server who was nice but almost seemed annoyed that we were there. I know we must have been the last table but why were we able to make reservations if they didn't want anyone there? When he talked to us he talked very fast and kept looking away like he wanted to be somewhere else. We didn't feel engaged, more so rushed as we tried to ask some questions about the menu. For drinks we saw there was a check in offer for a free glass of house wine with a purchase of 25$. The four of us asked to use our offers and while the wine was tasty, I felt like as soon as we did that they didn't think of us as high paying customers anymore.   The food, of course, was cooked well and tasted great. The steak is more on the rare side when you order medium rare but the portions are large and the sides are very rich. We tried the bacon and lobster corn, risotto and Brussels sprout side dishes. All were cooked perfectly and added a great richness to our New York steaks and Ribeye. We had also enjoyed the grilled octopus ceviche with mango but the octopus was definitely not in ceviche form, more like three grilled tentacles with a mango salsa and a couple plantain chips. The octopus was cooked well and you are also served a variety of breads in a basket. Most were very dry but probably because it was the end of the night.   We were thankful for the chocolate dessert brought out complimentary for my brother's birthday with a candle on top. We really appreciated the gesture but that cake was brought out by the man from the front desk who had checked on us during out meal with a warm smile on his face - something we hadn't felt from out waiter. We grabbed the check and headed out of the place without much to say about the experience. Even though it wasn't a bad dinner, unfortunately the Barrymore most likely won't be on our list of places to come back to the next time we are in Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled octopus ceviche
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Espresso
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New York

htJ2bA4NzJf81Qw_CF4hOQ.text: Tried this place my kayly 18th bday and if anyone knows me I dont eat fancy...but this place was amazing the steak was made perfect and the salmon was amazing. Service was excellent and very amazing atmosphere

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet mignon, corn and crab cheese and salmon was amazing

JHY7t2V6C21NJ2FgGbt-2Q.text: This place is beautiful.  We went for our anniversary. We ordered the octopus ceviche,  it was so tender and delicious.  My husband ordered the wagyu filet with the scallops and spinach. I had the Chilean sea bass , with a twice baked potato.  Everything was so delicious.  Our waiter was very helpful and so nice. The live music was romantic and perfect. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to our friends and family.

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dinning room
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilean sea bass

JFWww5-mJXoX5nlDrogQkQ.text: Amazing special evening at the Barrymore. Delicious food and friendly staff. We had a large group and they were very accommodating to us. Loved the old vegas vibe!

JjIZ5kBfksJbNTU5zNWl9w.text: First time at The Barrymore last night for happy hour. Loved it super impressed and will be returning. We had the oysters Rockefeller, bacon, fries, wedge and Cesar salad. Pretty much everything on the happy hour menu. Service was great and the food was wonderful!

7i9WrcC8KqUUhrFmQOQ7hw.text: We ate here at the beginning of December and we're not disappointed. it's a cool little throwback restaurant in a no-name hotel near the convention center and loved it from the moment we got there. You definitely get the old school feel of a steakhouse but it's small enough that you get incredible service. And the food is out of this world. Check it out!

Nj_dGgMmraQ-VWelMUmfHQ.text: Omg!! Can you say Amazing ? Every piece of food we have tried tonight was an explosion of flavors in your mouth!! I will come back and try every thing in their menu!! The service was incredible!! Ashley was an amazing, she was trying to show us everything great about the place, history and everything!! Thank you so much!!

A49FHCML0OIPJO9_OZDtpA.text: Old school steakhouse dining that harkens back to the days of the Rat Pack.   I was here for a corporate biz event and they pulled no stops at The Barrymore with service, drinks, and food.  Don't be freaked out by the weirdo hotel it's adjacent to with the 100 year old cool dude playing piano in the lobby, and the kitschy Vegas decor, along with C grade shows being performed here. Once you walk into the actual restaurant it's all class.   The main dining room we were in had some terrific booths and a dark wood community table, along with a ceiling adorned with film reels that bring back the golden age of movies. The food was top notch along with the wine selection. Trays of seafood appetizers, large jumbo shrimp cocktails, and seafood entrees. As a non-red meat eater this was perfect. Those who did have steak proclaimed it was delicious.   Those waiting on our tables and serving us made sure we had a great time. My wine glass was constantly being filled. Just a really good choice for a corporate event or biz dinner with clients.  Old school Las Vegas in the best of ways.

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0QenS-vWnUBnmQce843woQ.text: I dined here while on a corporate retreat and was impressed with the restaurant.  At first, it seems a teensy weensy bit shady considering it's located within a 2-3 star hotel at the North end of The Strip.  However, once you arrive inside, you see the cool, glitzy interior that is Hollywood-themed.    They were able to accommodate me with vegetarian options for all 3 courses.  For my appetizer, I had a berry salad.  For my main entree, I had a vegetable coconut curry dish that was served with quinoa.  For dessert, I had the key lime tart.  All 3 dishes were excellent - especially the curry dish.

DcC5joQ1OznAuCQQiP-hbg.text: After having tried this place once before we wanted to give this place another go. We were looking for a nice steak dinner for Christmas Eve for family that was town.   The decor is tasteful and inviting.   To the food and service...  We ordered the foie gras and bone marrow as starters. The foie gras was seared but it just didn't taste right. Many other accompaniments were tried to enhance the favor but nothing helped.  The bone marrow was undercooked--still bloody in the mid parts. It is served with a sliver of toast. It was the worst bone marrow that I've tried. The buffets on the strip do it better.   Next to the entrees. The steaks were standard. Nothing memorable about them. The brussels sprouts lacked any seasoning. Additional salt was needed to make them tolerable. The truffle potatoes were good--nice flavor and consistency.  The waiter recommended the Oscar fries. Some in our party were fans.   The service was quite lacking. It took over 10 minutes for our server to return to take our food order. The guy filing our water cups was on point. The worst interaction of the night was the ?sommelier. We weren't quite sure who she was because she never introduced herself. She spoke mostly in a loud, condescending tone. I felt like any concern she did offer was forced.   I would not recommend this place.

J-tESlsMK5-TwE2Vrd8XiA.text: Chose this place for a date night. This restaurant was recommended for a romantic dinner. We liked the ambience, food, drinks and interior design. Friday evening they had live music and social hour from 5-7pm with specials on drinks and appetizers. There is a nice outside patio with fire pit.

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smoked Bacon
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Slider
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smoked Bacon - Happy Hour

0QkKP3IlmGm7KTp6QXgmfA.text: Reasonable prices with delicious food and cocktails. It has an old school vibe and huge wine selection as well. It was nice to get away from the crowds too. Service was great. The lobster creamed corn with bacon is must-have side. Really enjoyed the bone marrow as an appetizer.

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States

X7uwru1jHvjbIy_2ud0xNQ.text: If you're looking for a really good steak dinner come here ! It's not on the strip so it's low key and quiet. The atmosphere is ambient and chill. The outside seating for happy hour makes you feel like you are a celebrity. The happy hour specials are a good bang for your buck (20$ bottle of really good champagne hollaaaa).   Everything we got was amazing but my favs were : steak (duh), oyster appetizer, and the cream corn and lobster.   The service was amazing and definitely made the experience. We had Louis who was very accommodating- he answered all our questions and made great recommendations. He convinced me to try the bone marrow add on for my steak and I'm so glad I did it. I never had bone marrow and it was amazing how they prepared.   Will definitely go back if in the Las Vegas area. No complaints. The food is higher priced but you definitely get what you paid for.

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best server - Louis !

wUM1dtF2OtStdHoL9hBlXA.text: I had such an amazing Birthday Party here! It was Breakfast at Tiffany's theme so the restaurant is so perfect for it! Kirk and Stevie were amazing at helping me get everything organized and perfect! We put together a fixed menu that all 16 of my friends raved about! The summer salad and lobster deviled eggs to start. Served family style. Then 3 options for Dinner entree: The sea bass, the fillet, and the pork chop. The sides were also served family style: Mashed potatoes, Asparagus, and Lobster Mac and cheese. Everything was delicious! They even printed custom menus! I really appreciate little details like that! They let me bring in some decor for the room and custom cake and cookies! It was such a perfect night! Thank you so much xoxo

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nG9g2bQB9a6ryNLCkjlcWQ.text: Imagine Vegas in 1963 and you've pretty much got The Barrymore. It's a great throwback to the steakhouses of Frank Sinatra's days. The food was good(carpaccio, Chilean sea bass, short ribs), the drinks were flowing (bourbon on the rocks plus an extensive whiskey and wine menu) and the ambience was straight out of my Casino dreams.   The price was on the steep side, for my meager wallet at least. Dinner for two (appetizer, two entrees, shared side, two drinks each) was $200. The staff was friendly enough, albeit a bit reserved. They were of the be seen but not heard variety, when I prefer more of the Hey let me have a seat at your table and tell you about the specials variety. However, it was a beautiful place and a nice Treat Yoself meal and I'd definitely be back...after some luck at the blackjack tables.

SNQz5omUlbVWxL8yoiYrUA.text: Excellent food and a great atmosphere!  Wish that some of the pictures on Yelp was still on the menu. Would have loved to tried the steak house burger. That was the lunch menu that they stopped a year ago as well as the breakfast menu. Only dinner now! Was a bit on the expensive side! The lobster Mac and cheese was by far my favorite.

itANSNKg-_Jh9LrER0U7DA.text: This is a must visit while in vegas. Fantastic flavors, great service, quiet, and very comfortable. This is what dining should be like. Their porch seating was fantastic. The foie gras was sublime, and the duck masterful.  There is some real talent in this kitchen.   A hidden gem.

vXjK-ZWou9O1svE6N5esRw.text: Make yourself a reservation and have a pep talk with your wallet. This place is swanky. The drinks are a bit pricey for being off the strip. While sitting at the bar awaiting a table we ordered two drinks. Once our table was ready (20 minute wait) we got our bill for the bar and $30 later we were being seated. They bring you a bread basket so try not to get too full off of carbs before your meals come. As other reviews have said...order the lobster mac n cheese. Delicious! It's a great opener to your meal. I ordered the duck and my gf ordered the prime rib as a side we ordered mashed potatoes. Yummy!!! To close out our meal we ordered the creme brulee. What a delectable surprise. Either way a great meal and a must revisit.

RT8xBIkgtEKQRk2p2CM_cQ.text: This review is a bit late but came here for my sister's bachelorette party dinner! It truly is a hidden gem! The decor was glamorous, service and food was AMAZING!!!! Every dish our party ordered was absolutely DELICIOUS!! I cannot say enough about the food! On the pricey side but definitely worth EVERY penny!! I cant wait to come back to vegas just to come back to this place! The amazing service just made our experience even better! They had live music and made sure to make our bachelorette feel special with a bottle of bubbly for the table!! I'm getting hungry just remembering the food!!!! Definitely worth coming!!!

T2eBsYVoTjIp2tkNXwgG5Q.text: The Barrymore is old Las Vegas at its finest. The food is spectacular, the people are friendly and best of all the hand crafted cocktails. If you want out of the Vegas hotel restaurant scene. Then the Barrymore is the perfect choice. Friday and Saturday is live entertainment.   This is definitely not the first for the managment. You can see by the decor and the money they spent to recreate that special atmosphere. Have a awesome time and say hello to Chad the maitre D.

GbF5rtke4PU_3UBAh9eSoA.text: Amazing service! Their lobster is excellent!! Corn Lobster is my favorite!!! Little hidden treasure!

E67ut_YYBARdCjdM_oZS1A.text: Good as it gets. Cool 50's old vegas / old Miami feel.  The food was amazing.  Great service and a sweet outside patio.  I would call it a hidden gem in a lackluster hotel restaurants of vegas.  A must visit

__27pNlKe_MLYkU4vYR3KA.text: Went here with my boyfriend to celebrate our anniversary. I wanted to find an upscale restaurant that wasn't over hyped. When we arrived, it was hidden and attached to an old hotel. It didn't look as inviting as I thought until I walked inside the restaurant. It was a hidden gem! The decor was very hollywood-ish and intimate. The first thing that caught my attention was the lobster mac n cheese. The mac n cheese was not heavy at all. It was the perfect mac n cheese. Their bread basket is also out of the ordinary. Bacon and cherry bread? More please! For our entree, we got chicken risotto and grilled scallop. Everything was delicious. Would definitely come back again :)

mLNlRfphrpc88MTyxfb7Wg.text: I am so genuinely jealous while reading all these good reviews. I couldn't have had a more uninviting and pretentious experience. Upon entering the hotel it's in, it appeared as though the restaurant was closed. We almost turned around and left but the man working the front informed us otherwise. We walk in and get glared at by the worlds most unhospitable hostess and decide to sit in the lounge tables. Mind you, we're the only ones in this place. After being greeted by a server, we decide to sit in the dining room instead. Our server.... where to start. Classic jaded Las Vegas server. Explains all the specials to us and rehearses some spiel about Drew Barrymore. As I try to engage in the conversation he shifts his attention to more specials and walks away. We came with a party of 4 and ordered a bunch of apps, entrees and sides to share. However, because we ordered so much food we only got one steak. The server walks away after taking our order with a snappy comment "OK, one steak to share, for all four of you." After getting our food, everything was ok but the lobster mac and cheese which I was MOST excited to try. Guess what, not one single piece of lobster in it. I told the manager when he checked on us and said "oh that's weird, i'll take it off the check." I didn't care for it to be off the check, but expected they would send out a new one. Never did, and never bothered to take it off the check. We didn't end up saying anything, just paid our $350 check and left. I'm still confused where that money went. Definitely was not worth it.

JRG2tICot8otIa8wM245FA.text: We celebrated our anniversary last October at The Barrymore. We have eaten at many of the top named places in LV and The Barrymore served better food with excellent service. The dry aged ribeye was the best steak of my life! We will return during our next trip in May.

mMvo-6FkkUci_gHOsZwEAQ.text: Very beautiful restaurant hidden in the Royal Resort serving American cuisine.  Service was stellar, food was hit or miss.  Average Food Cost/person: $80  Recommend:   Great wine list Roasted Artichoke Macaroons  Needs work: Ordered Wagyu and was more rare than medium rare. Had to send it back.   Lobster Mac and cheese had very little lobster.   Environment:  Beautifully designed restaurant located in a 2.5 star hotel.   Service:  Very attentive.

-ok53NJ6EANSt7nOCaAO0g.text: I have been to the Barrymore twice. Once with a Groupon and once with a gift card, which was a good thing. If I had to pay full price I would have been not such a good sport. Everyone raves about this place but for me, the atmosphere is interesting but not exactly high end, the service very proper almost to the point of aloof & snotty (remember folks I went there two times, two waiters two chances at the menu) and the food is tiny. I have said it. T I N Y. Oh such small food, like we don't live in the land of plenty. Like their food is so inspired and delicious that they can charge a bazillion for a tiny bowl of mac n cheese with some seafood sprinkled in. I guess I am just irritated because I am still so hungry and my wallet is just that much emptier.

WdtvW3o4fesHJ7-D8PVA2w.text: Fab-yoooo-lus!   Beautiful hotel lobby, charming little patio, lovely bar, luxe and plush dining area.  That's just the visual feast.  Having had both lunch and dinner at The Barrymore, I can assure you the food and the service are just as lovely.  Our lunch party of 4 enjoyed every morsel of our repast.  We were seated in the smaller dining area.  Our sandwiches were accompanied by mini fry baskets filled with perfectly crisp french fries.  Apple pie for dessert had a yummy buttery crust; thoroughly delicious.  For dinner, we were seated in the main dining room, in one of the plush curved booths along the wall (so retro!  I loved it!) and were attended by two friendly and very competent waiters.  We ordered cocktails which were perfectly prepared, followed by wine service provided by the house sommelier.  He gave a good recommendation and presentation; however, we never saw him after that as the waiters did the rest of the wine-pouring for the evening.  The French onion gratin soup was quite possibly the best I have ever tasted in my life.  Diver scallops over oxtail stew were luscious.  The short rib was so tender, like buttah!  The pasta dish consisted of a generous portion of homemade pasta with a veal/beef/pork bolognese sauce and ricotta.  My husband ate the whole thing.  Pear creme brulee was True custardy deliciousness, which we enjoyed with our capuccinos.  I understand they've only been open for a couple of months which probably explains why the dining room only had 4 tables of guests that evening.  Once word gets out, though, they're going to have a line going out the Royal Resort door!

DQ5nb6_7CeerMluMcbdFMA.text: This place was really great in all aspects. The one thing I will say is that it's not directly on the strip, and it's slightly too far to walk (especially if you are all dressed up for the evening and don't want to get sweaty). But that said, it's only a five minute cab ride (or less) away, and is totally worth it.   Great food and drinks, and not too terribly expensive, you can get out of here for under $100 for two people if you really want. We ordered drinks to start, I got a bellini and the bf got the Barrymore (their version of an old fashioned) which was very smooth. We got the lobster mac and cheese for an appetizer, very yummy. Ordered sea bass and the prime steak special for entrees. The sea bass was good, but the steak was spectacular, cooked perfectly and very flavorful. And for dessert we got the warm chocolate cake, again probably some of the best I've ever had. Our waiter was very friendly and helpful, and actually recommended some of the items that ended up being our favorites. He even brought complimentary sparkling wine to have with our dessert.   Would recommend this place to anyone, great for date night or special occasions. It is small and intimate, so they recommend making reservations.

4AlPb6e-21_L1mtkPzlgPw.text: I still cannot believe how amazing this place is. DO NOT be scared away by the ugly hotel it is in. The Barrymore is one of the best restaurants I've been to. The ambience is wonderful, the staff is so warm, and the food was out of this world. Extensive wine list that has a little bit of everything. The server is great at making recommendations. Awesome cocktails...bartender definitely knows what he's doing. But the best part by far was the food. Interesting, beautiful, delicious dishes. Each thing I tried was better than the last. My favorites were the panzanella salad, NY, scallops, and lobster Mac and cheese. And you definitely have to end with the chocolate cake. The whole experience was so amazing that I had to go back again the next night for round two. From now on I will never do a Vegas trip without eating at the Barrymore at least once!

G2VJtA2qwmukhpmbH2gAww.text: I nice little small place.  Very Rat Pack decor and atmosphere.  The food was good as the pictures show and service was excellent.  I thought the food was a little too salty and $15 for martini's a little pricey.....if not for those two misses this place is a four star restaurant.

bIlYeZmg71P5y0RvunFbTA.text: Hidden restaurant in a old dumpy hotel on the strip located in the Royal Resort. However, The Barrymore serves excellent food and service. Started off with their signature cocktail...The Barrymore, and Lobster Mac & Cheese for appetizer which was excellent and creamy with big chunks of lobster meat. Then had the Short Rib Bourguignon that melted in my mouth. I'm sure I'll be back to this place!

CKYG7LLLFClO_c-bqAr0Aw.text: Barrymore is a little off the strip but amazing place to eat. It's snazzy throwback classic vegas interior and food was fantastic. Outside of the excellent quality food and moderate pricing (especially in Vegas) there was one thing that stood out above all. That was the service that we recieved. I would venture to say this was the best service I have had from any restaurant. They were friendly, funny and attentive to the tinest of details. For me this took the Barrymore to the next level. If ever in Vegas and you want fine dining and take a break from the insanity of the Strip this is the place to eat.

F4pcJuvWouzmJjlAMAc3Cw.text: Don't judge this place from the outside! We pulled up feeling a little unsure about it, but I will tell you, boy were we wrong! Absolutely beautiful place, with such a nice vibe -- along with amazing food, and wonderful service. I will definitely be back my next trip to Vegas!

4aoxOsFnStUjUr2I5r795A.text: Not only is this place amazing but the prices are great too!  We went there for breakfast and ordered the fresh fruit appetizer.  The berries were sweet, unlike other places that serve sour fruit.  The dip was delicious. I ordered the eggs benedict and it was delicious.  The service was great, very attentive staff.  The atmosphere is perfect for a dinner date or perfect for a group of friends looking to enjoy some food and wine.    I would say that this place is a must in Vegas!

2YwJZaNnmxd3nyObnKxseg.text: I really liked the ambiance of this restaurant. It has that old hollywood vibe.   My husband and I had reservations for Friday night. We got there a little early so we could have a drink in the bar- just our thing. The bar area is really small and a bit understated.  The main dining area was much more impressive.The food was great. They started us out with a nice selection of bread. We weren't tremendously hungry since we had a late afternoon snack of tuna carpaccio at a different restaurant so skipped the appetizers and salads. My husband had the filet and I had the lamb. Both were amazing! The lamb was seriously one of the best lamb dishes I have ever had.  I was a bit disappointed with the selection of sides. We ordered sauteed spinach but there was no lobster mac and cheese on the menu so we ordered the mashed potatoes. They were good, but when my husband and I are looking to indulge, we want rich crab or lobster mac and cheese. The food was definitely 4/5 star.  But to the three-star rating. Our waitress was very attentive and friendly. However, I wasn't sure if it was the sommelier or the manager that brought our wine out to us but he just had a snotty attitude. We had ordered a nice 2011 Ridge Zinfandel and when he brought it out we noticed it was a 2012 bottle. My husband said something and the sommelier/manager gave us a curt response that the 2012 was a better year anyway. He didn't reduce the price of the bottle, didn't ask if we would rather make another selection, just started opening the bottle. The wine was nice... but either way, I wasn't very impressed with the guy's attitude.

gMCDVVpfiiPgPCX1ByNEpw.text: Dear Barrymore,   I just met you last night, but I have to let you know about how I feel. At the very start of the evening you blew me away with your old-school-gone-chic-fun-and-funky vibe. Your taste in music is classic and exquisite - wooing me from the start with a soundtrack that includes Billie Holiday. From the plush velvet tuck and roll booths to the faux velvet flocked black and gold wallpaper you looked too cool for school, but your open and friendly attitude made even older folks like my husband and I totally feel welcomed.   Our server, Israel, was FANTASTIC! Although he was pretty busy hopping from table to table, he took the time to talk to us about your history, the family that started the entire Block 16 restaurant group, recommend a bottle of wine from your sexy glass encased wine cellar and even call me by first name. Super attentive and always willing to enthusiastically rave about your food.    After having a grilled octopus epiphany at Estiatorio Milos, I've been searching out other restaurants in town that have their own version.  In fact, doing a Yelp! search on "grilled octopus" is what brought me to you in the first place. The tantilizing tentacles came beautifully mounded in the center of the plate with papas bravas, topped with celery leaf and bordered with dots of spicy tomato and chorizo oil. You delectable devil you! The octopus was of a thicker cut than Milos', which made it a bit difficult to cut through, but was surprisingly soft and non-rubbery. As with all your wonderful dishes, it was a sum of its parts for sure.  Next up - your Roasted Black Cod with brandade fritter, creamed leeks and squid ink buerre. I don't know if I'm imagining things, but this seemed like you were subtly winking at me and flirting by showing off your sense of humor. Beautifully presented, each item on the plate was solid within itself - but eaten all together?  I definitely got a kind of deconstructed and elevated "fish and chips" vibe - mainly coming from the inclusion of the fritter. Oh Barrymore, you're so charming and witty.  We don't usually do dessert, but one glance at the menu we were once again seduced by your charms. Israel suggested the Creme Brulee with balsamic strawberries, basil lime sherbet and black pepper shortbread - which we went for.  Again, a sum of its parts - I wasn't sure how the basil-lime sherbet was going to work - but boy, does it ever. Acidic cool and redolent with basil up against the creamy sweetness of the brulee and the tanginess of strawberries - you've shown me how thrilling a terrific dessert can be. I'm ruined.  I'm sure you get a lot of love letters - and I don't expect to enter into a monogamous relationship or anything - but this one night stand was one for the ages. Thanks Barrymore!

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled Octopus with chorizo oil.

xUG6yU3MvesBRa0uHGE2gA.text: Initially I wasn't impressed with exterior but inside decor is rather nice. I took few friends for a steak dinner and we all loved our food. The steak was cooked to perfect medium rare, juicy and flavorful.

CGaEDZc32moaW7bs-bZGkQ.text: *sigh* Oh, how I wish The Barrymore was located in San Diego instead of Las Vegas!  I haven't been this impressed with a dining establishment since I can't remember when.    Love, love, love the old-school Hollywood decor, dim lighting, and deep, plush leather booths line the dining room. The ceiling is decorated with old film reels, the vibe is very retro-Vegas with a heavy dash of Mad Men. Although we didn't sit outside, I caught a glimpse of fireside outdoor seating off the bar area.  I admit that I had been drooling over the menu for days in anticipation of our Saturday dinner reservation. So many amazing looking choices!  The menu read like a Hollywood A-List with a high number of Oscar winners.  Instead of giving a review for each dish, I'm just going to come out and say that everything that made its way to our table and into our bellies was top of the line delicious.  Presentation, composition, flavor...these dishes had it all.   Our appetizers: Roasted Heirloom Beets (the goat cheese fritters..I die!!), Roasted Artichokes, Lobster Mac & Cheese (my personal Achilles's heel).  The Caesar Salad and French Onion Soup might possibly be the average plates delivered.  Not bad, just completely outshone by the other dishes.  Dinner: Diver Scallops, Pan Roasted "Jidori" Chicken, Short Rib Bourguignon, Muscovy Duck Confit, Bone-in Aged Ribeye.  There wasn't a stinker in the lot.  All perfectly cooked and seasoned (although I personally would prefer a tiny bit less salt, it did not necessarily taste over salted).    Excellent cocktail and wine selections, too.  The biggest star of the show had to be the service.  It was amazing.  Really was the clincher for a perfect evening.  They know what they're doing at The Barrymore.  I hope to go back again and again!

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BgvUXrMq-86aq6pGtug_dg.text: AMAZING EXPERIENCE!!! Still smiling about it.   We hosted our Wedding Reception at the Barrymore on 2/28 and did a full venue buyout. We had 110 of our closets friends and family share the day with us.  We planned this event from Nashville and chose the Barrymore based on the fantastic intimate space, menu and fellow reviewers.   FOOD:  Delicious! We had a buffet menu  of roasted chicken, filet (all of the filets were cooked to perfection), asparagus, roasted fingerling potatoes, salad, lobster mac n cheese, chocolate chip cookies and cupcakes. MY guests are still raving about the food!!!   SERVICE: The Block 16/Barrymore team were so professional and accommodating. Chastity Bebe assisted me with the planning and she answered all 200 of my emails within a business day and with a pleasant tone. I felt from day one that she personally gave a damn about the success of my event, better yet my special day.  Chastity was consistent and even attended the event to make sure it was executed to perfect.   The Restaurant GM, Sergio G. and his crew treated my guests with the utmost respect and care. The service was really beyond my expectations. The bartenders executed our signature drinks with precision. Sergio made me feel like a princess.   AMBIANCE: The restaurant is romantic and fun! The blue room, the gold room, the bar, the patio. it is such a special place.   Just go and give the Barrymore a shot! Tell them Natalie sent you!!

QY-Q6pMENNHTwW-milUYbg.text: 10 stars.  This place is so gorgeous, romantic and delicious that I chose to have my birthday dinner here, two years in a row. I'm an adventurous diner who likes to try new places, but I just couldn't resist a second go here. The first year I had short rib, the second year I had duck. Both years, my boyfriend and I had the foie gras (since foie is unfortunately illegal in California) and ended with my dessert of choice, creme brulee. Everything we've eaten has been decadent and perfect tasting.  They have great cocktails and a pretty good wine list. Service is wonderful. It's a very small restaurant, with two dining rooms - one off to the right and one past the bar. You need to come here with your significant other (not a large group, obviously) and sink into a red booth making googly eyes at each other. That's what everyone else will be doing.

RirpBEIiyotGzVSeWekMlQ.text: Went for prix fixe menu (nite be4 NYE) we ordered:  Pan Seared Foie Gras- good Catalan Style Grilled Octopus - Good Baked potato - Ok Brussel Sprouts - Ok Cream Corn & Lobster - Ok  Muscovy Duck Confit - Best, compare to other dishes. Filet Mignon 8oz- good NY Strip 14oz - asked for medium-well, it came out medium-rare. send it back, it came out little bit over cooked. Bone-in Ribeye 18oz+Foie Gras - good 2 bottles of red wine ( recommended by wine specialist ) -great selection  Overall, dining experiences was good. Very helpful/ friendly servers. Just, I had better somewhere else.

xScj-2sAWwdZ5JIPWPDMkg.text: Not sure where to start but this place deserves more that just 5 stars. I was originally in contact with the Servando, the GM of this restaurant in hopes of doing bottle service because I thought this place was more of a club atmosphere. Once I learned that it wasn't I decided to just have dinner here to celebrate my fiance's bday. Servando was amazing he nvr hesitated to assist me with all of my pre-arrival inquiries. Once we got to the restaurant, they greeted us by name & acknowledged that we were there to celebrate my fiance's bday. The staff was warm, friendly, & courteous & the food was so good. This restaurant truly exceeded all of our expectations & we will definitely be back next time we are in town.

VppPfwFIAm0DmY9Lyi7uDw.text: Good steak. Get the chilled seafood platter. Live singer with a nice voice. The venue is smaller but well done with an old Vegas feel.  I have been to Del Friscos, STK, Ruth Chris and Mortons in town and the Barrymore is as good or better,  and when comparing price Barrymore wins.

FMrSwZ5HoKWw-rv86hIvsg.text: This was our first time at The Barrymore. I found it here on Yelp of course. We shall return. The food was excellent. We ordered grilled octopus, crab claws, duck con fit, grilled asparagus, and bone in rib-eye medium rare. The Barrymore cocktail was pretty good as well.  Note: if you want a booth seating make reservations for 3 or more. If not you will be seating at a small table next to the window.

HstS5jCU6048luGyoRjLmQ.text: Fantastic spot. Off the strip. Great food. Creamed corn with lobster and bacon is a must. Salmon had the best crispy skin. The short rib was melt in your mouth.  Staff was awesome.  Definitely a great find. And so much great stuff for a great price.  Ambiance, food, hand crafted cocktails...  It was perfect!!!

Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drinks on fire!!!  All good
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wonderful staff. This is Israel!  Luis was great too!

JGjEgVgRLTRY4L9-zMXNoQ.text: Very cool place.  The atmosphere is fantastic and the staff is incredible.  Everyone knew exactly when we needed them and no one overstayed their welcome.  We started with the lobster bisque, which was a little salty in my opinion, and a little pricey at $20.  The presentation was nice; a gravy boat to poor the broth over lobster, cracker and caviar.  We had the foie, the steak tartare, roasted brussel sprouts with bacon, and a New York steak.  The steak was the clear winner.  I ordered it on the rare side of medium rare and they couldn't have done a better job.  Nice grill marks, good sear, and delicious flavor.  The brussel sprouts were good, but I have made them a little better at home myself.  The foie and steak tartare were both excellent.  In fact, my date may argue that the steak tartare was the winner for the night.  Bottom line, if you want to try something different and you want to go somewhere that's off the beaten path, The Barrymore is a great choice.

RBaVfKz7hYylP3PUlxTijQ.text: I have to say The Barrymore is a diamond in the rough. It is hard to tell, but inside the Royal Resort, sits a glorious place to dine.  Food and service were exemplary. I made a reservation and was referred to by name throughout our meal. The general manager also made a stop by my table toward the end of our meal to inquire about our dining experience. Top notch service in a beautiful restaurant with A+ food.  Instead of ordering entrees, my friend and I decided on salads and appetizers. The Barrymore does not disappoint.  Heirloom Tomato & Hearts of Palm: Pleasing to the eye, vibrant with yellow and red tomatoes and topped with burrata cheese. Flavorful and fresh, with cracked black pepper.   Pan Seared Foie Gras: An amazingly large portion of foie gras atop a small slice of bread pudding, paired with a caramelized fig. All the flavors complimented each other and is the best foie gras I have had in Las Vegas.  Lobster Mac & Cheese: A favorite, as I can tell from other Yelp reviews, and it did not disappoint. Although it was quite heavy - a demanding appetizer, make sure you share this one!   Manjari Chocolate Cake: A decadent way to end our evening, with raspberry sauce and a scoop of pistachio ice cream. Excellent.  Overall our experience here was spectacular. I would highly recommend a trip to The Barrymore to anyone.

153yiwPWvu3k9oUe0xYx0A.text: Don't judge a book by it's cover is right.  Tucked in a relatively unknown hotel off the strip, the Barrymore is a gem.   Everything is fantastic.  Lobster Mac is not heavy and very tasty.  Sea bass was excellent and melted in your mouth.  Even the drinks were great and came in sizable glasses. The whole party thoroughly enjoyed it.   Ditch the overpriced strip and try this place.  It's exceptional, even by Manhattan standards.

iOVLFuJtslBxNKdcltd1Zw.text: Spent $300 on dinner for 2, Really nice dining room, beautiful bar, warm, friendly waiter, well made cocktails and classic 'splurge-y' dinner menu that is overpriced but well executed. They under-cooked our steak, which seems to be epidemic in this town, ordering 'medium' means you're gonna get 'rare' anyway.  We ended up eating our sides while waiting for the re-fire on the steak, These things happen though and I would never judge a restaurant by a single kitchen incident. Everything was delicious.  The Barrymore is quiet and feels hidden. I'd think this would be a great place to meet someone on the down-low.  Or to take a date if you didn't want them looking around the room at other people (there aren't likely to be any) I did see some escort-looking types coming out of the hotel elevator, which makes the curious part of me want to return for happy hour, see if I was right..   In general, I really liked the place, it's one of those spots you'll feel 'in' that you know about.

uSr9XZ4ezkSYLU2IYNhGMA.text: Brought my family here because I was so impressed the last time. There's guest parking right in front of the restaurant which was super convenient. The bread basket is awesome. You'll want to fill up on the pretzel rolls. They're so good. But fight the temptation.  The highlights of my night were the cream corn and lobster side and the beef short rib. The sweetness of the cream corn paired really well with the little bites of lobster. The short rib was so juicy and tender. Fall off the bone tender. The cream corn and the mirepoix helped balance out the bold flavor from the beef. Delicious.

xiGGOFoIzRw8MP9vuyND3Q.text: My friend and I went to eat at the Barrymore last night for dinner and based on the yelp reviews I was really excited to try it.  I left our meal feeling a little disappointed.  Don't get me wrong, the food wasn't bad but it wasn't spectacular.  We order the Crispy Shrimp, Artichoke Salad, Sea Bass and Short Rib.  The shining star was the Artichokes Salad, I could have eaten 3 more.  The pretzel rolls and parmesan flar bread are amazing as well. Everything else had potential to be great but fell flat.  The shrimp was soggy and had very little sauce on it.  The bartender and waitress recommended the sea bass, which was bland and boring. I don't understand why there are so many reviews on yelp saying how good it is.  The short rib was tasty and rich but the root vegetable mirepoix was greasy and had an unpleasant flavor.  I wanted so badly to love this restaurant, they have amazing drink specials and a really nice ambiance but the food needs some work.

UBT4aLTtCB8l29sgOZW8xg.text: I chose The Barrymore after lots and lots of research for my group's "big dinner" during a bachelorette weekend in vegas. I could tell a few girls were skeptical of the location - off the strip and in a very low key hotel- but once we got inside I was blown away. Very  old school Vegas vibe. It felt very intimate and our server Daniel was very sweet to us. The steak was cooked to perfection (get the sauteed spinach it's divine) and even added a round of shots on the house after dinner. All of us girls had a great time and will definitely be returning next time.

Vf3OECqZs2HHuAxeC6a_RQ.text: Service, impeccable. Very accommodating and food was superb. True Gem in Vegas, old school 60's vintage vibe. My new favorite!

OAPWg5aZ2DnGGvrW50uZuQ.text: Love this place, it was a recommendation from my good friend and it didn't disappoint.  Chilean Sea Bass was very tasty.  NY steak was also delicious..... Highly recommend this restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. NY Strip

eg4FbITW6y-JwD5c70I4kw.text: This place is truly a hidden gem! Located off the strip behind Wynn and Encore hotel inside the Royal Resort. Once you get into this restaurant it's really cozy and classy. The staff here are super friendly and great service.   Must have are their lobster mac and cheese, brussel sprouts side, hand cut fries, and their house bread is amazing! I had the 8 oz rib eye that was more then enough for me. My bf had the 14 oz NY strip steak. The steaks were cooked just right! For dessert I had a complimentary bday dessert that I was able to choose from the menu. I chose the guava cheesecake that came with the pineapple-orange sorbet. That was probably the best cheesecake I've had! Their wine selection is quite amazing here as well!  Great place to dine in Vegas and I'm glad I've discovered it!

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Guava cheesecake with pineapple-orange sorbet
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 8 oz rib eye steak
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted Brussel sprouts with bacon

_w_yHMjBU2pw5qT_6tknrQ.text: We were in Vegas this past weekend and I did some research on some places I wanted to eat at. The Barrymore kept popping up and on our last night there, we were finally able to make it into this wonderful gem.   Located off the strip, and in a less than glamorous hotel, the Barrymore is great escape for a romantic, intimate meal. The decor is dark, classy and very intimate. It's a great date spot for sure!  Here's what we ordered:  Appetizers: Grilled Octopus ($16)- a MUST order!  Caesar Salad ($12)  Entrees: Chilean Sea Bass $(35) The best Sea Bass, I have EVER had. Outstanding!  NY Strip ($37) Steak was cooked perfectly!  Cocktails: Spring Lilly ($14) The Barrymore ($13)  Dessert: They made us a special espresso martini- so good!   They made a mistake on our entree order. My fiance had ordered the NY Strip, and I think our server had written it down wrong because she brought out a filet. When we let her know that it wasn't what we had ordered, she sincerely apologized. They brought out a shrimp cocktail appetizer in the meantime so that he could have something to eat while he waited a bit longer for his steak. The shrimp cocktail was so good! The shrimps were HUGE and fresh!   Two different managers came to our table to apologize for the mix up, which I found quite impressive. They brought us another round of drinks as well and when dessert time came, it was on the house. I was more than grateful and impressed at how they handled the situation. We weren't upset to begin with, but it definitely made all the difference in the world that they truly cared about our experience at the Barrymore.    Overall, the BEST dinner place we visited in Las Vegas. Every time we visit Vegas now, the Barrymore is a must! It's on my top list for favorite places.   They also have a great wine list. It's hard to decipher between ordering a cocktail or a bottle of wine since both options looked great!   Thank you for your outstanding service, your amazing food, and just a wonderful experience on our last night. We will most definitely be returning every time we're in town.

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert martini
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Macaroons
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. NY strip

Fm5aUZKMKjbzrio64ngDBQ.text: Wonderful atmosphere and vibe.  From the moment you arrive you feel transported back in time.  A little old Vegas with an upgrade.    The service is one of a kind and the food is delicious.   I have yet to try a dish I don't like.    I would recommend taking the time.

2pyB4S09hhRnQEIJwvWh1g.text: We so enjoyed this little gem of a restaurant off the beaten path in Las Vegas.   We enjoyed drinks in the bar before we dined for dinner.  I had the Hugh Hefner and it was delicious!   The dining area is cozy but elegant with the singer from the bar areas voice creating a romantic atmosphere.  The service was exceptional!  I had the sea bass which was flavorful, fresh and delicious!   My husband had the bone in ribeye which was to die for! The flavor was amazing and cooked to perfection.  We shared a baked potatoe with all the fixings.   For dessert we enjoyed the Sundae for 2- so yummy!!  We brought our own wine and the corking fee was 30 dollars although I don't recall seeing it on our bill.  Again, the staff was a delight - Heidi made a real impression on us.   We will most assuredly be back when in Vegas.  We had dined a a "fancy steakhouse " the night before and were so underwhelmed - it was wonderful when we had such an amazing meal and service and a restaurant not many have heard of.  I would give 5 stars but the restroom is across the hotel lobby and in heels that's a long walk.  Literally the only bad thing I can say is the bathroom location.   Do yourself a favor and check this place out.  I also saw they have a nice happy hour which we will try and make it to next time around.

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hugh Hefner cocktail- try it!
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread basket of deliciousness
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ice Cream Sundae for Two

84_udyjv4Wt3ZN0H9KPA-w.text: Okay, so I'm not really sure how this place has four stars. I came here for a work event with about 15 of my co-workers. It smelled like disgusting, salty fish the second we walked in. Yuck!   If you don't like steak or seafood, forget it. They had ONE other option for non-steak-and-seafood lovers, the free range chicken. It was a whopping $29 and I REALLY wasn't that impressed with it. The skin was kind of burnt, and the potatoes it came with were bland. I tried the tuna tartar appetizer and I wasn't feeling that, either.   This definitely should be a 3-star restaurant. They make it seem all glitzy & glamorous in the photos, but it's actually in a jenky ass hotel located way off the strip. The additional star is for the good service, they did have that on point.   Also, it's so dark in there that my older co-workers had to use a freaking flashlight to see their menus. Pathetic!   Overall, this little hole in the wall is overrated!

TkBJ4XG9laoTKn_QOxHJdA.text: I came to Barrymore for an early dinner and I'm glad I did. The restaurant is divided into two sections: each with its own vibe. The front part of it has the bar and is light and lively, the dinning area is cozy and intimate with rich colors and textures. The dinning area is small but they didn't try to pack it with tables which I really liked. That being said, make sure you make a reservation as it gets crowded very quickly.  The lobster Mac and cheese and cream corn are a must but the fillet minion was nothing special. The highlight of the meal for me was the key lime cheesecake, quite delicious!   The staff was extremely attentive to the point they were overbearing. But this was nice coming from Miami where the service isn't the greatest...

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yDhSG_BhL890z_Ev33jC7w.text: Amazing.  Amazing.  Amazing.   Super friendly service.   So romantic and elegant.  The most beautiful voiced woman sang at the bar.  Food was spectacular.  Caesar salad was great.  Lobster corn fantastic.  Fois Gras perfectly cooked.  Short ribs were fantastic.  House wine was really good.  The bartender made us the best espresso martinis.   We sat after dinner at the bar and enjoyed margaritas, again listening to the live music.    If this place was on the strip it would be packed nightly.  Worth coming here.  Don't let that its in a crappy hotel fool you.  This place is impressive.  Top notch.   Nice to have a quiet place to enjoy with your special someone in between the madness of the strip.

rrhRF-hSOwmPA1ptZ4ViEg.text: A great way of having a fabulous meal with wonderful service while feeling like you have gone back in time.  Goodness knows how many backroom deals have gone on over a perfect steak, but the place practically speaks of it! The best cocktails start a meal that is so much better than all the pompous overpriced crap you will find on the strip. Yes when you show up you will wonder why the hell you are at a run down hotel, but seconds later once you are in the restaurant it just won't matter. Hopefully the real estate never becomes so valuable that it closes for some mega resort. For now support this wonderful old Vegas restaurant!

ROTrUcIPjyDImTtA6D_8CQ.text: The Barrymore is like taking a step back into time during the days of the Rat Pack and when mobsters ran Las Vegas. It has a masculine, sophisticated feel with a touch of Hollywood seen in the golden movie reels that hang from the ceilings, and the Rorschach-esque artwork of celebrities from a previous era. All of this is located in an unsuspecting off-Strip hotel.  The menu offers an array of appetizing starters and several entrees that are familiar (roasted chicken, duck, steak), yet have their own unique touches. Even though the Muscovy Duck caught my eye, I went the "lighter" route by ordering a salad and sharing two appetizers with my friend.   Heirloom Tomato & Hearts of Palm: Basically, another take on the caprese salad with its sliced tomatoes, basil, and burrata cheese. Very good.  Pan Seared Foie Gras: By far, the best that I've tried in Vegas. The flavor of the caramelized fig complements the rich, fatty flavor of the foie gras.   Lobster Mac & Cheese: Rich, cheesy and delicious, but on the heavy side for being an appetizer.   Manjari Chocolate Cake: The single scoop of pistachio ice cream that accompanies this goes great with the chocolate and cherry custard.   Service was excellent and personable. My friend made reservations in advance and throughout the whole evening they referred to her by name. Our server did an amazing job taking care of us, even as the night became increasingly busy. The manager even stopped by each of the tables to see how everyone was doing. Really, could they go even more above and beyond in assuring guests that they're at their service?   The Barrymore provides for an intimate dining experience with delicious food, attention to detail, and first-class service. This place is truly a hidden gem.

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Mac &amp; Cheese.
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan Seared Foie Gras.

hRKo5gVLHHAKpb2rDpXlbw.text: Went last night with a group of friends, enjoyed the small private space, excellent menu choices and some unique items I rarely find around my home area.  I would highly recommended the octopus which was the best I personally have had.  I enjoyed a nice medium rare 14oz ribeye with a side of roasted bone marrow and seared foie gros.  Not something I can normally get. Service was great and martini excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States

C-bYBLwaqbhxuXs8XYKRCQ.text: Awesome food, cool atmosphere, terrible service. We had to ask three times to get a Coke we ordered, and once our food came the server didn't return to the table. We flagged down multiple other waitstaff after about 30 minutes of waiting who finally got our sever to bring the check. He didn't even apologize or seem to care that we were frustrated with the lack of service. It's a shame because this was such a great place otherwise!

UMmYLKKq1N1Hlc5gka9_9Q.text: What a surprise.   Driving up to the door with a group I thought "oh my" this is not my type of place.  But not my party and I just went in and now I have my new favorite Las Vegas restaurant.   No smoke.  No slot machines.  Just a wonderful dining experience.  Easy to hold conversations and friendly staff.  I will definitely be back next trip.

yLNqD9e5bvciEB40qrSLmA.text: A close 5 stars! Fantastic food but was pretty dark. A friend's steak came out well done when he ordered for medium rare but out of 10 people, they only messed up one so I'm brushing that criticism off. The night I went, there was a live performer and she was really good too--definitely setting up the mood.

A4Yn-sczdm6Z2UF9QE1apg.text: This was a good restaurant but nothing I'd recommend for huge groups. Something more for a quiet date.  The restaurant is located at a hotel that's off of a small street from Las Vegas blvd. It can easily be missed if you're not sure where your going. The restaurant itself is nice, but very quiet. My main dish I ordered had great flavor (the short rib). The grilled octopus however was a little bland.   The service was ok as well. It could have been a little better considering the restaurant wasn't that busy. I'd return here only if I'm looking to go on a date at a place with a non-noisy atmosphere that's somewhat secluded from other restaurants in Vegas.  Dinner 1/25/2014

isYvcxtfba2LgbE74We45g.text: One of the better steakhouses in Vegas. The service is great as well. Highly recommended it won't disappoint. Blue cheese pork chop is the bomb!!

aiAt6jetIquwJM6aY_pTVg.text: Great intimate date restaurant! The food is exquisite and perfect for a romantic date. Good drink selection

0KiN-cJQleF8yPKVdMl7VA.text: Wow! This place is top notch! Don't mind it's located in a beat down old hotel, I know it looks sketchy. Make sure you make reservations. Service, drinks, food all quality.
