uAz6VDsPCNyFjm-7P1gozw.text: My taste buds are still thanking me! Food is just spectacular! Drinks are well mixed! And the customer service is impeccable! Loved the staff and the ambience of the restaurant! Chef even came out to the table to make sure the food was good and up to our expectations. I will definitely be coming back when I visit Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A little of everything!

aVHKDXeRXjfven6C82aw8w.text: Listen,  I cant put into words of wisdom what I experienced here, all I can say is GO!  Stop reading all the reviews and just experience the place for yourself. The 5 stars is from a guy who just loves to eat great food.... I've traveled all over and have eaten at fancy restaurants without having 1/2 the experience I had at Barrymore's. The strip is loaded with big name chefs turn restaurateurs and some have succeeded and some have failed. The key to surviving in sin city is not your celebrity name, who you know and blah, blah, blah...  Taste, Quality, depth, creativity, comfort and off the hook-great service-BAM!  The Barrymore has it all-  I'm done..........exit, stage left!  JUST GO!

yFrdiDmjEC7DlG4Dmo8OSw.text: A dud.  Our waiter only appeared twice. To take our order and then at the end to deliver the bill. Never came by once to say  "how's your meal"  or  "would you like a second cocktail".  We've wanted to come here for years, and now we can tick it off the "to do" list which is a shame as we take people to Vegas several times a year and go over and over again to places like Vic and Anthony's, Lotus, DuPars and a few others. This won't be on that list.  When we were seated, it took a good time for anyone to come to the table, and eventually a very nice man came by who I am guessing was the Sommelier or bar manager came by to offer us drinks. After some time the waiter came by.  He seemed a little put off that we didn't order entrees (you know that fleeting moment where you read the expression on someone's face?), but rather, several appetizers. Maybe that's why he generally never came to our table again?  None the less, it was $140 worth of appetizers and drinks.   We had reservations, on a Saturday and showed up- the place was half-empty.  Maybe 4 tables out of the 10 were taken.  So the ignoring your table because you're so busy wasn't it.    Over-all, each of the dishes were just meh, okay.  Nothing was a standout and certainly this $140 dollar meal was worth more like at the most $40.   The bigger message is, the place seems tired. Service is always a good portion of the experience, and I don't know what's going on here, but they need to take a rest and re-group. The appetizers need a little work as well.

zgOiD3dMXmeqdUhDrdrJSg.text: When you're looking for some of the best food in Vegas, this place needs to be on your list.  Yelp's reviews steered me here, and the crowd-sourcing came through. Admittedly, it's in a peculiar location. I mean, come on. The Royal Resort of Las Vegas is hardly Steve Wynn's place, and it's not even the Marriott brothers' place. It looks like a funky smaller hotel, and that's what it is, full of Damon Runyonesque characters, hangers-on to Jay-Z, and barefoot folks sprawled on lobby couches texting away. A throwback look, with a grand piano in the lobby, too.  The restaurant, though, is absolutely lovely. Slick bar with another motley crew of characters, attractive digs, and two dining rooms. Both packed on a Monday night. Impressive, you Yelpers.  The experience could have veered toward five star territory if not for a few glitches. To the Barrymore's credit, they went out of their way to make the glitches right, which was impressive as hell. First glitch? too-low lighting in one of the dining rooms, which happened to be the one in which we were seated. Fortunately, companion's eyes work better than mine. (I have other redeeming qualities). Our waitress Kendra M. not only came with her own business card, but with an extensive knowledge of the menu and a great melange of alt-looks and serious professionalism.   Opened with two drinks between us A perfect margarita and an even more perfect vodka martini. Whatever olives they're using in the martini should be patented. That martini was spectacular.  We started with the famed mac and cheese with lobster; it lived up to its tasty billing if not being particularly chunkified in the lobster department. Fois gras tasty. Breads warm and fresh. And it looks like we're rolling, right? She gets the duck, I order the NY strip streak....and a filet mignon comes out.  Well, not only did Kendra apologize and bring both back, so the right steak could be done right and the meal served at the same time, but the maitre d' stopped by, too. We were forgiving, but they acted like it was a personal failure that they were going to repair.  And they did.  Not only were the main courses brilliant -- maybe the best steak of the last year -- but they brought us two desserts and a glass of Remy.   You gotta like that. Thanks, Kendra.   A couple of tips:  a. if the eyes are an issue, ask to be seated in the brighter dining room when you book your table. b. don't panic if there's a big group in the second dining room. Acoustics were fine; we could talk just fine c. The house zin a bit hit and miss. Probably opt for the malbec or a cab.  We're so coming back here sometime. This was a wonderful meal and a wonderful experience. It ain't cheap, but sometimes you really do get what you pay for.

9mfHyE7qL1sOdl3_dEMt4g.text: This was an unexpected surprise.  The service was impeccable and the food was fabulous.   I can not remember when I have had a better Filet cooked to perfection.   The complementary vegetables balanced the meal perfectly.  The desert was also wonderful, but had to take it to go because I was so full.  The meal was so good and reasonably price we plan to return tomorrow.

EDCy7ZGtCwLrtxdw2Ty6ow.text: I'm guessing you were led to this page because you searched for foie gras. That's how we ended up here. Overall, this is absolute crap food with crap drinks made with crap ingredients with crap service. For the same price range, just go with the tried and True and eat at Mastros or Bouchon or Craft.  Everything at Barrymore felt low class from the moment we got there. Reservation was at 9pm. We arrive at 8:55pm. Hostess tells us they're behind, but didn't fail to suggest to us 3 different times in the same breath to grab drinks at the bar while we wait. We opted to wait in the tacky hotel lobby that was trying too hard to look like SLS/Bazaar.  Seated at 9:30pm, outside. And, as it turns out, the rest of the country still smokes; and they all seem to be chainsmoking in Barrymore's patio. I asked if we could move inside, they inform me it'd take another 15-20 minutes. We suck it up and dine in smoke.   Drinks: No distinction from bottled wine coolers. Simple syrup seemed to be the key ingredient. Thoughtless and unimaginative; what you would expect from TGI Friday's happy hour (no offense, TGIF). Go with the bottled beers--at least they can't mess those up.   Artichoke appetizer: Overcooked beyond recognition--literally--we couldn't tell what the hell we were eating. Texture was so mushy it could've been mashed potatoes doused in oil. No resemblance to artichokes in any way shape or form.  Truffle lobster mac & cheese: Taste was ok, but the texture of the cheese indicated subquality product (I have a feeling it evolved from powder). Promising name; lazily executed.   Ribeye: Unremarkable.  Foie gras medallion with the steak: I blame this little piece of shit for putting us through this meal. It was not good; it tasted old and I suspect possibly previously frozen. Rubbery texture.   You know it's been a bad meal when the party skips dessert, which we did. You should skip this place altogether.

to6k6cjdJ-KF5dg63M3dIA.text: Despite some mishaps I think that The Barrymore is a fantastic restaurant.  My bf and I had reservations and came here on a Saturday night. Our server was awesome and the entire staff was really attentive the entire night.   Octopus app: 3/5 In terms of apps we tried the octopus since everyone seems to rave about it. The flavor profile was nice, I liked the aioli and the potatoes. My only issue was that the most of the octopus pieces were really chewy. Some pieces were super tender and delicious while the bigger pieces were kind of hard to eat. We let our server know and she brought out a new octopus. The second batch was a little better but it still wasn't as tender as other octopus that we had in the past. The manager kindly took the octopus off our bill which was much appreciated. I probably wouldn't order this again and go for the lobster mac & cheese instead.  Mashed potatoes: 4/5 Really solid mashed potatoes. Really creamy and smooth. Not the best I've ever had but still pretty delicious.  Sea bass: 5/5 This dish was AMAZING!!! This was our favorite dish of the night. The fish was cooked beautifully and the miso broth that it came with was delicious. I didn't care for the rice and frankly I didn't need it at all. Definitely a must have!  Short ribs: 4.5/5 The short ribs were tender, loved the sauce. The root veggies were perfectly cooked. Second favorite dish of the night.

804XsSOaHIuQd5O3bL8MLw.text: Ohhhhh Barrymore..... I haven't been here for a while, I use to come all the time and went last night cause I missed the food --- I hate to say this but I was really disappointed with my meal :(  I came here for some charred octopus and not the as good as it was, the foie appetizer was not the same, I always go for there specials cause it's always good but damn the bone in filet mignon with crab meat on the top was mediocre, and the filet wasn't tender, even the Muscat after the meal tasted it was water down :/ I always recommended this place but I don't think I will now... last night dinner spending $280 was a big disappointment.

ldHKPWSHpAz7CgkwU0aQ-Q.text: Worst dining experience of my life. Food was blah, took forever to come out. Horrible service and rude management and wayyyyy overpriced for what your getting. Basically just don't come here, you will be disappointed. I want to give this place zero star if I could.

bYJICb0dKOCMONmDpKaDeA.text: If you haven't been here yet, stop reading this review immediately and prepare to stuff your face with some classy deliciousness.  Everything i've had on the menu is just ridiculously good.  The type of good that when you take your first bite you're immediately sad because you know nothing will ever be that good again.  The rib eye is on that list.  As is the short-rib bourguignon.  The cocktails are simple and perfectly made.  The Old Fashioned here is one of the best i've ever had.    If you're still not convinced by my raving food review, then the atmosphere will do it for you.  Ron Burgundy would proud to call this place home.  The decor is upscale but simple, the waitstaff are very knowledgeable, and the management really seems to take an interest in your experience.    The location of this place is odd, in the Royal Resort, and so it's stayed somewhat hidden until lately, but this place will not stay secret for long.    You stay classy, Barrymore.

YzCviRteRtFgCUxFucDCLQ.text: I hesitate to write such a glowing review because I don't want to share the great secret that is The Barrymore.  This off the strip steak house was outstanding.  It only has 10 tables which is perfect for a quiet, old-time Vegas experience.  As soon as we sat down, our server Danny and the sommelier Bryan tool great care of us recommending a bottle of wine that was excellent and well priced.  The steak was great, and the cream corn with lobster and bacon may be my new favorite side dish!  The entire experience was pure class and unlike much of Vegas, totally lacked pretense which is a welcomed relief.  We will absolutely recommend The Barrymore to others, and stop in next time we are back.  Many thanks to Danny, Joey, Bryan and Kerry for a wonderful dining experience.

Mg4wlm1WiM6uxwNDg8KJnA.text: Had dinner here on the advice of Yelp and it worked out great.  We called late and were told that the only seating was on the patio...which it turned out was really great.  The ambiance was nice and decidedly off strip.  We split the pork chop which was very well prepared along with a caesar salad and sweet breads.  It was the perfect amount of food and set the stage for a nice evening out.  The wait staff was also very nice.

x7127nDS75SscPWigVGB3A.text: Amazing!  The minute we walked in we knew we would love this place.  Decor was beautiful, got a bit of an old Vegas feel, bartenders were so friendly and helpful, love the lounge singer.  Isreal was our server and did an outstanding job from beginning to end.  All of our food was beautiful and so delicious.  My favorite appetizers were the Sweet Breads and foie gras.  Loved the Moscow Mule drink I had before dinner.  Can't wait to go back!

mAzSJqJTfMRaR7gSgeVK5A.text: The Barrymore was a spectacular decorated restaurant oozing old school Vegas class however  the food was not spectacular.  Nothing stood out as being terrific and the meals are on the pricey side but what the hell it's Vegas.   Our bottle of red wine was served slightly chilled which I also thought was strange. The service was also a little flat. I most likely will not be coming back here.

MaToogMeIyK76eNAXjEqNw.text: This restaurant is the epitome of retro glam for sure. A group of us came in for a quick dinner before a show at the Smiths Center. None of us had a poor experience, but none of us had our minds blown either, hence the three star rating. This is only due to the prices being a bit steep for what you get. We were the first customers in the door at 5pm, and upon being seated, we did note that we had some time constraints due to our show. Surprisingly, despite being a recommended restaurant for people attending shows at the Smiths Center, they did not show any amount of urgency in getting our food out to us. The service was good, but not outstanding. As my boyfriend is a waiter that always goes above and beyond, I am a bit picky when it comes to service, so take that opinion with a grain of salt. Now for the food.   The complimentary bread basket may have been the highlight of the evening! lol  Apps:  Heirloom Tomato Salad - this was the stand out dish of the night. The tomatoes were perfect and the burrata was delicious and creamy.   Mains:   Chilean Sea Bass - the fish was cooked and seasoned to perfection, and the sauce was wonderful, but for almost $40, the portion was extremely small. The dish was served with grilled asparagus which was a bit mushy and unappetizing.  Filet - my boyfriend was not happy with this at all! While the seasoning was okay, the steak was overcooked. He ordered medium rare and received a medium cook. He also ordered the special "oscar" crab topping. It was pretty bland and not enough crab for the additional $35 dollars it cost, which was almost as much as the steak itself.   Sides:  Sauteed Mushrooms - these were very good, and the portion was very generous.   Lobster Mac n' Cheese - meh, nothing special. It was pretty bland and could have used a little texture as well.   Drinks:  We both got the Moscow Mule, these too were only okay.   Desserts: Unfortunately, because our food took so long, we did not have time for dessert.

-hyAIgQMiQjEy5_bLR_Low.text: Perhaps I am a bit biased to the Barrymore as this was the place that I had my first date with my girlfriend, and it has become pretty special to us.  We finally made our return and wanted to give a review of the place.  Ambiance: Great intimate spot, low lighting and excellent decor around the place.  Very old vegas vibe in the classiness without actually being old and having a great clean feel.  Service: Best part of this place is excellent service.  Both waiters we have had were excellent, nice conversationalists, knew their wines and were attentive without being over bearing.  The bussers were pretty quick and ready with water.  Food: The food is pretty rich, but hey, you are here to splurge a little bit.  This is American cuisine, we've had most of the seafood options when we have came so I can't really speak much past that.  Some of the best scallops I have had were served here.  Next time I hope to get the famous Lobster Mac and Cheese.  Though it has the classics there are some adventurous items like Veal Sweetbreads, Muscovy Duck, and fish that we don't always see here.  Give it a go!

W1hK42ZloyaA3LZBuWsuJw.text: I really wanted to like this place. During our 3-night stay in Vegas, my husband and I planned one romantic pricy restaurant night, to get away from the craziness of the strip and the casinos. We chose the Barrymore because the menu looked amazing and the restaurant was highly rated.   The food was indeed fantastic and I would give the Barrymore 5 stars for just the food. Unfortunately, the service was terrible. When we arrived, there was just one other couple finishing up their meal in the restaurant. We ordered our food and wine and while the wine arrived very quickly, the bread took quite a long time. In the meantime, three other large tables were seated, asked for their orders, and were brought bread. Odd, but this is not the reason for by 2 star review. Before moving on, though, I just wanted to mention that one of the breads that they serve has bacon in it. If you're a vegetarian, watch out!  Later, the lobster macaroni and cheese appetizer arrived and was amazing. The problems were entirely in the service of the entrees. My husband ordered a special, and I ordered salmon. Upon ordering, the waiter misheard "salmon" and asked if I said "same." I told him that I actually said salmon, and, writing my order down, he reiterated "salmon." What came out an hour later were two of the specials. Not a big deal - we told them that my order was actually the salmon, and the waiter unapologetically whisked my meal away.   For the next thirty minutes, I watched my husband eat his entree as I sat eating nothing. Now, I'm not in the restaurant business and I'm not sure what the protocol is for an incorrect entree, but I don't think the right thing to do is to leave one person (out of a couple!) with no food, while the other is awkwardly forced to eat his food alone so it doesn't get cold. I took a bite of my husband's dish, and it was delicious, but it was his meal and I was still waiting for mine so I just sat there, staring at my forks, as he uncomfortably ate his meal. Waiters and waitresses passed us and no one seemed to think that this dynamic was odd.   The cherry on top was when our bill arrived: the restaurant attempted to charge us for two of the specials instead of one special and one salmon. The price difference between the special and the salmon was $15. I pointed this out to the waiter and he very unapologetically said that this was the check for what he thought we ordered. I was actually expecting them to perhaps discount my entree or maybe provide a free dessert as an apology for the awkward meal due to my incorrect entree, but instead they tried to charge me $15 more for my meal!  This restaurant is quite expensive, and we were spending quite a chunk of change on a full meal with a bottle of wine. In exchange, what we hoped for was a pleasant meal that we could share together. Unfortunately, the Barrymore did not deliver.

kQNxSp9KamaQCwjTzDyzsw.text: We found this on Yelp and we are very pleased with the experience.  When we came in, a large group was seated at the same time. Since we only could see two waiters, we were concerned that we have to wait a long time. I expressed this to our waiter. (Yes, I am one of these people who annoy everybody). The waiter assured us that this will not be a problem. And - it was great. I was very impressed how fast and good they handled all the tables at the same time.   The food was excellent. Everybody on our table was pleased with the taste and the perfect temperature of our steaks. The prices for this type of food are reasonable.  This is definitely a place we will visit more often when we come to town!

Vjh7amC0OGxGvbyboR3-ZA.text: Outstanding! Out of the way (we had to tell the cab driver where it was) but so worth it! Unbelievable filet, delicious seared ahi, and a wonderful heirloom tomato appetizer. Everything made to perfection! Wonderful service, beautiful room with great ambiance. You WON'T be disappointed.

UhgMIm0RcbQR0hqO4B3LZA.text: What a great find!  If you plan to travel to Las Vegas, do not miss visiting The Barrymore.  Without a doubt, it was the best meal we had in Las Vegas (after dining at numerous high end spots in The Palazzo and the Venician).  Service was attentive and friendly and the food absolutely delicious at 1/3 the cost of the fancier spots on the Strip.  The setting (a bit campy in the Royal Resort) only adds to the allure of the restaurant.  My husband had the burger and I had the short ribs and both were superb.

RZZbBbWEWFGytB8WesppPQ.text: Excellent, it was definitely a lovely experience. The chef had a special that night for some sort of artichoke and risotto dish that was, hands down, THE BEST THING ever!!  It will be on my list of favorite dishes forever!!!  Very beautiful and peaceful/quiet ambiance and we had great service.  I would like to go back :)

9w4vU_Nf6g4lEdObFfvWCw.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants in Vegas... Great atmosphere...great food (grilled octopus and rib eye for two are two of my faves!) - great wine list! You must come here for dinner!!

ZRkc4OwphMZaCHJP7V3CoQ.text: THE BARRYMORE - A BIT OF OLD LAS VEGAS The Barrymore restaurant doesn't do any formal advertising. They don't have to. The food, the ambiance, the sincere interest demonstrated by reservations, wait staff, manager, and chef alike, make your dining experience a warmly personal and gastronomically delightful event and together create a charismatic memory that is unforgettable. The Barrymore is a little off the beaten path, located inside the Royal Resort at 99 Convention Center Drive,  North Las Vegas. Neither the geographical area nor the resort per se has any of the gaudy glitz or the excited roar of the Strip. But with a single step inside the doors of the restaurant, you feel the intrigue of LV's theatrical history and the luxury of its star-studded past come to life.  Dimly and tastefully lit, you are ushered past a cozily inviting and friendly bar area into the dining room itself.  There are six large curved booths, three on either side of the dining room, and four square tables down the center of the room, for a total of 40 or so patrons maximum at a time. Sink into the comfort of a cushiony booth seat and look up. The ceiling is a sea of large, empty, metal film reels that lie shoulder to shoulder and cover the expanse completely. Some of the walls look like they're papered with a richly flocked pattern, and on these walls are hung framed black and white pictures of famed Hollywood stars done in a manner reminiscent of Rorschach ink blots. The walls behind the booths feature side-by-side-by-side octagonal porthole-style mirrors. The atmosphere is romantic and intimate. The sounds of the likes of Sinatra provide a gentle and nostalgic backdrop.  The drink menu is large and varied, although there are not so many wines offered by the glass as some might wish to see, a fact that we noted while we were researching The Barrymore online from home prior to making reservations there through Open Table.  Although we are typically cab or merlot drinkers, we were attracted to an Italian Chianti that was offered both by the bottle AND by the glass.  Once at the restaurant, however, we couldn't find the Chianti on the single glass wine list at all, and asked our server about it. She went to great lengths to find the answer for us, and it finally turned out that the online menu hadn't been revised that season, although the in-store one had, and the by-the-glass feature for that particular wine had been deleted. The manager himself, Mr. Chad Jahn, came to our table to apologize and to let us know that the error in the online drink menu had already been corrected. Shortly after our main courses of deep sea scallops and halibut arrived, Chad and the chef, Francisco Campa, came again to the table to ask how we were enjoying our meals.  Breaking here to describe our dinners. There was a small relish tray brought to the table, as well as a basket of breads.  The latter consisted of two pieces of parmesan flat bread, some epi (a dry, braided, unsweetened crusty bread with a soft center), and two sweet rolls. All were sampled and all were awesome! The scallop plate ($29) had three large sea scallops, some seasoned green beans that had been roasted, and risotto in squid ink. The veggies and risotto were a delight. The scallops were delicious although the seasoning on top was a bit too salty for my taste. The halibut plate ($27) consisted of a nice piece of fish, about 4-5" long and 1.5 - 2" thick, a block of potatoes au gratin, and green beans pesto. Both plates were artfully arranged and visually appetizing. The service was impeccable. The concern of the manager and the chef relative to the quality of our dining experience was refreshing and I believe genuine.  The prices were very fair considering the uniqueness of the restaurant itself, the quality of the food, the personal service, and the fact that one will pay considerably more anywhere else on the Strip for a lesser but similar dinner experience.  In short, The Barrymore should be on YOUR list of "must do's" when in Las Vegas. It's a definite winner and that's a sure bet!

RFC8KjnTJ887gBw-Kd9S6g.text: I went to the Barrymore for dinner with my best friend the other night and besides us having fun, on a girls night out the food was delicious and we had great service! I gave already told my girlfriends that be t girls night out, we have to go there!! So much fun!

cicsfX6D2Z3bVk41AYt3Pw.text: Love this place!  Creative chef, fabulous service and over the top ambiance.  In a sea of overpriced, big hotel, big name chef corporate food, The Barrymore emerges with amazing food and I just had the burger.  It was a taste sensation with the bacon marmalade stealing the show.  Oh yes, the bacon infused bread deserves a mention too.  With wines 50 and Under, you can't go wrong.  If they have room, I'll have dinner for 25 here for my 50th!

p1QXQdvXRSHwURVz2hJYFw.text: Service was excellent, loved the atmosphere and every bite was amazing.  My steak was so tender I didn't even know it was possible!  I would highly recommend!

8muzm0-1SLHyDpGyVAcOSg.text: This restaurant is absolutely gorgeous. It's randomly located in an older hotel located right off of the strip. It almost has a speak-easy feel to it.. really cool. For the most part, the food is good. Appetizers were tasty and cooked perfectly. Our party got the shrimp cocktail, lobster mac and cheese, rock shrimp and the grilled octopus. All really amazing. Where the restaurant was lacking was the service and the quality of the entrees. Our steaks and fish were overly seasoned with salt, it almost rendered it inedible. We would have said something or perhaps sent it back if it didn't take an hour for our entrees to come out after we had finished appetizers. I've been to this place twice, and both times had an issue with the timing of the entrees coming out at a reasonable time. It's a shame because for the price, you want to be able to enjoy eating all of your food, but waiting for that long you begin to get full and lose your appetite from the appetizers expanding in your stomach:( The service was ridiculous. We had about 4-5 servers and all seemed to be on different pages. You'd think with that much help, that things would run a bit smoother than it did. And when we asked how much longer our entrees would take (this is at 40 minutes after our appetizers were removed), we got shot back with an attitude. Not ok at all. I've worked in the service industry for seven years, and it was very hard to keep my blood from boiling over when we were treated this way, especially since our check total came out to more than $1000! Overall, our dinner took a little over 3 hours, when it should have been over in 2. By the end of it all, we were absolutely exhausted and instead of going out to enjoy the night, we all were just ready to go home. Any-who, with that being said, I sadly will not be returning to this establishment. First time shame on you, second time shame on me. It is truly a shame because it really is a beautiful restaurant.

NmERSPN4gqGGyz4swOwMzQ.text: Im divided between a 4 stars and a 5 star.  I went with a party and i got a steak.  The $65 ribeye for 2 ppl.  The steak itself was OK.  I had better and I dont think its USDA prime.  I believe its USDA choice.  It was overcooked and I did let the waiters know and I was offered a replacement.  GIven I was with a party, I didnt want to hold up everyone so i ate it and they gave me a very small cheesecake as a replacement.  The steak itself (besides the overcooked part) was alright.  Nothing out of the ball park.  for $65 for 2 ppl servings (I shared with a friend), I expected a little bit more.  More like USDA Prime meat quality.    They steak sauce is AMAZING! You should get the hordnaise sauce, im not spelling it right.  They have their Barrymore sauce too.  Friend had the VEGGIE CURRY.  Dont order, its blend and not tasty.  Other friend ordered New York steak i believe, its the other one.  Its alright too.  BUT,  they have AWESOME service! Totally a place to bring a date! Ambiance is awesome, small and cozy.  Waiter is attentive.  They CLEAN your table after you eat and take plates right away.  Take bread crumbs away and very attentive.    Given the price, service and quality, I feel that 4 stars is what this restauant gets.  COme here for a good time, but not awesome food!

jm3ERl6e_96mZFCdESUY_A.text: Ok, second time coming here and I have to say its just amazing.  Been to many places and mostly overhyped celebrity places on the strip.  The service is amazing and friendly which is hardly found on the strip.  Every dish I've ever had is amazing, especially the creamed corn/lobster and bacon  and the braised short ribs!  Had the ribeye this time and it was cooked perfect!  Atmosphere is great, and every employee including the Manager is professional welcoming.  What i like is that most people eating here come dressed decent and not the usual Vegas casual attire.  One thing I hate is going to a so called upscale place on the strip and seeing people in Jeans and a designer T-shirt.  I just hope The Barrymore upholds everything they currently due and does not fall into the habit of changing for the masses or the "at the moment" trends so often found in this town!!  If I had to give one suggestion it would be keep the blinds closed until sundown.  First time I went was in the winter so it was already dark and the view was nice with the torches and city lights.  But this time was last week around 6:30 and it was still light out, sat by the window and had to look out onto the street and buildings.  But other than that minor thing this is my one of my top 2-3 places to dine in Vegas!!!

MRJaexfRn5A8yC7iIzUIug.text: I was looking for a perfect restaurant for a romantic evening and the Barrymore was everything I wanted! Off the Strip, so you don't have to fight traffic to get there. Quiet, so you can have a romantic dinner without shouting to hear each other. The food - excellent! I would DEFINITELY go there again! GREAT place to take that special someone!

3fEfkha_YzDH7AlPZ0wzww.text: The Barrymore was so fantastic, I had to renew my Yelp account just to let everyone know about it!  It's def off the beaten path and you will be skeptical when you see the hotel it's in and the location (as I was), but the restaurant is amazing!  Perfectly prepared food and portions, stunningly beautiful and elegant decor, fabulous service...it was a 5-star dinner all around!  I had the filet mignon and mushrooms, and my hubby had the diver scallops - both dishes were superb.  We also had the squash curry dish as an appetizer (although it's an entree) and it was very delicious - would be a great entree for a vegetarian.  Prices were good too, especially compared with the 5-star restos on the Strip.  We will definitely dine at The Barrymore any time we are in Vegas again!

V9M4hVtdtEuH7TmTkEjXsw.text: Perhaps their food is good. Unfortunately we didn't get that far. My family and I were looking for a place in Vegas to celebrate my Dad's 60th b-day. It was a bit last moment, and we wanted a classy looking place that could accomodate 8 people for dinner at a short notice. Most places of that nature were already booked until finally we found Barrymore, reviews looked good, and the location really is very close to the Strip. We made multiple phone calls there to assure the reservation and ask any relevant questions. The service we received before even ordering food was so ridiculously bad, I am not sure folks there realize just how easily a reputation of a restaurant could be ruined by a couple of bad reviews. Perhaps, it was just a really bad shift manager, so I don't want to necessarily criticize the whole establishment. But let me just mention the facts1)We had certain liquor preferences and asked them about a corkage fee. On the phone they said it would be $30, which would have been fine. When we came and asked them to open our bottle, they said they have no license to serve liquor (even though there was definitely wine on the menu and hard liquor at the bar), but it wasn't "an issue $100 wouldn't fix". 2) They were quite rude to my mother who asked about some special dietary accomodations for our elderly guests. As the manager was responding, he actually took a swig of vodka in front of her. 3) We decided to leave (having no back up plans and having the b-day ruined), the manager chased us out, cursed out my whole party (including the f*** word), and asked a bunch of well dressed respectable people to never come again (and this in front of all the other patrons). It was especially embarassing because all of us were from out of town, had no cars, and had to just stand out in the dark and cold on an iffy plaza trying to arrange rides. So, definitely think twice before making any special plans at this place until and unless the management changes.

T89114TT6hlKUrvNYDVuPA.text: I came to the Barrymore for my 1-year anniversary while in Vegas. I love that it is off of the strip, intimate, cozy, and special. The food was amazing - especially the lobster mac and cheese appetizer. The ambiance was perfect. Service was outstanding. Drinks were great and a good price.

JC1E3IFbCgKloeWMoAv2tg.text: My buddy and I arrived early and had an hour to kill before our Saturday night reservation. We had a seat in the lounge area and decided to have some appetizers and cocktails. The waiter was very knowledgeable about the wines and the drinks.  The special app of the night was Frogs Legs, which I hadn't eaten in years. I ordered us up an order of those and the Lobster Deviled Eggs. The Deviled eggs were very rich with the truffle oil and caviar topping and had that touch of lobster flavor from the diced up pieces of meat in them, but didn't overpower the eggs. Awesome!! The Frogs Legs came out and were fall off the bone tender and highly flavored. My buddy had never eaten them before and was a bit shy about trying them but did and loved them also. Killer app. We were seated for dinner afterwards and ordered 3 more apps to share.....the veal loin with tuna sauce, the roasted artichoke, and the beef tartare..........all incredibly delicious!! Very impressive. I ordered the lamb rack medium rare, and my buddy ordered the special bone in cowboy ribeye medium. My rack was perfectly cooked and melt in your mouth tender. My buddy's steak was more towards Medium rare/rare, which to him was  a bit of a turn off. We sent it back and it still came out rarer than requested. Funny, as I recall seeing multiple complaints on websites about undercooked meat.  If it was me, I'd have eaten it but then again, that's my preferred way to eat a steak. I tried his and it was sublime. The waiter was annoyed at the kitchen for his steak misstep, but was very attentive , knowledgeable, and nice. Overall, the atmosphere was great. Staying on the strip on a Saturday night in the Cosmopolitan was absolutely insane busy, and so were their restaurants. It was terrific to be able to have a meal where it you could actually have a conversation and not be at all rushed, in such a tranquil atmosphere. Their pricing is also a bargain when compared to the hotel restaurants also.  Go there with confidence that you will have a memorable meal and mention to the waiter to make sure your steak needs to be medium, if you like it that way, or the chef will err to the underdone side. Awesome restaurant and atmosphere and food to die for made for a memorable evening.

ohJo8sJuYH2pYS0Kji6lKQ.text: One of the best restaurants in the city.  Staff is excellent, food is excellent, ambiance is awesome.  The place has an old school feel and is small and intimate.  Great wine list and very helpful sommelier.

OmyJRbUNPwh-QAAJsms61A.text: This sexy old school intimate restaurant is a diamond in the rough. The food and service is amazing! If you are looking for classy "old Vegas" type ambiance- this is the place!

7MUR4Fl_uuZWnSXIsRpcAg.text: The yelpers were right. This place was the gem of strip and the find of the trip!

RKD_3yVVhz1CAT39gCdKCg.text: I found this restaurant on Yelp and was excited with such great reviews.  We called and they were booked.  We asked them to give us a call if they got a cancellation and they called with a 730 available time.  They were very pleasant.  We arrived and and had a drink at the bar were seated fairly promptly.  Restaurant had nice atmosphere.    We began with the lobster deviled eggs.  They were definately fresh good for deviled eggs but if lobster wasn't in the name I would not have guessed there was lobster in the dish.    I had the chopped salad and my husband had the dinner salad with balsalmic dressing.  Both were fresh, mine had good flavors.  For our main course I had the lobster mac and cheese (the appetizer left me wanting more lobster) and my husband had the the Hangar Steak.  Mine wasn't at all special not even great for mac and cheese and again minimal lobster and no significant lobster flavor.  My husband really didn't like his steak and although small didn't finish the dish.  Really said the flavor was off.    The waiter recognized my husband didn't enjoy the flavor and was very apologetic.  Although my husband would not have sent it back no one really came by to check if everything was ok until it would have been too late anyway.    The waiter did comp the dessert because of my husbands dislike of his dish and was very eagar to make it right.  My husband ordered the molten lava cake and this was really dry without any real "molten" center.  I don't like to write bad review but this restaurant is way over rated in my opinion.  The staff was very pleasant but they could not make up for the poor flavors in the food.    We will not return.

CqUwW4aeOBaFmQXiQtTtlQ.text: I was SO excited to try this place with all the great reviews but I was not that impressed.. This is kind of a late review because we came here like a year ago so I don't know if anything has changed..   We came in for lunch.. maybe that was the mistake? We didn't even get to sit in the pretty main dining room nor did we get that delicious bread basket everyone had mentioned. Even the server wasn't that attentive.. good thing the busser was.   Anyways we had the french onion soup which is pretty hard to mess up.   The burger was good but it wasn't "THE BEST BURGER" I've ever had... From what I heard.. they don't even serve this burger anymore.   We also had the chicken lunch entre and that was horrible. We both couldn't have more than a couple bites of it.   So maybe we will come back again for dinner or try out the Happy Hour on their patio but definitely won't be coming back for lunch.

PeYV7ZGgm--l-xZaSlyuiA.text: Very nice restaurant with high end steak.  Superior to most of the restaurants on the strip.  Fantastic service with a great ambiance.  Love the movie reels and would definitely come back.

FspPoxBoUz1G6Z5eI5fT9A.text: It was my second time here and was even better than I remembered.  The staff is amazing and the food even better.  It truly is a little gem that is tucked away.  It's a treat for locals and I would definitely bring out of town guests here to impress them.  I recommend The Curtain Call cocktail!

yadYlLHkRb3vRDIkpbJcbQ.text: Excellent steaks and seafood off the beaten path. The ambiance alone is great and classic , you see then we get to the food. 18 ounce rib eye with your choice of fixins' they have a special surf surf and surf for 75 bucks 3 jumbo tiger shrimp , lobster tail And nice size chillean sea bass all over a risotto.  Must try Cream corn with lobster Roasted Brussels sprouts in bacon 18oz rib eye

w9AwLAhD3bWAFW-13x8aQg.text: We hosted our company holiday party at The Barrymore.  With a total restaurant buy out, it was the perfect blend of cozy but large enough that 85 people could mingle and eat.  We have growing potential and we would definitely come back again.  The wait staff and bartenders were extremely attentive and never let a drink or appetizer be empty.  The food was delicious and the presentations were amazing.  The decor was unique and retro.  The outdoor patio was perfect with warmers for a December evening.  Parking was plentiful and free. The only "con" I can come up with is that the restrooms were in the main hotel portion.

XtyAGAF6n9V73weNvxLK5A.text: Is the best! Love it. Bordalaise sauce (spelling?) is a must with the ribeye. The Barrymore cocktail will get u there quickly.

c4GmPsLt_cdEKeWZij59ew.text: Visited with my fiance on our last night in Vegas and had a great time. Off the beaten path so had to Uber over which was a slight inconvenience but ended up being for the better because the place wasn't packed wall to wall with people. Our waiter, Daniel, was stellar and we had constant attention from servers, sommelier, and management. We had a friend make our reservation here for us and unbeknownst to us he had ordered a bottle of wine for us for when we arrived. The wine was at the recommendation of the sommelier with no direction as to what wine we like besides 'red'. We were presented with the Yangarra grenache which we both enjoyed, thumbs up to the sommelier for that one. Another thing I love is that they had a dedicated scotch list on the back end of their drink menu. Too many places only list their wine and cocktails so it's nice to see the full scotch list, especially when there's multiple selections. Now, for the food.  Appetizer: bread is complimentary and the pretzel rolls are awesome. We ended up getting the bone marrow for an appetizer to share. I'm a huge fan of bone marrow but it's something Ashley is still getting accustomed to. She said the Barrymore provided her with her favorite bone marrow so far and I love it as well. Wish it would have come with slightly more bread but we still had some complimentary rolls left over so it worked out fine.   Entrees: Being that it is a steakhouse I went with the filet mignon. Ashley doesn't eat steak so she was already hesitant coming here but got the salmon and had good things to say about it. Ordered the filet medium rare and it was prepared PERFECTLY. Steak was seasoned well but not too much so another thumbs up in my book. I usually avoid steaks when at restaurants because I can be a bit of a snob and don't always feel a restaurant is fair to judge based on their steaks if that's not their flagship menu item. Barrymore delivered me a great cut of meat, prepared wonderfully, and it didn't kill my wallet either. Other restaurants on the strip would charge 50% more for a steak of that caliber.   Sides: Ashley went with the brussel sprouts and I had the cream corn and lobster. Being an Iowan, it's not often I get lobster in my corn but it was great. Ashley raved about her brussel sprouts and the few I tried we're good, although I'm not a brussel sprout guy.  Dessert: opted for a less traditional dessert and went with the Taylor Fladgate Century flight. Originally I had tried to order the Taylor Fladgate 30 year but the server directed me towards the century flight as, although a slight upsell, was much better value all things considered. It was great to get to compare the different generations of port and obviously something you don't see everywhere. Really enjoyed it and appreciate Daniel taking the time to explain that to me and recommend it.   We had a great time and the food was wonderful as well. Too often when Ashley and I dine out at fancier places it sometimes seems we aren't a priority due to our age (20's) with the service staff. This couldn't have been further from our experience with The Barrymore and we were left with a 5 star experience. Thanks again!

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary macarons with the bill.
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Taylor Fladgate Century flight.
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creamed Corn with Lobster

bT1tUtbgSiBZ4n56FcjqBw.text: I had a group of 9 coming in for a birthday dinner, so I worked with Stevie and arranged for a pre fixe menu and ordered a cake for the party.  Stevie was wonderful - very friendly and attentive. The restaurant was lovely, but that's about where it ends for me.  Where the group was seated,seemed to be just outside the kitchen and there was a VERY strong (overpowering) fish smell. The service was "ok" but not very friendly, and definitely  "no special attention" was given.  The food was not prepared well. Many in the group ordered steaks and requested them medium, medium well or well. Almost everyone of them came out very undercooked. Mine was raw/ rubbery on the inside and I had to send it back, as did a few others. The cake was BEAUTIFUL -  looked exactly like what I had requested, but even that didn't have a great taste. It was ok, but I really expected more for a $150.00 8 inch cake. I really had high hopes for this dinner, but honestly left very disappointed and sad. I wanted to give my husband a memorable birthday dinner, but it left a LOT to be desired.

7DUN661vGcapyb3ks_mQuw.text: Very good service very good food! The dressing on the Cesar salad was delicious and the mashed potatoes were so creamy and the steak was perfectly cooked!

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary macaroons at the end
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qGu0mNSjd7xYDMO-JTJCqQ.text: 2 stars= food 1 star= service  One of those places where first impressions are everything.....the Barrymore FAILED, miserably.   A reservation was made far in advance for a birthday dinner, and was reinforced with the hostess upon arrival but no attention was taken to it after that. We were also completely IGNORED during our meal by our server and the manager that was trolling the dining room. So here goes...  Happy hour at the Barrymore includes bottles of wine, so we bought one because the bartender was not hospitable to offer a cocktail. The hostess wished me a happy birthday and guided us to a plush booth in a room of 3 parties of guests = a total of 10 guests in the dining room, including us. It was romantic and inviting.  Once we were seated, the waiter arrived and noticed we already had a bottle of wine, picked up the bottle and stated, "Oh I see you have wine already, you must have gotten here for happy hour."  I was a little taken aback by his comment, but I let it go. He suggested some appetizers (the two most expensive ones), announced the specials, and offered sparkling or still water. He never offered another bottle of wine, mind you our bottle was 3/4 empty by now. A couple of minutes passed and a female server arrived with bottled water: glass bottle of Evian, nice ($9-nice we later found out).   Another 10 MINUTES passed, while watching our server walk back and forth pass us, in addition to a suited man strolling the dining room, then our server returned to take our order. By this time, we were ready to order everything, appetizer and dinner, so we did. We decided on the octopus that came recommended, and I chose the salmon entree. Noted in the menu as "pan-fried with crispy skin," the waiter warned me that the Barrymore cooks their salmon to "medium" and I was fine with that, in fact, I prefer it (I was later disappointed). The other entree we ordered was the squash curry. The waiter tried to upsell it by asking if we wanted to add shrimp or lobster. I didn't see that option in the menu anywhere, but whatever. We also opted for the creamed corn w/ lobster side dish, as recommended. I asked for bread before he left. Again, no attention taken to our now empty wine bottle or if we wanted more.   A few minutes later, the same female busser? arrived with bread and butter. During this time, I noticed the suited man again strolling the dining room and watching each table. He didn't seem to engage very much or engage with anyone. He stopped at our table earlier and noticed our wine had not been poured for us, so he graciously refilled our glasses and left the empty bottle on the table without any conversation. WEIRD. The octopus appetizer was delivered to the table by our server and he announced what it was then left. Again, NO OFFERING OF MORE WINE OR DRINKS. The octopus appetizer was excellent. Octopus wasn't chewy at all, perfectly grilled and the vegetables were very tasty. We thoroughly enjoyed the appetizer, every last bit of it without any attention from our waiter. He never returned to see how it was or if we were satisfied. He did manage to bus the empty plate. The female busser? again returned and cleaned up our table, then reset it for dinner.   After about 5-7 minutes, it was quick, dinner arrives and is brought to the table by the female who I am now sure was just a food runner. She was by far, the best person working there and I can't understand why she wasn't waiting tables. To recap, two more tables arrived during our dining period but one table also left leaving a total of 5 tables and now 14 guests in the dining room for our server. As we enjoyed our meal, I started to notice that the salmon was NOT cooked to medium, as previously announced. In fact, it was so dry that I had to spoon the sauce from the other meal we ordered in order to make it appetizing. The vegetables that accompanied the salmon were excellent and full of flavor; lots of colorful baby carrots and potatoes. The squash curry was good but REALLY lacked salt, it was very one-dimensional, and the vegetables were so finely diced that they resembled something you would use for a breakfast hash. It was also missing couscous. For $25, my salmon was oily and overcooked (and farm-raised at that); while for $22, the squash curry was disinteresting and unpleasant to look at. We completely finished our meal and were NEVER checked on by our server or the manager. Where does that happen? and why??  We were so unsatisfied that we had to bring it to the attention of the house and had a chat with the manager. He apologized and blamed it on the 20-person party they had on the cocktail patio. I didn't understand that or accept it. He offered dessert, I wasn't interested. He did comp our appetizer from the bill but I still feel it wasn't enough. We came for a special occasion and it was bad. We weren't treated with care or hospitality. The Barrymore left me bewildered. I won't be giving it a second chance or recommending it

A_sBAKSN-9uIZx99HEws9Q.text: Excellent meal. Great service. Beautiful restaurant.   I came here with a party of four and we all had a great time. Of what we ordered, I tried:  Seafood Appetizer Platter Bone in Rib-Eye Curried Squash Steak Tartare Mashed Potatoes Asparagus  Roasted Mushrooms  The appetizer platter included muscles, oysters, jumbo shrimp, crab legs, and lobster tail. The entire selection was chilled and deliciously fresh.   My husband ordered the Bone In Ribeye medium rare. The steak was cooked perfectly and the seasoning was excellent. Based on the excellent reviews, I was planning to order the Short Rib, but the Curried Squash caught my eye and I opted for it instead. It did not disappoint!  Next time I plan to try the Short Ribs. My girlfriend ordered the Steak Tartare as her entree. I had a couple tastes of it and it was good, though I'm generally not a fan. The portion was huge and she commented that there was so much of it she kinda got tired of eating it.  We concluded this was because, as an appetizer, it was probably meant to share.   Of the sides, the Roasted Mushrooms were definitely the star. The Mashed Potatoes were creamy and tasted great. The asparagus was pretty standard.   For dessert I had a very yummy Moscow Mule! It came in the most adorable mug.   A couple notes...Wednesday features a very talented lounge singer which is super fun. The wine list here is outstanding so, if you are a fan of upscale vino, this is your spot.  At about $100 per person, the menu may seem pricey to some especially given the location of this restaurant. In my opinion, you are getting what you pay for in terms of food quality, service, and ambiance.   Can't wait to return!

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Moscow Mule.

eeP0DUURA5jo2BQ6mQjlXw.text: A great experience for all in this hidden gem. Start with the seafood sampler or the pan fried Foie gras. Awesome. Then we all went with rib eyes or other steaks. Perfect!  With bleu cheese or Oscar style. I had the foie gras topping. Wow! Get sides to share!  Lobster Mac, poutine, Brussel sprouts... yum.  The atmosphere is classy but warm and friendly. 1940s style. You just can't beat it.

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Perfect apps
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cool ceiling
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Poutine

oGxYSkUeJ724SQbKaZWd7Q.text: This place is awesome.  Old school meets modern with incredible food and ambiance.   Wife and I found it online and decided to try it for our anniversary.   It did not disappoint.   Luis was our waiter and he is fantastic, right recommendation,  history and timing.  Drinks are made from scratch and maintains the original.  This is a completely different place than the original Barrymores, but maintains the authenticity of what that one was like.  Everything we ate melted In our mouths.  A must while in Vegas or just passing through.  We will be back next year for our next anniversary dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great old school feel.  Just like original
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet with king crab, asparagus and hollandaise sauce backed on top.

JfdlQUYX2_mGMHiV0hOp7A.text: I wish I could give this a 5+. First, the atmosphere is classic. Very upscale. Kind of a Frank Sinatra elegance. The bread was great! One of the varieties was a pretzel bread that was warm and fresh. Unusual and done right. We had the bone-in filet steak and we shared it. It melted in our mouths. We also had the mashed potatoes which were pureed with a lot of flavor. Their wine list is extensive and they had a wine advisor available to help with your selection. We left feeling satisfied without being overstuffed. It was the right amount of food with great flavor, so larger servings aren't always better. Wonderful experience

fuxLEid1IKVS2KmLaDLlNg.text: This restaurant is indeed a hidden gem, and I am so pleased to have finally discovered it. The Royal is nothing to look at from the outside, but when you step inside- wow! The lobby is whimsical and quirky, with a multicolored piano and a shuffleboard table.  When you open the door to the Barrymore, prepare to be even further amazed. It is dark, artfully decorated, intimate, and perfect for a date night. There is a gorgeous patio with fire pits and heat lamps, as well. This is not a large restaurant, so I would imagine that it gets rather busy on weekends, as we had a 7p reservation on a Wednesday night and still had a 10-15 minute wait.  The service was impeccable, our server was friendly, but not too casual, and offered great suggestions and displayed a great knowledge of the menu.  The food- amazing! From the bread basket, to the grilled octopus, to the steak, to the salmon, it was all beautifully presented, perfectly cooked, and delicious. The prices were also very fair based on the quality of the meal, and the portions were just right. And even though we didn't get dessert, the complementary macaroons were just the right sweet touch to end the meal.  I will definitely be back- the Barrymore is top notch!

pnrMf3oHM2rNk0vZ-kJpOg.text: This place was referred to us by a friend. My cousins (locals) had never even heard of it and between the two have lived her for almost 30 years.  I was so glad we made it here this trip! Let's start with my favorite part of our visit: the ambience. Small, unique, classic Vegas. My favorite. Approximately ten tables/booths.  The hub and I ordered the following: 1.  Autumn flowers - cocktail.  Refreshing and delicious. Excellent  2.  Moscow mule. Made just right.  3.  Bone marrow w crostini - not the best I've tasted but not the worst. A little cold and gritty.  4. Caesar salad. Hub ordered. Average Caesar salad. 5.  Seafood platter - petite. We shared this. It was a minimum amount of seafood for the cost. Very fresh though. An assortment of oysters, muscles, lobster, shrimp, crab.  We had a party of six and gratuity was included. Our waiter's demeanor changed (and not in a good way) when we did not want to order dessert. Between us six, I'm thinking our bill was at least $500.  Not a bad night for him, I thought. Why four stars?  Food was good not great. I really enjoyed the ambiance. That's what gave this place a four in my book.  A definite must- see/experience.

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States

y1Ak51GjAnw2ynXhSM0xqA.text: Food was amazing! Must try the lobster cream corn. Service was okay.. When I go to restaurants, service is very important to me. I really didn't get the wow service honestly. Took the waiter over 20 minutes to even come take our order, I put a note on the reservation that it was my boyfriend's birthday, and the waiter I guess didn't know, or forgot, so I had to remind him. And we didn't get a, "goodbye, thanks coming," nothing. We just paid and left.. But food was good, service not so good!

7vyAKGbrpoIWfGiMqGeXEw.text: We're disappointed because our "go to" restaurant when we annually visited Las Vegas  has closed down. Found the Barrymore by accident. Great service (Ashley was awesome) Food was fantastic. We have a new "go to" when we visit Las Vegas. Don't let the location and location deter you....

BF7XmAFipJ2FQlP70p-eaA.text: The Barrymore...  What can I possible say about The Barrymore that hasn't been stated in a review already?   Yes, it's off the strip and attached to the Royal Resort Yes, it's small and intimate. Yes, they have good steaks and lobster mac. And Yes, The Barrymore is a great place to take a date or celebrate a special evening.   My girlfriend and I chose The Barrymore to celebrate our one year together. We wanted to go somewhere that was good, intimate enough for some quality time, and a place that we haven't been to.  The Barrymore fit just right.  We had reservations, which really wasn't needed since we were the only ones here when we started our dinner.  Our server was fantastic.  Our server made it a point to give full descriptions of everything on their menu, especially their steaks. He even brought out a raw steak just to show us the size of it before it was cooked. I had my eye on their Filet Mignon since I learned about the Barrymore, but ended up with their bone-in-filet.  My dish was pretty good. I'm not saying it was the best steak I've had, but it definitely wasn't the worse. It was still tasty, tender, and my portion was huge. I only regret that I didn't stick with the filet mignon, which in my opinion, tends to have more flavor.  Regardless, I was still satisfied with my meal. My girlfriend was satisfied with her meal as well, but thought that their lobster mac was missing something. We just couldn't figure out what.    Overall, I would suggest The Barrymore to anyone looking for an intimate dinner, a good steak, and great service.   PS:  Can't forget about their bread basket.  One word....delicious!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Macarons!!
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic Mash
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone In Filet

3x77Ub73qWm09am5c8Y6Zg.text: Decided to try here for the first time for my husbands birthday and happy I did. I saw complaints on here about service but decided to try it since food quality reviews were good.  First off the service was excellent. Our waiter was very friendly, upbeat, offered great suggestions and always checking on us. Second I loved the atmosphere. We were seated right away in a nice intimate booth.  We started with the grilled octopus which was the star of the night. Tender, charred with good compliments of sauce and beans. We both ordered the dry aged steak. Mine was cooked perfect medium rare, my husbands was a little under done. Over all decent flavor. We had sides of brussle sprouts which were OK and creamed corn with lobster which was excellent! We also had a bottle of wine from their 50 under $50 list. Very happy with our Merlot choice.  It all came to $200 without tip. A decent price for a quality meal.

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dim pretty interior.

lkDDVOmZFRdi4eje61WO-A.text: Classy hidden gem. Great place to bring a group of friends to enjoy live music and great cocktails  Nieve Malandra has an incredible voice! Happy hour is perfect for an early night out before hitting the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Live   Such a fun shot to enjoy happy hour and entertainment with friends.

POSoLLzgQP380LC00scd-g.text: Overall: Excellent, the Industry Night deal is great!  Initially, the waiter told us that Industry Night was not being honored last Monday due to the SEMA auto show.  He claimed it was on the web site, IT WAS NOT (still isn't).  However, he spoke to the manager, and since it was our first visit, they allowed us the discount, so thanks for that.  The food was outstanding; the seafood platter was great, nice Caesars salads, bacon apps, lobster mac & cheese and octopus.  The steaks were cooked perfectly and the lobster was nice and firm and buttery.  My brother really likes the steak sauces, and that they were very cheap ($2 each).  The smoked dessert was rather unique. The service started off excellent, but waned a bit, as a large party was seated and the staff was stretched a bit thin.  We will visit this place again!

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet, lobster &amp; bone marrow
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Twice baked potato
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smoked tart dessert

4fyx050AE1N8mFyQnj04dQ.text: Funny story. This terrible experience was almost a year ago and the waiter we had, Luis P, is STILL harassing me and my friend on yelp. Sure hope he doesn't work there anymore, and if he does, ask for another server. This guys a d0uche.

u59xVVkSN9DxbX9dpceKXQ.text: The bad, the neighborhood is sketchy, the hotel is shabby, and there isn't a lot of comfortable seating in the bar. This place seems to cater to an older crowd so I am surprised they have only barstool height seating. They do offer a patio which is rather tight and seems to collect all of the smoke from people outside the hotel. If you are here for happy hour and detest bar stools this is your option.  The meh, the food was just ok, especially for the price.  The good, uncomfortable seating aside the place has a great atmosphere. The service is friendly and excellent. The drink specials are great. The singer providing live entertainment was talented and engaging.   If they would bring back some of the regular height seats in some of the yelp pictures this could easily be a 4 star regular hangout.

CGfJLG75lqhYme163Vvfrw.text: Come at your own risk...Red Roof Inn meets Golden Corral, with poor service, bad food and less than ethical bartenders/servers...I had to give it 1-Star to be able to review it  Shrimp Cocktail was 3 Shrimp and some nondescript cocktail sauce...then it got bad!  I ordered the bone-in, dry-aged strip, sauteed spinach and mushrooms. They brought me the wrong steak and it took 15 minutes to get a Pittsburgh Cold replacement- really??? Spinach was tasteless and mushrooms were like a salt lick...No Bueno!!!  Then to top it off, served me the wrong wine/charged me/ wouldn't remove it from my bill....needless to say, I won't be going back!!!

LQ2NVYQ1wGT4KFtUlHIhgA.text: Came on a late sunday night at 930. Very quite and not a lot of people there since its a shady part of town. Service was good but the food was just awful. I got the newyork steak and it was extremely chewy and overcooked. Pass this restaurant unless you just want to enjoy the setting and atmosphere

Ev41WRbCUz3S3B8eaulQFg.text: So glad I finally came here. Went on Sunday for happy hour and live entertainment. My bf and I sat at the bar and ordered Oysters Rockefeller, thick cut bacon, and bone marrow off the happy hr menu and foie gras and creme bulee off the regular menu. Our favorites were definitely the oysters and foie gras. Live entertainment was very pleasant and it was surprisingly quiet on a Sunday night. Even though we mostly ordered off the happy hour menu, the total ended up being over $100 which I think is a bit pricey for the amount of food we got.

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creme brulee
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Foie gras. Very good but tiny piece

s_Mm_9S3DvaB9IvJSQeAqg.text: My husband and I were heading here with high expectations and left quite let down.  The ambience is great, and the Decour is beautiful. I really love the space.  However, our waiter and the food failed to impress.  I ordered off the restaurant week menu (this became an annual tradition), the hubs did not find anything he wanted off of it and ordered steak off the regular menu. Restaurant week menu had two options, $50 and $80 fixed. Though the $80 offered steak, it was paired with lobster mash. The hubs is not a fan of seafood (insanity!).  My RW pick included: Sashimi duo - quite good! Fish tasted fresh and flavors mixed well.  Chicken Mole - unseasoned chicken breast that was tender and I guess was made to receive its flavor from the mole it laid on.  Tiramisu- took it to-go, pretty creamy and enjoyable.  Hubs got Filet Mignon that was also not seasoned, and mash potatoes. While eating, he gave me a list of places where he had better steak and mash.  We shared asparagus, which was great. Also not seasoned but it had a grilled flavor.  I enjoyed El Diablo and Paloma cocktails - both Tequila based.  If the food was as impressive as the decor, our experience would have been 5+ stars! A True let down however, was the service. Our waiter did not acknowledge my husband at all. Any time he came to our table, he spoke directly to me. He only asked ME how the food was and whether I'd like a drink. It was quite ridiculous! It was interesting to hear a table next to us be read the specials of the day after our food arrived. We were not given the same courtesy.  My husband gave his own take as to why he was treated differently, I will not mention it here.  Needless to say, we won't be back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. El Diablo
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary bread basket
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The fare

JnEBZA7snyT3ewxEi6pN2Q.text: I do not always feel it's fair to give a bad review, but in this case; I must. After reading tons of good things about The Barrymore, we booked it for a family vacation and Christmas Day dinner- all 8 of us were extremely disappointed- The service staff was disinterested at best. Timing very off....but most of all, the food was lackluster to say the least- undercooked and " fishy" tasting crab cake...tough and tasteless short rib.....fishy tasting and tiny lobster special....tasteless gnocchi appetizer...and inedible special dessert. From start to finish we were disappointed and sad that we chose to eat here. It is not inexpensive! I don't understand who is giving this place good reviews- we have had many good meals during our week in Las Vegas, sadly, this was not one of them. The Barrymore charges top dollar for tasteless lackluster amateur good. Don't go. Trust me

eoK__PR9XC3plmI2VptaEQ.text: I came here with a group of business associates and didn't know a thing about the place.  The salads were a nice portion, and the bread basket was wonderful as well.  Then came my 14 oz Ribeye.    I typically pepper almost everything that I eat, and usually enjoy some steak sauce on the meat as well.  This steak was cooked perfectly with a middle sear on the edge. It was so flavorful that it didn't need anything added to the cut. If you haven't eat here, you really should!

Lp8VJElzeHAOfcNiEclXkQ.text: We have some go to restaurants and after reading the reviews for this place we decided to try it. It's a super cute restaurant that is in an unexpected hotel. You would never guess that such a cute and upscale restaurant would be inside of an old hotel.   The food was good but the service was a bit lacking. We sat for 20 minutes without being greeted. When we were greeted we had questions about the drinks and while they were answered we were told we would be given a minute but that turned into 20. So 40 minutes before even placing a drink order was a bit much.   We shared a Caesar salad, lobster macaroni and cheese, bone in rib eye, baked truffle potato and the Brussels sprouts. The food was good but it was not my favorite.   Had we had better service we would probably return. This place was on our list of places to try and now we can say that we have.

qsCiLw5MG3l2r3zg6aedmA.text: The Barrymore is ridiculously great. If your looking for great food, service with a touch of romance and old school Vegas, this is the place.   Ambience:  On the outside, it looks like your standard off the strip Hotel (basic with nothing special). When you walk into the restaurant, you seriously are transported to a different time in Vegas. Back when gangsters ran the place and dinner was quiet and intimate without all the neon and the celebrity chef's.   Food:  I've been here twice and I can recommend the lobster Mac and cheese and the fillet mignon. The chunks of lobster in the Mac and cheese are massive.   Service: Everytime I've come, Luis has served us. He is without a doubt one of the best waiters I've had in my life. Easily top 3. He does everything in his power to make your night special, sometimes even without you knowing it, till you get that check.   Cost:  Not going to lie, it's pricey. Party of 2 with a drink each can easily run you $150. That being said, it is 100% worth it.   Tip:  After your done eating, I suggest you take an Uber or Lyft back to your next location as no taxi's are out front.

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great and chill

bFgaZ8ip0myNfZVOoYuFhw.text: Just wow from the food to the service.   THE AMBIANCE:   The Barrymore is one of my favorite places to eat in Las Vegas. It has been some time since I went back but the memory of my experience there is forever engraved. The Barrymore is elegant, fine dining. Their wine cellar is beautiful and you will want one in your own home. The dining room decor is classic and enchanting. You feel like you're part of the high rollers club surrounded by metallic accents, blue hues, and dim lighting. Movie reels decorate the ceiling. If you want some natural air you can relax in the patio with a fire pit and Mediterranean-style pillows. It almost felt like a scene out of Aladdin. Loved everything about this place.   THE FOOD:  I was in town on a business trip and decided to treat myself. The food was phenomenal. I ordered the Grilled Octopus appetizer (merguez sausage, green lentils, sherry, red onion, romeaco sauce, herbs, $17) and it blew my mind. Wow! It was an explosion of flavor throughout and the octopus was so tender. The dish tasted was unbelievable and the octopus was plated beautifully. For my entree I tried their Short Beef of Rib (parsnip puree, baby root vegetables, granny smith apples, $33) with a side of mashed potatoes ($8). The beef was tender and the vegetables were caramelized. For dessert I had their apple creme brulee with an apple chip. It was sooo good. The best creme brulee I have ever had. Sour and sweet at the same time. Dinner was fantastic and I cannot wait to go back.   THE CUSTOMER SERVICE:  I was by myself so I dined at the bar. Both the bartender and the host were very welcoming and we had a great time chatting it up all night. I don't remember their names but the bartender appears in one of the videos I am posting and the host was a Latino man, I think his name was Carlos, and he was so kind; he gave me a tour.   THE TIPS: The octopus appetizer is a must have if they have it on the menu. It was my favorite dish. There is mirror with the restaurant logo that hangs in the bar area. Story goes that it was originally a floor plate at a residence and when the residence burned down, it was recovered unscathed by the flames and placed in the restaurant. Pretty awesome.

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States
