crLosCRY1dyRWYrghO_amQ.text: This unlikely gem is hidden on a quaint hotel property, although upon entrance it is entirely possible to loose sight of one's location all together.  Rooms draped in suede and dim lighting, centerpiece wine cellars, and classic sonatas give an nod to Sin City's demure side.   The Barrymore is a different Vegas...  the kind reserved for those with time to savor every morsel.

uAUfbBmywuxNTe8XLNSBcQ.text: Amazing food. Only con that I have is when I asked for grilled onions, they gave me pickled onion when I'm allergic to it. Other than that I would recommend this place.

u4ds7Bf08NuQIkBo_LkzfA.text: Such a hidden gem! Everything was delicious. I loved the decor & old school vibe. Can't wait to be back. They also offer a local industry discount I believe Monday or Tuesday I can't remember :)

PHLV5qdTlipPoboPCpirUw.text: This was a bit pricey, even for Vegas. For 3 people (with only 1 beer for one of the people), it came out to $200. The steaks were delicious though. The lobster mac and cheese was a bit bland but the rest of it was on point. Brussel sprouts were awesome. Mashed potatoes were good but a bit cold when they came out. Overall, I don't think it was worth the money but the steaks were melt in your mouth good.

FomXH9YDTJcDct6WVxzU-g.text: My new favorite hangout, happy hour, wine bar,  lounge,  speakeasy,  restaurant.  I feel like I stepped into a film noir set.  See for yourself.  Tons of atmosphere without the attitude.  Great service.  Lovely all around.  I kinda can't wait to return.

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Singer.  Lovely voice.
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lionel Barrymore poster.  Of course.
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ceiling

YJerppxi2uJuGoRaXLDTgg.text: This place is delicious! I came here at 5 on a Friday, so I didn't get a good feel for the ambience when there's a crowd and live music playing (that starts at 6). Even in the relative quiet, the ambience is beautiful - stunning decor and great service. We had the foie gras appetizer with prickly pear and pomegranate gastric, the bone marrow appetizer (delicious with the toast), char siu pork chop, and the short rib. The pork chop was absolutely an elevated dish, but simultaneously harkened back to childhood takeout orders of bbq spare ribs. The short rib melted in my mouth, perfectly cooked. I wholeheartedly recommend a trip out to this spot.

qGg9uC__YoJD6uQMw8PM8g.text: I found this spot to be a place where locals can enjoy themselves with amazing food and ambience. Being a new local, I wanted to try a steak house off the normal hustle and bustle of the strip and The Barrymore provided that experience. The food was top notch and the cocktails were strong and boozy which is a good combo. The restaurant is located on the lower level of a hotel, but the hotel is mellow and not another annoying casino. Thus making this spot a good get away for locals but still conveniently located.

7d050myQ0iq8WTD7gxaZVA.text: Excellent food and ambiance. Felt like "old Vegas". Our server Danny was great I.e. Attentive and friendly. Everyone was super nice!  Will definitely return!

htbhS3CbFM-t8nZRusfP0w.text: Amazing staff and food! Also, half off for locals on Mondays! The seafood tower and short rib are fantastic!

LLVjipuj7bUPnOlIKQ8pNw.text: I had dinner at the Barrymore as part of a Birthday/Mother's Day outing with my family. I must say that dinner was outstanding. The restaurant is decorated in a Old Hollywood fashion with what appears to be film reels on the ceiling - very chic! The Bar area and waiting area are small but there is plenty of seating through out, so you don't feel as if you're piled on top of one another.   On to the food: The short-rib was so tender you could cut it with a fork, it was served with small potatoes, carrots and a red wine glaze. The Creamed Spinach ( there are two options) was prepared so well with out being too soupy or the spinach to stringy. The Lobster Mac and Cheese was great, I'm not a fan of seafood in my Mac and Cheese, but this dish gets a pass- it was really good. Other items that my party dined on were:  Cream corn w/ Lobster and Bacon, Muscovy Duck, Jidori Chicken  and Miso Marinated Sea Bass - from the reactions at the table they were all excellent.    As for Drinks: The Watermelon martini was a hit all around at our table - it was light and refreshing with just the right mix of Watermelon Liqueur and Watermelon Vodka not too sweet and not too strong - Perfect!.     The service was fabulous -  our waitress Kendra was an absolute delight. She provided excellent service and ensured that our Birthday celebration ended on a sweet note ( We had cake!).

a1FIsGhkj7OGkutF44rOhA.text: We had, quite possibly, the best meal I've had in a long while last night. We chose the preset thanksgiving menu and our son had the New York strip. The steak was outstanding and the thanksgiving menu was amazing. The service was second to none and excellent wine suggestions were great. Can't wait to go back soon!!

ZNmaNukI39y0T9t5q2urkw.text: This place was awesome!  The hostess was sweet, the bartenders were attentive, and our waitress Emily was fantastic.  Emily was very knowledgeable about the menu and helped guide our dining experience.    We absolutely loved the artichoke appetizer. It was a perfect start to the meal.  We ordered the snapper and shared it.  It was succulent.  The vandouvan squash curry dish was great.  I am usually not a fan of curry, but this dish wasn't over the top spicy.  Our mushrooms and asparagus were wonderful as well.  We cheated with the chocolate cake dessert and I'm so happy we did.  It was delicious.    It didn't seem like we had a lot of food for what we ordered, but it ended up being the right amount.  We didn't feel gluttonous!  We dined in the room with the reels on the ceiling.  It had more character than the other dining room.  We will be back!!!

WIG8HhBHYIG9fL1BdmAHLg.text: Fantastic!! Be sure to dine at the Barrymore when you are in town!  I rarely find a meal that wows me in Vegas. Sure there are buffets, tons of steak houses, lots of choices. However, I had yet to find SF/NY quality.  Look no further. Foie Gras? Check! Duck Confit? Check! Specialty Seafood? Check!  I had a wonderful meal here this past weekend and I will be talking about it until I come back! Excellent service and the ambiance is awesome.   The Barrymore is on the top of my Vegas fine dining list!

3YhE9N6-L26Zvw2FBDst5Q.text: I came here on Valentine's day with my booboo. I had been wanting to come here for awhile so he secretly made reservations...awwww, I know haha They had a prix fix menu but we didn't get it. We just decided to get other things on the menu that we wanted. We were sick of red meat so we opted for the fish items. I had gotten the salmon and he had gotten the sea bass. We also got lobster mac and cheese, sauteed spinach, and one other item I can't for the life of me remember. The food had all come out at once which I like because I have a tendency to get full on whatever comes out first. The fish was SO good. My salmon came wtih some type of salad with asparagus and a yummy sauce. The top of the salmon was crispy mmmm. The sea bass also came with some type of salad and it was equally as good. OH!! We had also gotten a salad to start off because we were starving - something light because as I said, I get full on whatever comes out first haha We had also ordered some drinks. I would recommend just getting something on the rocks if you want to catch a buzz. I had gotten some cocktails but they tasted like juice to me - I'm not an alcoholic I swear but they weren't as strong as I wanted. For dessert, we had gotten this chocolate pudding type concoction with nuts inside and holy hell, it was soooooooooo good. I ate it fairly quickly so I could eat more than my boyfriend...LOL   This is a really cute date place, the inside decor is old school, they play nice old school music, and the bathroom is really nice. I would definitely come again!

cvZjTTagZfGLg3IRes5WXQ.text: Recommended: Venetian Spritz, Satan's Whiskers Martini, Lobster Mac & Cheese, New York Strip, Ribeye, Creme Brulee  Very cool kitschy ambiance, personal service (Thanks, Israel!), interesting cocktails, and incredible food.  I really like how they don't over-season the steaks; it's how high quality beef should be done. We were given complimentary creme brulee and it was fantastic.

P_NrLidTVYWG0tS3f2D1ng.text: Their menu changes seasonally. Some things in reviews aren't available now but we were told the favorites often do cycle back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Heirloom Tomato and Watermelon Salad.
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Octopus a&#39;la Greque: tender grilled octopus over a savory couscous topped with a bit of frisée. #unexpectedlydelicious

VoKDP-WvZOo2LiN7no07rA.text: Lobster Mac n cheese Grilled octopus Opakapaka Free-range chicken  All delicious! We love that parking was easy and this place is not crowded with tourists.  Great service.  We will be back!!!

OyeJZYqHWOhqtACcs2jLZA.text: This is definitely one of the best restaurants I have been to! Wonderful singer here with juicy, delicious food that is irresistible. This place was exactly what me and my family were looking for which was: a quiet,peaceful,tasty and fancy. This place had a really good design in terms of decoration and I highly recommend people to go here!  Review by: Nh Adm

4qduJ2pgKTlqPsO8T5GeiA.text: Such a classy yet comforable dining room with the perfect mix of whimsy and old school masculinity: leather banquettes, Hollywood reels adorning the ceiling, rich damask wallpaper and plaid carpeting may seem too busy, but believe me, this space just draws you in and wraps its cozy arms around you like an old friend.  The food was perfectly portioned and seasoned. My beet salad with pistachio and goat cheese medallion was perfect for an appetizer. We shared the small plates among friends and not one complaint was murmured during the meal. Entree-wise, we ordered a great variety and The Barrymore delivered on every single dish.  You will not be disappointed!

UuqVKU0TEiJpPocNAUxAOA.text: We found this place on Yelp and are SO glad that we did. Like others have said, the hotel that The Barrymore is in seems a bit sketch, but the restaurant was darling. Very warm and welcoming. We got there early and were seated right away by a lovely hostess.  Hubs had: - an excellent dirty martini - shrimp cocktail (very elegantly plated with huge shrimp) - French Onion soup  I had: - a tasty Prosecco - Caesar salad - short rib entree with root vegetables - oatmeal cookie ice cream creme brulee  A delicious bread basket came right away and the bacon-cranberry bread was yummy! Our server Bill was friendly, attentive and super knowledgable. All of the food was tasty, with the short-rib being the highlight.  We could easily get a reservation on a busy Friday night. Service was excellent and prompt. Food was delicious. We were thrilled to find this gem. Will definitely go back.

GCytNdb8CHXh0GrjE4uA0Q.text: YUM!!  What a great place just off the strip!  Went here with the BF after finding it on the Vegas homepage on Yelp nearly a month before our trip.  Everything was great.  First, our awesome waitress recommended the artichoke as an app, and who knew an artichoke could be that good?!? I've been dreaming about it since.  I got the short ribs, which were hands down the best I've ever had.  I would have licked the plate if I could, the sauce was so good.  My boyfriend had the duck confit, which was served over farro, and it was also excellent.  Both our cocktails were great as well.  Cannot say enough good things, and will be back next time we're in Vegas!

Xpg4tBC4RArDnrkYeX1eLw.text: This restaurant is a big scam. It tells you that you can get a glass of wine if 25 dollar is spent. However, it gave us only ONE glass for a party if 14 people spending $120 per person in average. They are cheap and stupid.

Ko2oytmqJH69eT0NG3Y-IA.text: The atmosphere is nice with romantic lighting and live music. Service is helpful and considerate. But the food is mediocre at best: the short rib is as dry as beef jerky, sea bass is dry and flavorless as well. And the price is much higher than we expected(3 $ on yelp) - we ended up paying 160 for two entrees and an appetizer plus a glass of champaign. Would not recommend.

jiOIcyrenVNJuQ2iBk2CNQ.text: Don't be fooled by their "under $50" wine list on their website, this place has offerings from all the great houses (if you're in to Bordeaux) and a nice range of other regions.  Just enjoyed their last bottle of 1970 Chateau Latour along with a great meal including the octopus appetizer and a nice filet.  Bonus, they have bone marrow!!!

yuxBjq9HotGhYSnI3u5Npw.text: We came here for my wife's 30th Birthday this weekend, with 15 friends.  We all loved everything about The Barrymore.  The restaurant is very clean, the atmosphere is cool and unique, the food was incredible, all 15 people loved their meal.  The wait staff was very friendly to us and more important very attentive.  We can be a pretty loud group at times and were never met with hostility.  I would recommend to anyone.  Thank you for taking care of us.

rNMH0KgWnemG_YthKJHzHQ.text: I ate here for a work dinner for which we had a  reservation mid-week. The patio was constantly inundated with cigarette smoke, the steak was overcooked, the service was seldom there to fill glasses or other things. It was a mediocre meal at a price twice or three times the quality justified. While some of that is Las Vegas, there are much better meals at much better prices. Also, when your taxi driver warns you not to walk around the area too much as it is not the best area, it makes you think twice about coming back.

q3lyNH_0jwyEksTL71kFGw.text: So, I wavered on giving this place 4 stars, but I did since the food I had was great and the place was absolutely beautiful inside and the patio looked nice as well. We got a great assortment of breads, my fave was the pretzel roll, which was to die for. I got the Chilean sea bass for $35, which was amazing. Some of my friends who ordered other meals weren't as satisfied. One friend got the chicken which she said wasn't nothing special and same for the curry dish.   Now here's where I have my complaint. This place IS expensive so if coming here plan on spending quite a bit. All the drinks are pretty much $12 on up. My 1st was a pomegranate martini, very tasty and $15. I ordered a glass of pinot noir at dinner and when brought to me I thought he was giving me a taster. That's how little a pour it was. Probably about 4oz, definitely no more than that. And when I looked down the table at others who had already been sipping on theirs, it looked like they might have gotten an adequate pour, which is 6oz. I asked the manager and he said my glass was what they pour but I complained so they gave me about an ounce more. I figure if I'm paying for a $15 glass of wine I deserve as much. Also its funny there were 2 pinots on the menu. I only saw 1 which was $13 but they waiter didn't ask so he gave me the $15 one so when I got the bill I thought they charged me for my extra pour. Now what's also funny, one of my friends at other end of table got a 2nd glass of wine, he got a double pour, about 10oz!!. Hilarious! I want to just say, I recently went to the Wine bar at Tivoli where their wines were $14-16 per glass but at least gave a nice 8oz pour.  I will say we had a huge party and the staff was very efficient, friendly and I appreciated that they separated all our bills.

SFJraSHeJA4mFYOmTVCG0g.text: We had a party there for 70 people.  The food was amazing.   We had the lobster nachos, truffle arancini, foie gras parfait, shrimp cocktail, beef tenderloin and cheese board.  We finished off the last hour of the party with the sliders and chicken fingers, which were also a huge hit.  My guests were incredibly impressed with the quality of food, especially given that it was a large cocktail party.  My bf and I ate there a few times before we had the party and based off those experiences decided to have the party there.  If we had had the party somewhere else, like a restaurant on the strip it would have cost thousands more.  Some of our guests were a little put off when they first got to the Royal Resort, but were blown away when they got into the restaurant.  The service was impeccable as always.  Even when we had only gone there a few times before the party the GM, hostess and bartenders already knew our names.  I recommend this restaurant for regular dining but also for large parties.  Sometimes smaller local restaurants struggle with executing larger party's, but that was definitely not the case here.

xUTtuYZsJ86WWmYF3_mWow.text: Picked the Barrymore for a nice romantic dinner after reading the reviews on Yelp. Found the food to be excellent, the portions were large, and our waiter Israel was helpful and fantastic.  The only downside was the large, loud group seated right beside in a dining room that is on the small side.  Would highly recommend this restaurant!

GW2Aw6_KIJv5RSinDFJ2kw.text: I was a little concerned when we walked into the hotel this restaurant is in, but as soon as we were in the restaurant everything was top notch. Beautiful upscale atmosphere, excellent service, excellent food. Worth it!!!

FxaiNlJ9m6f9BH7VKT1aBQ.text: Truly a gem of a place.  The menu is exquisitely composed.  Bar is well stocked with good classic cocktails. Although some item lacked in temperature, they made up for it in presentation and over all flavor profile.  I will go back and elaborate more on individual dishes next time!  Mean while go check it out, you won't be sorry!

JDEWfKD2jd2swWjR6_lMOQ.text: Was a little disappointed.  Room and ambiance is very nice, but the food is just okay  Nothing special at all.  Felt a bit rushed as we sat down and had the food menus quickly opened up in front of us.  Not  a great sign.  Food was good, but nothing special.  Sommelier was very knowledgeable and nice wine selection for a good price.  Too many great restaurants in Vegas though, so doublt we will go back.

l2_bRTIEHn2s9iKGh5ObTg.text: A group of friends went to this restaurant last night and it was really great.  The cool started with the bartender's Bruno Mars-like cocktail shaking.  Moved on to the retro Sinatra-inspiring dining room.  Then had excellent service by Israel and nice wine list.  The food was really good, too.  I tried the lobster mac & cheese, which I liked. I really liked the panzanella salad.  We then went to the main bar, which was a scene out of Pulp Fiction. We danced to some music I have never heard before and enjoyed some great people watching.  I would definitely recommend another evening at this place.

AgxhcyCViJSqSzweOumnJQ.text: My wife booked us a reservation here late last year, and I must admit I was a bit skeptical heading into the outing.  I'm used to dining within the various casinos at a variety of restaurants with top notch chefs and glitz and glamor, but this place was well off the strip in a hotel I had never heard of.  Expecting a typical steakhouse, when I saw the menu I knew I had to try a number of the appetizers.  The seared foie gras was excellent and the fried calamari was fresh and not greasy at all.  Also, they brought out some bacon cherry infused bread that was extremely good as well.  Since I had eaten steak the night before, I ordered the steakburger, which was very reasonably priced.  While it looked good on the menu (Gruyere cheese, bacon marmalade and some kind of tomato), I thought it would be like any other burger.  Oh my, how I was mistaken!  Similar to the experience of enjoying a great movie you had never seen previews for or heard anything about, I was immediately blown away after my first bite.  I'm very much a good burger lover, and this was by far the best all around burger I have ever had!  It had a soft sponge type bun that didn't get soggy, a very full and juicy patty that was ground sirloin, amazing cheese, and the best tomato that was somehow pureed and grilled?  All these flavors combined into a juicy treat that formed a completely unique flavor of burger.  Adding in their special steak sauce at the end was the kicker.    I am actually somewhat saddened as I write this review that I won't be able to have another one until my next trip to Vegas, however I will most likely be booking that very soon.  Kudos to a very friendly, accommodating and knowledgeable staff that made the experience all the better.  This place is my new favorite Vegas restaurant.

jKPby1j_s7OcOPiIJ5wbZw.text: quick service. nice ambience (though a tad dark). really good food. lobster mashed potatoes were amazing.

bV2qgBOw8YwQqzyU5ssgdA.text: What a gem!  We were very happy to discover The Barrymore inside the Royal.  We have had a timeshare there for years (Trade Shows, it is the best way to go) and are thrilled to have a great restaurant so close to "home".  Bill was a perfect server who helped us all the way from wine to dessert.  Great experience, we will be back!

2NK6fytG5tERqQN0l-PldA.text: I had dinner at The Barrymore last night and it was the best meal I think I've ever had in Las Vegas, and that is saying a lot. It's also reasonably priced for this level of dining. My fiance and I each had an entree, a drink, we split a salad, appetizer and a desert and the bill was just under $100. The food was perfection--nicely balanced and not overdone and very creative. The best thing at The Barrymore may be free: the bread they serve. I especially loved the bacon and cherry roll.   We started off with the grilled artichoke--a must have. We just had the regular house salad, and I wish all house salads everywhere had this much creativity put into them. The dressing is light and savory, and there was also shaved fennel and some of the freshest grape tomatoes I've eaten in Vegas.   I had the swordfish, which was $22 and served on a bed of fresh fava beans with Brussel sprouts. Everything was cooked just right. My fiance had a special: pasta bolognese. The pasta is fresh and the sauce, authentic.     They also have a good wine list and affordable wines by the glass, but if you like the hard stuff, try their specialty drink, The Barrymore, which is what my fiance had. I had the Au Bon Climate pinot noir, which was about $12-definitely worth it.   We loved it all: the decor, ambiance wine, service and the price.  I looking forward to many happy dining experiences at The Barrymore.

JuPk46c_8K_c0KyFBm_fTg.text: love love love this place.  you can see the bartender takes pride in his concoctions, which were delicious, by the way :) food was excellent.  service was impeccable.  compared to a lot of places on the strip, this is a BARGAIN.  total value for the money.  i can't wait to head back again. a hidden gem!

Q-OAmG2R-3JpcFs9qB4R1g.text: This place is so charming. Food was great, service was spot on, and the atmosphere of the place is incredible. I can't wait to return for dinner to see the place at night. If your a local, it is well worth the drive to the strip!

5YW7y5_krC9MRHsWhjhK6A.text: The place is freakin' bombshell.  It's especially bombshell if you're someone like me who'd rather be horse-kicked in the trachea than spend time on "The Strip".

8H7P8eqp9jANZciuC7XZoA.text: I really loved this place! So much so, that I have decided to join yelp and write a review so everyone else can go here as well.   My fiance and I were visiting Las Vegas for our 4 year anniversary and decided to do a nice dinner out. This was the place recommended to us, and we were more than impressed! the food selection is great - it is a 2 page menu, so it is not overwhelming, and every dish on there is worth trying. I had a ceasar salad and he had the grilled artichoke salad - very delicious, unique flavor.  The bread they bring is AMAZING - they have a cranberry-bacon  bread, and it really the best bread I have ever had (though the combination maybe doesn't sound good, it really is!).  Drinks - we initially were not going to order any, but then our waiter brought us complementary glasses of champagne. Very attentive staff, my water glass was always full, and the food came quickly. For the main course I ordered the salmon and my fiance ordered a steak topped with foie gras (he said it was the best steak he ever had, even compared to Del Friscos and other steak houses). AMAZING! the salmon came with a squash puree, which nicely complemented the richness of the salmon. We also got a side of mushrooms and grilled asparagus - again, perfectly cooked. For desert, we split a creme brulee - one of the best I have ever had!  If you are trying to find a nice place to eat in Vegas, you MUST CHECK THIS PLACE OUT! Truly a hidden gem. You won't regret it!

Ah2TqE0a1aXazljGcskdkg.text: This resturant is just great lobster Mac cheese Berger love it if you like to have Berger or any American food yo going to like this place.

0dD8Dk5wDs42npu2GXVeLA.text: My fiance and I scouted this restaurant out after finding it online. We are planning on having our rehearsal dinner here in several months. Can I just say- what a little gem!!! This place is awesome. Nestled right off strip in the Royal Resort (kind of a cool boutique hotel, also), this restaurant is top quality and comparable to the high end strip restaurants. Starting at the valet, service was excellent and friendly. The restaurant is dark and retro, it was very quiet. The decor is beautiful. We were early for our reservation but were seated immediately and had the whole room to ourselves! Emily was our server and she was super friendly and prompt. The menu was amazing- our food was absolutely delicious! It was my fiance's birthday and Emily brought us out complimentary little cookies- so sweet! We also told her we were thinking about having our rehearsal dinner here in April and she was so excited and provided us with info to get in touch with their group sales manager. Once getting back home, we set up our reservation to have our rehearsal dinner- the manager was incredibly responsive via email. This place is seriously one of the best restaurants I've been to in Vegas. It plays homage to the classic Old Vegas, Rat Pack days, and I just love it!

SMPuzr_5p5Lq6V_UQ2exLw.text: Went here as a solo based on all the great Yelp reviews.  Burger was as good as advertised.  My waiter, David, was not only friendly but very attentive.  Service, especially for a solo, is always hit or miss.  Thankfully, the service was just as good or better than the food.  Definitely recommend.

YdvCjtFZjFG-MyC5-Vbq8g.text: Found this restaurant through Yelp and TripAdvisor and although in a remote area, we gave it a shot. Everything was great and we both agreed that it was quite possibly the best meals we'd ever had. Lobster mac and cheese is a MUST. It looks like a small dish but it just keeps going. We also had the range free chicken and ny strip steak. We finished off the meal with the warm chocolate cake. It was my boyfriend's birthday (which I had mentioned when I made the reservation) and although we didn't get to pick out the dessert, we were blown away. It was so amazing. We were stuffed but couldn't stop eating. Also, the spanish sangria is to die for!! Cannot wait to go back to Vegas just so we can eat here!

HoDyfz1dnVtibSpTLA2HTg.text: I really wanted to like this place. Great "throwback" atmosphere, signature cocktails, menu selection looked great....   Our pork belly game out cold. When I say cold it was icy cold. I ordered medium rare and my 8oz filet came out well done. The cocktails (we tried 3) were just "eh".We had a wonderful dinner the night before at Nobhill Tavern and had high hopes that our dining experience at The Barrymore would meet or exceed our expectations.  We were disappointed.   The one thing that makes me think that maybe we just had a bad luck night....everyone else seemed to be enjoying their meal. Or maybe it was the atmosphere? It really was a great, cozy, "conversational" atmosphere...dangit...I really wanted to like this place.

LE9TtSA9x7qg1B8Q9BkQTg.text: We had a great meal tonight. Booked on open table. Great value, great steak, and excellent service. I would recommend to anyone in Las Vegas.

NBYuv0BrJg3HN2YLI1seRw.text: I came here on Sunday night without a reservation.  It was very quiet.  There was only my table and another table.  The server was very nice.  I went there to eat my favorite foie gras.  So I ordered a filet mignon with a size foie gras and beef bone marrow.  My husband also ordered the Chilean seabass.  The price is reasonable considering it is a high end restaurant in Vegas.  The filet was $43 plus $19 foie gras add on and $16 for two pieces of bone marrow with crusty bread.  The Chilean seabass was pretty soft and I thanked them for that!  I didn't get the Yelp check-in free wine because my husband and I don't drink but that's a tip for those of you do.  We asked for steak sauce and the server brought us three kinds of sauce in little containers.  But the server didn't let us know that there was extra charge for $5.   I think I would appreciate if I was told there is extra charge because you never know how much it would be.    Overall the environment was okay and the food was decent.  The only thing I wish for is a bigger portion.  Especially that little piece of foie gras.  It was way too little.  I rather pay more to eat a bigger piece.

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy bread when you are very hungry and waiting for food!
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The foie gras itself was way too small
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilean seabass

PSMR78tXQTGXxT8fDu_dTQ.text: This place is truly a Vegas gem! It's beautiful and classy in a "1950's movie star steak house" kind of way, with great artwork and fun movie reel ceilings. It's a small steak house tucked away in the motel-like Royal Resort.  There are 10 tables in the restaurant area, and the menu screams classic steak house. Service is wonderful and attentive, as one would expect from a high-end steak restaurant. They also have specials like the "Dean Martin" (which included filet mignon and lobster tail) which just reinforces their Oldies throwback :)  Onto the food. I hate to say, but I've definitely had better steak. The filet mignon I ordered was a little chewy, although it was cooked appropriately to medium, and it was not juicy :(  They do have lobster mac n cheese, which was rich and creamy and delicious, and they had a very common caesar salad. Their shrimp cocktail was quite impressive in size (3 very large shrimps) but overall, for the $$, I was unimpressed with the food quality.   Next time I'd just come here for HH, enjoy the outside patio/ cool bar area and eat some apps.  It's a great spot for a date night or if you want to impress your boss ;)

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caesar salad
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster mac!
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp cocktail

jPdxf6eeyfZQvCIAh75XmQ.text: Carries well traditions of heavily french-sauced 80s, with many favorite perennials, prepared with surprising alterations. Desserts are a star attraction.  --Best macaroons in the world. I'd put them against the pastry chefs abroad. Light, perfectly formed, packed with flavor. The perfect bite to finish your delection. --steaks personally salted by chef before serving. perfectly cooked. --seared fois gras for the ages --creamed spinach --scallops with polenta and proper reduction. wow.  Not much to add here which hasn't already been said.  arriving at the Royal, i was nervous. Encore is visible just over the wall and the parking lot is empty. but step inside and you'll find some slightly odd design choices like the painted Yamaha grand in the lobby. feeling inspired i sat to play, but it was so out of tune, didn't make it for more than a few seconds.  i love that the restaurant's entry door is as big and heavy as a bank vault door. cool. so too go the chic treatments and lighting in the bar and dining room. very classy in a retro yet modern way. the clash of these styles is mesmerizing. and all this without the throngs and sea of mouth breathers. so quiet and exclusive.

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Finest macaroons in the world. Perfection.
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread pudding.
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flourless chocolate cake.

cdjppsIxnC8M6VbMd_W1tQ.text: One of the best places I've been in Vegas.  Old school, Rat Pack vibe. Actually, it reminds me of Palm Springs. We were here for a huge group birthday dinner.  Our waiter was courteous, super funny, and on top of the large party.   Most of us ordered steaks, one friend ordered salmon. Each of our entrees was cooked perfectly. The sides are served family style and we ordered everything from the lobster mac n cheese, the corn, asparragus (there wwas mushrooms, but I hate mushrooms).  Every side dish was excellent and we ended up ordering extra spinach.  I brought in Sprinkles cupcakes for the birthday girl and waas saddened to have the $5 a person charge for bringing our own desert in. That was going to cost more than the cupcakes alone!  However, our waiter was awesome and dinged that charge because hey, we drank our faces there and dumped a ton of money.  Thanks!!!  Great spot for an unpretentious yet really nice meal.  don't be put off by it's location or the hotel iti's in. Once you walk in, you step back in time.

yWnq5FndT3n-2kSMQpBReA.text: I am in love with this little hidden gem. We held our wedding reception here and they were so friendly and accommodating. Everything was perfect. I could not have asked for anything else. Everything was on point.  Brian the manager had saved the day for us he was so wonderful throughout the entire day. The food and the drinks were so delicious. I highly recommend throwing a wedding reception here they are really on top of their game all around and the restaurant itself is stunning. If you aren't looking to throw a wedding reception stop in for a drink on their beautiful patio or for dinner you will not be disappointed.

9OjCxFUt8PcTznR6L5J0TQ.text: We came 10 mins late and they sat us no questions even though it was 20 mins till closing. Then our server Ashley gave us wonderful recommendations and was very knowledgeable about the food and cocktails and was really relaxed, in no way trying to rush us, even though we were obviously going to be her last table. When our steaks came out the were a bit over cooked and I was super embarrassed to say anything but Ashley walked up to the table and instantly saw them and said they were over cooked for what we had asked for and took them back to the kitchen, again, no questions asked. Then the manager came out and very unexpectedly took the steaks off the bill and was very apologetic. When they did bring the steaks back they were perfect and and all of the sides and the cocktails that were recommended were delicious. And Ashley was a gem the entire time even though we were the last people in the restaurant. Absolutely will return and try some of the other cuts and sides. We were very happy with everything.

59GjJLPxFC_in19Pm_i9Xg.text: The ambiance is awesome.  Service, not so much.  Food ok.  Would rather go to Joes Primesteakhouse and Seafood or Smith and Wolenskis.  Said several times was checking in on Yelp, the waiter did not respond.   Oh well, it's always good to try.  Won't be returning.

uUzpBiO9yH1FHrWxCcF6Ew.text: Amazing off the strip place to enjoy! The atmosphere is quaint, cozy, romantic and swanky. I took my girlfriend of 6 years here for dinner before I proposed to her on the Venetian gondola. The food was on point and service was great. The only thing is that the location and hotel it sits aside does not due it this place justice. Definitely try the mac n cheese and the cold platter app.

9g4crNEYVm3ItTNff5T8Iw.text: Fantastic, off the the strip steak restaurant. Excellent, excellent service!  We're planning on returning many more times. If only the courtesy of the waiters, waitresses managers and all other people in there being as they are, that would be good enough reason to return then of course, the food.  Excellent!!   Thanks Barrrymore!  Glad to have the experience to enjoy your food and service.  See you soon.

EKzdbfGxI0c8KqnBFwlMfw.text: What a hidden gem! First the decor is fabulous. Intimate & classy, this is a great date night restaurant located inside a boutique hotel. Second, the service was phenomenal! Our server was professional, yet super friendly. She gave great recommendations and made sure we never lacked anything. The other staff also made sure our drinks were full and we were happy with our cocktails. Third, the cocktails were great. The Barrymore signature drink in particular was delicious. We also tried the Final Act and Not Your Grandmother's Fuzzy Navel - all delicious.

PFNS59uSOAb7rA-NfQuiPA.text: First night in Vegas and we stumble to this place.  It is located in a not so nice looking part of the strip in the north end..a little off the strip.  It is a True hidden gem in the Royal Resort.  Arrived and got seated right away.    Service was great here.  The manager (or who looks to be the manager) came check on us a few times to make sure we are happy with our food and service.  Our water was always filled and the server check on us often as well.  They truly take the extra mile to make sure you are happy with your meal and service here.  Items we ordered:  Miso Marinated Sea Bass - Yums!  The sea bass is cook and flavored to perfection.  The season was just perfect that you can still taste the sea bass.  Cream Corn and Lobster - This is probably my favorite dish.  Not as creamy but it is perfect.  Delicious dish that I recommend.  Lobster Mac-n-Cheese - Another delicious dish.  I would say that this is one of the best I've had.  Very creamy and cheesy with chunks of lobster.    Will definitely come back to this place and try other items on the menu next time I visit Vegas.

a6wOGl8PJc6K3QShRa4BWQ.text: This review is for 3.5 stars  The vibe of the Barrymore is very old school.  It has that original Las Vegas feel which is very cool and different from the usual flashy-ness of new Vegas.  It is located in the Royal Resort.  We sat in a very small room that had about 4 different dining parties on a saturday night; very slow.  We began the meal with a good selection of bread and by sharing a seafood platter.  I highly recommend the seafood platter as an appetizer.  I think it came with 6 oysters, 2 lobster tails, 6 shrimp, and a few other seafood offering.  The shrimp in particular were humongous and very meaty.  One person I dined with had a steak and the other had the french onion soup and a salad.  I went with curry with a side of grilled asparagus.  My meal and the quality of the food were very solid.  I heard good things about my other dining members' meals as well.  The manager came over a few times to check up on us (not sure if this is usual or just because it was a slow night).  I liked that he conversed with his patrons; very old school.  Overall, I really liked my meal.  I just do not think the high cost matches the quality of the food.

3uo5OKk5lycOgP81g4MiOA.text: The service was on point! The food was..  okay... I expected more but it was fine overall. The tea setup was amazing! Glad we came in general but I am not sure the prices match the actual product :/ still, excellent service, extensive wine choices, and yummy dessert so I gave it 4 out of 5 stars

veSbh9ZzMNr8LgDO_KCajw.text: Decided to surprise my wife with a intimate dinner and was really let down. Restaurant was slow with the exception of one big party of 10. We ordered a Caesar salad and lobster Mac and cheese. Salad was bad, but the server did realize he gave me the wrong salad. We were sitting across from the kitchen and we can hear the cooks and servers yelling at each other. When our main course came out, my steak was cooked right on but my wife's steak was supposed to be a Medium Well came out as a Medium Rare and was burnt to a crisp on the outside. I'm not sure why the server never came back to check on us probably because his busser dropped a bunch of plates and the manager came to fill up our waters and never even asked if everything was ok. Which was embarrassing on their part. We sat their for a good 15 minutes, no exaggeration I ate half of my steak and my wife picked at hers before the busser asked if everything was ok. I asked for our server and when he finally showed up and asked us how everything LOOKS, we were both ready to leave. My wife expressed her feelings about her steak and it was almost like the server already new she was unhappy. I give him credit though for dropping off the check quickly.  Good job on that part but we will never be back to visit.

GYHJnuXbd2Tw2XWwPxwPng.text: Amazing staff, and food! My sister had her wedding here and I would highly recommend this venue for anyone getting married in Las Vegas.  It is also a great place to grab some yumi food and specialty drinks. :)

UlHWWinrcaRxSDPE5p_s1A.text: We brought a couple friends here who we thought would really enjoy the vibe. We'd been here once before and really enjoyed ourselves. Unfortunately for that evening, we were not notified that there would be a wedding that took over the entire dining room so we were seated in a little room off to the side of the bar.  Definitely a huge disappointment.  Service was also a very big let down.  Because our table was small, it did not have room for our wine bottles or water bottles.  They kept water in a chiller behind us and the wine in some hallway on one side of the room.  Water was filled slightly more often than the wine but towards the end when they got busy, we went thirsty.  Our wine glasses sat empty for long stretches.  Even when the snooty unhelpful manager dude would pass by, we'd still go thirsty.  So it appeared that they only had one server for that entire room which consisted of a party of 14, a couple two-tops and another 4 or so four-tops.  There were a couple bus boys bustling around but otherwise, after it got busier, we got ignored.  The food started out good (when it wasn't so busy).  We got the large seafood tower, king crab cocktail and lobster mac and cheese.  These items were pretty tasty and we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves...happy that we were kicking off in good fashion.  Unfortunately, from there it was all downhill. Although our friends raved about their entrees (filet mignon rare and sea bass), hubby and I were not happy with ours.  I ordered the ribeye and hubby went with the NY strip.  After a bite of the steak, I thought something was off.  I put my finger on the steak and realized that it was barely warm.  Same for hubby's!  All our sides came and the sauteed mushrooms were cold.  Nothing else was really hot!!  Worse yet, our steaks were underseasoned and mine was so full of gristle I stopped eating it halfway through, feigning a full stomach.  Should we have paid double and gotten the "Reserve" steaks?!  At this point, I felt like they served us leftover wedding food.  By this time, I was worn out by how disappointing the evening had been.  It took us forever to get out of there...trying to find our server, get the check, get our cards run, etc. I didn't want to put up a fuss with our friends present but we could tell that towards the end, they too were also getting short on patience.  Frankly, I get the feeling they are struggling.  When we arrived, the Royal Resort was deserted.  Their hip lobby lounge had nary a soul hanging out on a Saturday night and the bar was emptied out, shut down which was a stark contrast to how lively it was when we last visited.  The hotel's decline may be affecting this place's business.    Needless to say, I think we've seen The Barrymore for the last time.

_Zq-PGLoDRb8PENCaW9xuA.text: I was in town for business and decided to stop in here to have dinner based on proximity to my hotel and reviews on Yelp. The pictures looked appetizing. My food experience was meh. Service was great, the manager went above and beyond to make sure I was happy with my dinner. Alcohol seemed very poor as far as the well drinks but I guess what do you expect for $5 in Vegas. I wish I had ordered something else because there really was nothing magical about the food itself. I do commend them on service but with food that disappointing, I will not be returning.

tIEhKISDPW8UpnxN-qmDNA.text: I love how easy it was to book online. Stopped in on New Year's Eve. Awesome wine selection and the best filet I've ever had. Try the house steak sauce!

-LFMpoPJ-KWfIelVeUKTVg.text: The True definition of a Hidden Gem. When walking up to The Barrymore I must say any expectations I originally had immediately went out the door.  This restaurant is not right on the strip, and is attached to a small no-name casino. Don't be fooled by all that though, this place was Great!  We started with: - Lobster Mac & Cheese - Always a crowd pleaser - Crispy Rock Shrimp - AWESOME - must get!!!!  As my main dish I got the Chilean Sea Bass with egg pea risotto, shaved truffle.  10 out of 10 for sure!  Again, don't be scared away, if you give this place a chance you will realize that it's one of the hidden secrets in Vegas!

Bic6VpfY8GJ8JOKd2JkhTQ.text: The service is fabulous, and the food is just as great. I was able to try the duck breast & confit leg, scallops, short ribs, grilled octopus, lobster mac & cheese, cheesecake, molten chocolate cake, creme brulee.   Everything we had was delicious, especially the duck & grilled octopus! The server gave us complimentary champagne and desserts, while the bartender gave our group of 10 girls shots.

9CKAd780RrYLl2vcY1QHCw.text: Loved the place, but they undercooked my steak a lot! They compensated and gave me the steak for free, why they deserve 5 stars. Great vibe, dark environment(which I liked) Good drinks and amazing food selection! Tried bone marrow for the first time, and foie gras for the first time, and wagyu steak!!!! Loved trying 3 things for the first time in one place. Would definitely recommend this place.

-8cfidKYH-7xB5hECnQj7w.text: What a gem.  The Barrymore.  Named after John Barrymore and designed with Drew Barrymore in mind.  A wonderful steakhouse nestled in the Royal Resort Hotel.   A 16oz. Bone-in Ribeye.  Lobster Mac-n-Cheese, and an out of this world Maple Smoked Thick slab of Bacon.   Service was fantastic.

9ojY6II8fepZAN7O1KIbXw.text: I recently checked out the Social Hour at The Barrymore and I was very impressed. The property itself isn't too impressive from the outside. In fact, I almost didn't go inside but I am so glad that I did.  The Barrymore is small but nicely set up. Really cool wallpaper and interesting old school Vegas meets steam punk decor.  I sat at the bar and ordered the oysters rockefeller and the candied bacon along with my favorite Campari and soda. Both dishes were delicious! I definitely would order both again!   The bartender was great. She made sure that my friend and I were good and happy.   I will definitely be back for social hour/happy hour again and to try dinner in their dining room.   The Barrymore is a hidden gem for sure!

R7rXASUg0_vD2JO7YX1iLQ.text: The reviews that I read before making reservations for hubby's bday did not let me down. From the moment we walked in, we loved the ambiance. Our waiter was great. The chef is hands down amazing! I ordered the filet mignon. It was tender, crusty, juicy and flavorful! My side, the parmesan risotto, was hands down the best I've had. Hubby's 18 oz bone in ribeye had us both salivating before the plate hit the table!!!!! It was cooked medium well to perfection. The juices flowed out as he cut freely into every piece. The cream corn and lobster with bacon that he paired as a side definitely disappoint. If you're in the area, it's a must stop. I tell you, you don't expect to get THIS when you walk into this hotel. We couldn't be more pleased!!!!!! Perfect place for a birthdya

tGsb2hdvPEzILH14tTdzxg.text: Truly a hidden gem. Off the Vegas strip and in a hotel that no one's ever heard of. When you step into the Barrymore you are immediately taken back to a bygone time. The velvet booths, the movie reel-covered ceiling, and the dim lighting feels like a Dick Tracy 1920s speakeasy. The night we dined there was a live singer at the bar. Her notes and melody carried into the dining room and made the scene even more magical.   The menu is typical Americana - appetizers, steaks, sides, etc. Their drink menu is inventive, both in name and in mix. Wine list is extensive with notable bottles in their collection. We wanted to try many of their dishes so we ordered most of their appetizers and no main entree. Can't find any complaints with any of their dishes. The shining stars would be the bone marrow, grilled octopus, foie gras, and the dessert - Chizu, a Japanese cloud cheesecake.   What a great find! If you are a foodie and Vegas is your next destination be sure to add the Barrymore to your list of must-eats!

TzQFl2CWK6DcB86rf5WQ_Q.text: Well... I have been living in Las Vegas for over 25 years but never heard of this restaurant, nor the Royal Resort !  Came here because we bought a coupon. It definitely worth to give this a try. Food is good, service is good. We told the server we came here to celebrate a birthday and they bring an extra dessert with a candle for free! Have to mention the cold platter, quality is much better than fancy seafood restaurants on the strip. Definitely will come back!

t34NJwTlu6bWlVUH_adRIg.text: After reading all of the great reviews I decided to have dinner at The Barrymore on the 16th. I was very disappointed with the service. The food was ok. Perhaps they hire a company to randomly rate them.

dYgHsMwNom61eMVKTrUvrw.text: Ever wanted to just go in the kitchen and lay a sloppy wet kiss on the chef?? OMG. Seriously. The Lobster MAC n Cheese, The bacon made from heaven. Yasssssssss, and Even the bone marrow thing that we never tasted before and the duck liver thing we could barely pronounce. You can't pronounce it because your mouth is too full of deliciousness. It needs to be re/named "the omg wtf is this in my mouth?!"  (But, In a classy way of course). This was a awesome hidden treasure off the strip. It was so romantic and well decorated. The food was amazing and Matt was the best server ever! The ambiance and overall experience exceeded our expectations. We went to celebrate my husbands birthday. We were looking for a intimate and unique dining experience with new flavors and boy did we get what we were looking for!

x1y_8UfnWRsOLkZCkQAUzA.text: While trapped by road closures because of a presidential motorcade, I had the pleasure to to sample the happy hour menu on the patio, which is stylish, comfortable and cool, but I just had the bad luck to sit near old people that could not stop talking politics.  But that did not ruin my meal or harsh my buzz, some perfect Cuba libres saw to that. I tried the  iceberg wedge salad - with bacon, marinated tomatoes, radish, red onion, and blu cheese/buttermilk dressing- the bone marrow with pickled veggies, shallot jam, and grilled bread, and the smoked bacon - all were delicious, solid items.   Service was outstanding, friendly, attentive, and anticipating my orders. The decor is stylish, cool, yet comfortable. I will be back!  Years back they made a gourmet burger that was one of the best in town - bring back the burger!

usUQ9YvDIjxLjGX4hqcDYQ.text: This restaurant is awesome! I first heard about this place on Weekly magazine and decided to come here. It's definitely worth a visit. It is located inside Royal Resort Hotel. The parking is free.  There is a nice outside area for warmer weather and I love the ambiance. The restaurant seating area is very comfortable and relaxing and we sat on the high top. The waitress was very attentive and the manager came to check up with us too. We had mostly ordered from the Social hour menu.  We ordered ~  Smoked Bacon : Barrymore Steak Sauce, roasted onions, toast  Roasted Bone Marrow:  pickled vegetables & shallot jam, grilled bread  Beef Slider- ground beef, gruyere, frisee, roasted onions, & garlic aioli  Oysters Rockefeller- creamy spinach, prosciutto, pernod, bread crumb  All the food were very satisfying and enjoyable.

CZx3adrkkvZFe3VJnYk25g.text: This little gem was a pleasant surprise. It's a retro Vegas with a twist atmosphere. The service was amazing. All servers were very attentive and accommodating for our party of nine. The food was price at an upper scale steam house. The filet mignon was a bit over cooked but the lobster creamed corn was delicious. They brought a dirt dessert to the bday girl which was also a nice treat. Great experience overall l.

RH59gR5fPAO1tL06DLkOOA.text: The restaurants atmosphere is nice and the decor is on point. The steaks were cooked wonderfully and the Parmesan risotto was Devine. However they tried to make bearnaise their own version and added tobacco to it. This was not a wise choice. The desert was poorly concocted and tasted like sprinkled cocoa powder on top of it with bakers chocolate. A poorly made dirt pudding.

c7c2MiUrnDNMLOVSZioj4g.text: This is one of my favorite places in Las Vegas this is my 2nd time visiting this restaurant and I brought friends with me the food is incredibly good  and the  environment is very pretty  Every time I  Come to this restaurant I don't wanna go home because of the wonderful service this restaurant gives us

qRqaVWplekAAK4hDjVt5Ow.text: If you're looking for Good Food & Great atmosphere this is your place. It's located off the busy strip. It's within walking distance of the Convention Center/Westgate. I bet this place is packed during convention time.  I love anything and everything Old Vegas and this restaurant has that vibe. Love the decor. It's super trendy & Quaint. The Live music (in the lounge) that played throughout the restaurant is a nice touch. I definitely see myself coming back and bringing friends.   The Lounge is on the smaller side but, they do have a nice outdoor area that extends off the lounge which I can see myself out there once it cools down a little.   Our table enjoyed the Chilled Seafood Platter, Crab & Cream Cheese Wontons (A Special Item that night), Caesar Salad, Filet Mignon, Asparagus & Twice Baked Potato. All the food was great but, I'd like to point out that the Caesar Salad was the best I've had.   We had a Sundae for dessert. A suggestion for the restaurant would be to add the verbiage  "build your own" Sundae to the menu description as it might be more enticing. Although... It was a nice surprise for my son once he saw he got to add all the toppings himself.   If I had to find something wrong with this wonderful experience it would be the Missing Cheesecake on the dessert menu. We really enjoy a Cheesecake to share after a nice dinner, ha

MDYgfW5czN08eJaoIr5hEg.text: A hidden gem tucked away inside an unknown hotel called Royal Resort. Had dinner reservations here for my birthday on a Monday night and not knowingly that on Mondays it's half off on all food items for service industry. Its beautiful inside with a lovely outside seating. The service was on point and the food was phenomenal. Great selections on wine and if you don't know anything about wine, don't worry they have a sommelier that comes to you at the table. Wednesday's are half off on all wine bottles. It was the perfect birthday dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The front

TG2LaSUWMj30J00FjqRVwg.text: We were in town visiting for the weekend and wanted to have a nice steak dinner. A friend of mine recommended this place, and I was glad he did!   This spot is based in the Royal Resort Hotel, which was a bit odd... It's not on the strip and the whole neighborhood is pretty quiet. It feels a little creepy, to be honest, though I think that's the vibe this boutique was going for.   The restaurant itself, however, was marvelous. The decor was vintage, and ambiance relaxing. Service was incredible the entire night, as our server effectively balanced our party of 8, with a wedding party that came in with about ~20 people. I was really impressed.  The wine list was solid, and we ordered a few bottles to share with the table. Lobster Mac & Cheese was the appetizer, along with complimentary bread. I didn't have the mac (shellfish allergy) but reviews were positive.  For mains, everyone got the porterhouse, which is the "signature" dish. You can add on mushrooms, foie gras, etc if you'd like. It's a LOT of food... like a LOT a LOT, so probably better to split for two people. For that reason, I opted for the filet, which was delicious, and more appropriately portioned. I added foie gras on top, and am glad I did. For sides we ordered asparagus, mashed potatoes, and Brussels sprouts. The sprouts were the best of the bunch - the other two weren't particularly memorable. I know they also have a truffle baked potato, which I would probably try if I ever returned.  Keep in mind, this place is a steakhouse, and doesn't have great options for vegetarians (salmon for pesca's).  Overall, I was really satisfied with our meal. The restaurant is very close to the convention center, if you find yourself in town for something like CES. Great spot for a date, passing time with friends, or dinner with parents. Definitely not a spot for kids. Price was fair, about ~$100 pp for 1 main, side, and wine for everybody. Dress skews toward business casual, though I don't think they'd deny anybody on that premise. Great work!

qXSoD6RrUVBFVtcCjxu72g.text: This is probably one of the best steakhouses in town. Not only is the atmosphere fantastic, the food is mind blowing. Honestly, we go on Industry Night which is every Monday. The entire food menu is 1/2 off! It makes for a perfect affordable (and adorable) date night. (Check the website for industry night rules)   Food Recommendations: Start with the Lobster Mac' N Cheese, Bacon, Ceasar Salad and Crab Cake! Continue the meal with the Bone-in Rib Eye or Fillet (add a side of Bone Marrow, Lobster, or Shrimp) with sides of Lobster Cream Corn, Brussel Sprouts, or French Fries (amazing fries, get them)! Make sure to check into Yelp! to get a free glass of wine.   *Make a reservation and ask for a booth. If it's a beautiful night, ask to eat on the patio!
