3UnP_4hPosesUpdJduq_1w.text: I agree with the other reviewers on ambiance and vibe - the piano player is 96 and has Grammys from his days playing with the rat pack - so he's a kick.  Our meal started well, service was friendly and attentive. Drinks consistent with other reviews. The manager stopped by our table and chatted for quite awhile - we learned the history of restaurant and features of menu. He seemed to honestly care about our experience - I inquired about the foie gras - he said it was good, but they were going to tweak it. It was ok - a bit gamey, sinewy, too much quince, etc. good thing they will work on it. Lobster Mac and cheese was dry and tasted like strong cheese - The mgr checked back and we gave him our feedback -  he insisted on exchanging the Mac and cheese - as it turned out the second was much better and creamy (tasted like totally different dish) although I wouldn't recommend it. We ordered the special entrees- lamb, cooked perfect - could have used a crust and lobster, good too.   BUT - the specials were grossly over priced in comparison to the rest of the menu, by at least $25/ea. The waiter doesn't tell you the price, shame on us for not asking - so be aware! I don't mind spending on great food but this was good trying to be great and I don't like surprises - like when the waiter said "don't worry, I didn't charge you $10 for the water" WTF - this was still or tap water! Wine menu very interesting but grossly overpriced too. We are from No. CA with access to lots of great wines - we just couldn't get excited about the offering to value proposition.  We went to experience something more authentic and to get off the strip - left feeling unfulfilled and disappointed.

5aCB5iZN4UijDsRauIkmxQ.text: We ate here in September of 2013 and had a great experience.  We took a group there a couple days ago and I have to tell you I won't be back.  There was hardly anyone in the restaurant so you would think we'd get good service.  We didn't.  I had a filet as I had before and while it was cooked correctly, the cut was not tender.  I had to work my way through it.  Others in my party who had steak had similar complaints.  We brought wine as we always do and offered tastes to our waiter, who accepted.  Normally that results in a break on the corkage fee.  Not here apparently.  We were charged the full $35 per bottle.  The next night we visited our favorite waiter at our favorite steakhouse in Vegas and brought 4 bottles.  Our waiter only charged us one corkage and comped us 3 desserts.  That's the way you get a bigger tip and generate loyalty.  Something The Barrymore needs to learn.  We had a party of 10 so I expected an automatic service charge but there wasn't one on the bill so we only added 15% because of the service.  Low and behold when the credit card receipt came back there was an 18% service charge written in by hand.  The folks at the table who paid cash made out because I had to make up the difference.  Again, no way to get me back.  It's took bad.  I thought we had found a regular stop but we won't be back.

oosEqxWcgbow70Io2MG4mw.text: Delicious food, impeccable service, old Vegas feel, lovely ambiance and relaxing  -very nice time. Romantic and private. Nice reprieve from the hustle and noise of strip.

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Foie gras, (a must!)
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone in ribeye oscar style.

vvpcGyGN_a6bVNb4l371fw.text: Pretty F'n amazing!  Yes, it's a couple hundred bucks for 2 people, but everything was great. We went on a Sunday night and had plenty of time to have a couple drinks at the bar. Happy hour $5 wells and cosmos. Good pours and a friendly staff. The decor is pretty cool, with some neat paintings and film roll ceiling. Nice, comfy booths.   The bread basket was awesome, but could have used a little more butter. I was a little disappointed there was no cherry bacon bread that lots if other reviewers raved about, but it was still good.   We had the octopus appetizer to share, and it was done really well. A couple thicker pieces were not as tender, but very flavorful. The citrus sauce on top was quite good, and the fava beans were excellent.   My wife had the Muscovy Duck, which she liked. It came with heirloom carrots and we got a couple sides. Brussels sprouts and asparagus.  The asparagus was fresh but otherwise unremarkable. The sprouts were covered with bacon, so there's that!    I had the bone-in ribeye with bleu cheese. I ordered it medium, as many reviewers indicated theirs were more rare than ordered. What I got was a medium-rare steak that was nearly perfect. My only issue was the portions were huge, even the duck, and we couldn't finish everything. It pained me to let that beautiful meal go unfinished. I don't suppose that's something to complain about, though.   So, with drinks, an appetizer, two sides, and two entrees, we paid around $195 with tip. We would definitely return.

JkHplRuB1x5UCGoEZEZjpw.text: Hip. Swank. Elegant old Vegas feel.  That's The Barrymore in a nut shell. We stopped in for some drinks on a Friday night. At first, it seemed like we picked a terrible night for it--the place was jam packed with a huge group all wearing t-shirts akin to those smut peddlers on the strip. Luckily, their party moved outside to the piano and we seized our opportunity to grab seats at the bar.  After a quick glance at the drink menu, I went for their namesake drink, The Barrymore. I thought it would taste like the Twin Creeks Manhattan thanks to orange marmalade being one of the ingredients. I was right. It was pretty close and I enjoyed every last drop along with every last ice cube.  I'm already a fan of The Royal House and this is just one more reason to visit.

-ccRuoGg_2hnFqo3v8iw2g.text: We were looking for an off strip quality meal.  Went in hoping for a find.  Unfortunately, after our experience we are very confused by the many strong glowing reviews.  Our experience was one of the worst we've had over the years in LV.  Food - Started w roasted artichoke app.  It was roasted and buried under a mountain of arugula.  Flavor was ok, but the leaves were blackened.  Give it a pass.  Halibut entree was sooooo over-cooked it was almost a brick.  The filet w bordelaise was cooked perfectly but there was a metallic flavor that we couldn't identify.  Both entrees went uneaten.  Gets a second star because we got a bottle of Kistler.

Cwy4nU5Ofv7yZzpyt_zQIA.text: I've lived in Vegas for 50 years so it's a pretty rare occasion when something really surprises me. I've been in and out of every casino, seen most all of the bars and restaurants and even hung out at a few of them without being overly impressed. Last night my wife and I attended a Yelp event at The Barrymore and to say I was blown away is an understatement.    The Barrymore is located in the Royal Las Vegas which quite frankly has never been known as a Vegas hotspot. In fact, The Royal has mostly been known as a place that folks stayed when they couldn't get accommodations elsewhere. A couple years ago we went to a timeshare presentation at The Royal and listened to the salespersons story about how the resort was being rehabbed. I took this tale with a grain of salt and passed on a purchase. Needless to say my opinion of this tucked away spot has changed completely after last night.     Upon entering the lobby of The Royal I was taken aback by how nice the place was. The decor had been updated since my last visit with an art gallery and a cool looking sports bar/lounge adorning the interior. As we approached The Barrymore I could see that this place was no ordinary Vegas tourist trap. When we walked in we immediately took note of how classy the place was. The designers were obviously going for an early Hollywood feel and in my humble opinion they hit it out of the park. The bar was packed on this particular night, but the service was great. There is a flat screen behind the bar playing old Hollywood movies and a large glass wall that leads to the outdoor seating area. The outdoor area is large enough for about 20-25 people to sit and plenty of space to mingle and enjoy a nice spring evening. There is also a fire wall which really set-off the exterior decor. It was definitely an ultra-cool patio.    Returning to the inside we decided to check out the restaurant area since they weren't serving guest yet. WOW! In a word, this place is plush! Huge black leather booths, old school gold movie projector reels adorning the ceiling and a glass wall which allows diners to peek into their extensive wine storage room. It is the kind of place that reminds me of old Vegas when people wore suits and gowns out for the evening as opposed to today when the weekend warriors trudge in and take over the town.    In a wonderful twist of fate for anyone reading this review there is a Groupon deal out today (3/05/12) $25 for $50 worth of menu items at The Barrymore. I would highly suggest that you buy one and go check this place out. I can't wait to go back to eat there and have a drink out on the front patio. It won't be long for The Barrymore to find its place firmly on the list of Vegas hot spots.

XvlfDEQTXFqK7Pw6NlzF-w.text: Great food, great drinks and great service.  I enjoyed sitting on the outdoor patio.  The panzanella was fantastic and the foie was good, but overpriced for the portion size.  The lobster mac and cheese was good, but not great due to the lobster being overcooked.  I don't think it is possible to cook it correctly, because every time I've had it anywhere, the lobster was overdone.  The drink menu was interesting and good, with many drinks you won't find elsewhere.  The wait staff was very good, with a good knowledge of both the menu and drinks.

7w12VKzbqKgsELUdBfjCjA.text: I was looking for a restaurant to take my girlfriend to for a nice dinner during her first trip to Vegas.  The Barrymore did not disappoint. The menu offered an array of options and the service was excellent.  Luis waited on us and was extremely helpful and knowledgeable about the menu.  Everything we had was great, she had a steak and mashed potatoes, I had the pork chop and Caesar salad.  If we're ever in town again we will definitely be back.

puHLxPdvfKd8sLuWaYDBBA.text: When we were scouting out different locations for our wedding reception in Vegas, we happened to come upon this place because of high yelp and trip advisor reviews. From the very first interaction I was hooked on this place. Heather Caldwell was incredibly kind, quick to respond, and so so friendly. Talking to her on the phone was easy and the packages they have at the Barrymore are very easily customizable to what your needs are. They have decently priced prix fixe menus with relatively low F&B minimums. We were able to feed our 34 guests a really high end meal for a great price. Everyone kept talking about how great the food and service was. We loved our meal, and our cake which was custom made in house for us. I would definitely recommend this place as a post nuptials dinner reception site. The service from start to finish was fantastic. The inside of this place is romantic and intimate and plush. It's like the Rat Pack might be hanging out in the place! Very Old Hollywood/ Old Vegas feel to it with really luxurious decor. The film reels on the ceiling is another really nice touch. Just a super romantic venue and perfect for a wedding! We didn't even need any flowers or candles (though they do have vendors available for that should you need it!)  Next time I'm in Vegas I will definitely be back for a trip to this awesome place!

zPSRi64g_-U3C0cacc3FpQ.text: Before even stepping foot in the restaurant we were a bit hesitant because there were very few cars in the parking lot. But once we got inside the restaurant looked very nice.  I was unimpressed initially because we made reservations for 8 pm and weren't seated until at least 8:20 pm. We had (good) drinks at the bar while we waited, but there was another gentleman sitting at the bar, who I think worked there, who was extremely obnoxious and was hitting on all of the female employees. The hostess seemed to be his girlfriend and it came off very unprofessional. After telling us our wait would be longer, she offered to sit up in the empty dining room which we declined, because we didn't come to a restaurant to sit alone with no ambiance.   Once we were seated our experience improved. The environment was romantic and intimate and our server was great. We ordered the lobster mac and cheese and it was underwhelming. I would not recommend it. Our entrees were delicious though. I had the tuna and my husband had the duck, and both meals were excellent. We also ordered the asparagus which we loved, and the cream corn with lobster which we sent back. It just was not good and seemed as if it can straight from a can. We also ordered dessert which was fantastic.  Overall, we had an enjoyable night although I don't think it is worth a second visit.

KcW1bOjVHyDp0bud3gI3sQ.text: This place is so great.  I almost don't want to write a review just so I can hoard the goodness all for myself next time.  It's stumbling distance to/from the Wynn or Slot's of Fun depending on how fancy pants you are feeling afterwards. I just can't say enough good stuff about it from the outdoor lounge to the beautiful leather interior.  It's very intimate and the steaks are just incredible. I had to be restrained from gnawing on the bone  with my bare hands by the wife.  You could pay more on the proper strip for a lesser meal with a "named chef" or you could go to a place like this which is definitely a unique Vegas experience. What an oasis in tourist hell. This will be a mandatory annual pilgrimage from now on.

aGlCxnu34bZIztAZKH5WfA.text: Had an amazing dinner with my girlfriend on a Sat night. If you're looking to get off the strip for some great food and service, this is the spot. Touch of old Vegas in a random location. Cool,  cool, cool. Had the short rib, was fall apart tender. Gfriend had the filet, also great. Creme brulee was fantastic.

JE-b6S51eOgaXg47P-habA.text: We really enjoyed our experience at the Barrymore, it has kind of an old-school Vegas vibe and the food was outstanding. The wine selection was good and our waiter was friendly and helpful. Best of all, we loved the food! We had a steak, a shrimp and pasta dish (the shrimp were huge and very tasty) and the European Sea Bass which was one of the best fish dishes I've had in recent memory. The sides were really good, especially the Brussel Sprouts, and they're big, one will definitely cover 2 people. This place is a little ways off the strip but worth the drive or cab fare, highly recommended!

Sw41Om037Oh3xebDS4VPTg.text: Gorgeous atmosphere, very hip vipe. Thought the food was very good but didn't like the fact that didn't allow subsitutions which we never seem to run across these days.  The food was expensive but we thought the quality was there with the exception of the unripe tomatoes in the panzanella salad.  We thought the hotel was fine, not as shabby as we expected but definitely not reflective of such a great restaurant. We also thought the small bar was very nice and the location was around a mile from the Wynn so it's easy to get to.

2J6RGtFiimRDYGEt0b09aQ.text: It was a great hidden gem! Great food, service, amd atmosphere. A really perfect meal.

9FaAPTGI-CfeYvoyl8tNOw.text: One of the best restaurants in Las Vegas our service was outstanding Israel was the best.

Icgdrji3uwlSrbbXnF380A.text: I came to visit some friends in Vegas and WOW did I ever get a treat!  No one on our group had ever been to the Barrymore before, so we certainly were in for a surprise.  From the greeting, food, impressive wine list, managerial staff, and ambience this is a place I will come back to, as well as recommend to ALL who come to Vegas!

vZSjwX8N8Cubf5J8Lxjj9w.text: Prepare to travel back into time at The Barrymore, a place so cool you expect to find the Rat Pack at a back table. I went there while in Vegas for my B-Day and the food was great, the ambiance was perfect, and the staff was exceptional. Will absolutely go back.

qJbWJSeNEbj0nDhxHuNUIQ.text: Such a nice surprise considering this restaurant is located in a little known Vegas hotel.  Great decor...cozy, quaint and quite chic...love that the music fit the decor too!  Service was good, but nothing incredible.  The food was quite tasty - we enjoyed the caesar salad, free range chicken and the scallops.  Love that I got a free glass of sparkling wine for checking in on Foursquare - bonus!

MeQKFJZkWrwMyDYRKjH10w.text: This place should have 4 $$$$. I wasnt able to view the menu on my phone, but went anyway with kids - big mistake. There is nothing for kids to eat at all. The steak was $48 without any sides. We decided to order 3 appetizers. Two were just ok - lobster mac n chz and fried green tomato with crab meat. The lobster bisque was disgusting we didnt eat more than one bite each and no one asked if anything was wrong. The best thing we ate were the side of french fries I ordered for the kids. Total bill with tip was $78.

R1DUduV98reryqg6m3QPnQ.text: What a pleasant surprise! Everything was exceptional here! The service, the food, and the ambiance. The steak was cooked perfectly and sea bass was wonderful! The mushrooms for a side were outstanding! Definitely recommend and would go back! A hidden gem!

d9MgwC_Qodtx6DfRsOUz1A.text: Here are my thoughts:  Made a reservation for a Sunday evening, got to the place and it was empty, really?  The steak we ordered was tasty and cooked just like we liked it. The cesar salad and lobster bisque where yummyyy, and also the complimentary bread, but the short ribs had to much fat and where a little burnt. I  Was not to crazy about the drinks either. So if you have extra cash give it a try and I hope your experience is much better than mine.

XrAqb4CqpHjdPKlO7BcC0Q.text: The Barrymore has a killer menu, fantastic staff, a well priced wine list, and is a Vegas restaurant you must try before it gets too popular. Largest serving of foie gras I think I've ever been served. Lobster mac n cheese was to die for. This is a must try!

01-tnn8mi7IaNsiA_5d2Bg.text: Killer food. Lobster mac, and cheese!!!

cTitLDmsAXzt3FMnJpOZIg.text: This is in a small resort slightly off the strip it used to be a little known gem but is now quite popular in the local and tourist scene you will want to make reservations.  The whole aspect of this restaurant has been thought out, the food and the ambiance.  The hostesses, wait staff and bartenders will make this a experience to remember.  The Decor is a retro Hollywood with huge booths where you feel like you're in the middle of a mobbish Hollywood movie (think the movie Casino and old 30's 40's Hollywood), reserve a booth if you eat inside.  If you come on a time of year where the weather allows for it, eat outside on the patio they have an amazing firewall so fun to sit and watch.    A lot of prior reviewers will tell you to get the burger, it is great but there are other options I enjoyed as well.  The Lobster Deviled eggs with caviar is a fun interesting, worth the price in my opinion because it is not something I have heard of before but not amazing.  The lobster mac-n-cheese made me reminisce about childhood but remember I am an adult ;) The seared foie comes with a sweet sauce and a toast the buttery flavors of the foie with the sweet flavors of the sauce amazing.  I also recommend the roasted artichoke they have a different take on an old favorite of mine.  On to the main courses as I said earlier the burger is highly recommended but I feel there are better items to choose from, here are a couple I have had.  If you are into Lamb with potato sauce, snap peas, au jus it is extremely good very flavorful with a full blend of the sauces and the meat.  I also enjoyed the braised short rib comes with carrots onions a bacon sauce and au ju.  Braised just enough on the outside and perfection with the rest.  I have also had one of the seasonal pastas the one I had at the time was a truffle ravioli with a buttery truffle sauce but they change all the time so I cannot recommend the one I chose. For sides I enjoyed the asparagus with parmesan gratin, the creamed spinach and the creamed corn with lobster and bacon.    They have pretty much any kind of drinks both alcoholic, non-alcoholic plus specialty drinks and a amazing wine list to chose from.  The menu does change slightly with season and chefs moods so not everything besides the main menu will remain the same.

rsKlh8dGXl985RdAZWq76g.text: One of the best meals I have ever had in Vegas before!!!!!! This restaurant is not on the strip inside some fancy shmancy hotel, it's a bit off the strip pass Wynn but not far at all. We walked from our hotel (treasure island) and it took around 20-25 minutes. It is a restaurant inside of an hotel and once you walk into the hotel lobby the restaurant is to the left. Walking into the restaurant we were greeted by the hostess right away and they bought the three of us to a booth inside. It was a very simple yet elegant restaurant. They have a display of wine in glass cases and it was beautiful.   Before coming to the restaurant we did our research (ie yelped all the pictures, read some reviews and tips, and memorize the menu) so before the server ask if we had any question we already had a good idea about what we were gonna order. Of course we still asked for recommendations especially with the drinks because that's one menu we did not memorize. After ordering drinks for the table they bought over some bread and butter. The bread was so good...I don't know if we were famished from a day of clubbing but it was so good but I had to control myself so I can fit in all the other food.   For appetizer we ordered the seared foie gras to share! GET IT!!! Shoot you should get two of it! It was perfectly seared and the bread that it came with made the perfect combination. For entree my friend got the Chilean sea bass and I got the steak with my other friend and we shared the Mac and cheese as a side. ORDER THE MAC AND CHEESE! It has the perfect crunch on top of some gooey cheese giving you a crunch with each bite. My steak was perfectly seasoned and cooked just the way I like it. My friends Chilean sea bass was also amazing, very fresh and the miso glaze was just right, not too heavy or light.   Next time you're in Vegas give this place a shot, the prices are fairly cheaper compared to all those other fancy restaurant on the strips and you get an amazing meal with wonderful accommodating servers.

VaMEMBzslb4fCSTSbpw3XA.text: This place is a bit away from the Strip and thus not have a lot people. The steak was Okay, not impressed me that much but the crab cake as appetizer was the best I have ever had!

GR4EWd4BIgzdBdJ0cfRCgQ.text: We dined here a few years ago. Super romantic and great old Vegas vibe.  We had plans to dine here tonight and. They had a table of about 15 in the main room.  Screaming, yelling, cussing and being obnoxious.  We left. Headed to another steakhouse for a romantic dinner. Sorry Barrymore - you guys are not a table of 15 party vibe place.  Other couples dining looked not thrilled also - hope that big ass table full of jerks tipped y'all well.

inCgY6sOp0TJCyYenapzrQ.text: This place is great! Took 13 guys here for my buddy's bachelor party last Friday and the entire staff couldn't be more accommodating. They put together a massive table for us, entertained us with some great descriptions of the steaks of the steak while the tables were being set up, and just made the overall experience great. Most importantly, the steaks, sea bass, pork chops, and all other dishes we have were great! Every single person enjoyed their meal. Very reasonable prices as well. Will definitely be coming back next time I'm in town.

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States

12xDNnp3bgF9bd84v8OKAQ.text: Once you enter through the heavy and elegant  white door of The Barrymore, you can tell that this will be quite the neat experience.   We were greeted by Paul, the manager of the place and his presence off the bat was friendly and endearing. He sat us down quickly and introduced us to the wine and food menus. He gave us a few moments to look through the wines- a nice assortment from different regions across the world. We were then introduced to Israel, the "jack of all trades" at the restaurant. After consultation with both gentlemen, we decided on a white "Les Abeilles," and we couldn't be more satisfied.   We started with the Lobster Mac n Cheese, Israel letting us know it's a crowd favorite. The Marscapone and freshly made shell pasta complimented the slices of lobster quite well. The assortment of warm breads that were brought to the table were also a great plus, and the butter was room temperature- not even some swanky restaurants on the strip do that!   My partner and I were both craving sea bass, so we ordered both kinds: Chilean sea bass and European.  The European sea bass was crisp on the outside and thinly sliced, paired with a saffron ratatouille and spices. It was a great pairing.  The Chilean sea bass was seared on the top  and a smooth texture on the inside, perfectly cooked. It was placed on an English pea risotto that was so creamy and delectable, that alone I'd fly back for. After trying both dishes, superb in their own styles, I would recommend the Chilean sea bass if you only wanted to order one- you won't regret it.   We finished our meal with a dulce de leche cake and a strawberry compote and ice cream. A fresh finish to a savory meal.   Throughout our entire eating experience, I commend the staff for being engaging and accommodating to our every need. They were friendly, thoughtful, and had great conversation to give to folks while they dined at their establishment.   And to top it all off, Israel introduced us to the legendary Joe Vento, house musician who played alongside some of the greats on the Vegas strip throughout the decades. He's a regular at The Barrymore, playing routinely at the hotel piano in the lobby right outside the restaurant. If you catch him performing, or find him dining in the restaurant, make sure you have a conversation with him. Who knows, he may just play a ballad or two. :)  And so I finish with this- if you are one who frequently visits Las Vegas or it's your first time, take some time to indulge yourself in all that is the Barrymore. Don't hesitate to make the trip a little off the strip to have some great food in an intimate environment.   So what are you waiting for..?

elJApRSRsGZk9hGqTwF16g.text: Had my wedding dinner/reception here and it was top notch. The food was great and the service was impeccable.  Kirk, Brian and their staff were efficient, capable and in synch with mine and my guest's needs. I also worked with one of their event staff/coordinators who was equally as amazing (and her name is Ku'uipo). Don't let the lackluster hotel exterior deter you from the cool restaurant atmosphere. Local and out of town guests (did I mention I'm from CA?), don't fret...if you need a uniquely beautiful, high end establishment to host a party then go to The Barrymore.  Their peeps will take care of your peeps!

OIwsmFi2MTboLsngb4iTFA.text: Awesome place ! Best service ! Great food! Very intimate / romantic setting ! Most def white glove service

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetable risotto

3CgU9Z2fdwzo38aDjhMmnQ.text: Unique ambiance that has an "old Vegas" charm with a modern twist. We decided to dine al fresco at their beautiful patio, which reminded me of Vinter Grill meets the Pottery Barn catalogue. We settled for appetizers & drinks. We ordered the Watermelon & Grilled Beet Salad with Goat Cheese, Rock Shrimp with Fried Calamari, and the Grilled Octopus. Wow...delicious!! The shrimp & calamari was crispy, the watermelon salad was refreshing...seasoned beautifully. Overall great food, service & ambiance. A little on the pricey side...but if the food is great along with the service & a decent size food portion, then I don't mind paying for quality.

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful Outdoor Patio with Firewall.
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Watermelon &amp; Grilled Beet Salad topped with Goat Cheese. Fried Rock Shrimp with Calamari.

l7YMbiuKfDGjQ7VhtCs4xg.text: A strong 4 stars!  I came here most recently because I was wanting a place with a unique feel and wonderful ambiance for dinner... and was entirely happy with the choice of The Barrymore! The atmosphere is exceptional. Old film reels line the ceiling in the main dining area and the surrounding aesthetics compliment with a feel from yesteryear.  The food is consistently 4 star quality-- with the occasional 5 star standout and the less occasional 3 star encounter. The menu changes seasonally, but I've had a lot of love for the fish entrees and as a result haven't ventured too far from those options as a main course goes. More memorable though, have been some of the starters. Their Foie Gras used to come with peach gobbler and more recently it has been Pan Seared and accented with clementine confit and citrus jus. They do a good job of pairing it with fruits that enhance the natural flavors of the foie. The octopus has a beautiful texture and taste. Lobster Mac & Cheese isn't usually my favorite, but I liked sharing it here specifically because of the truffle essence and mascarpone-tallegio cream sauce. We enjoyed the Steak Tartare with pickled shimeji mushroom and quail egg. The mushrooms were a pleasant, rightfully earthy addition, but generally speaking wasn't as memorable as some of the other options.  They also make quality drinks at The Barrymore. Their menu is dominated with white spirits and a good selection of gin, but I have had a couple real nice whiskey based drinks after talking to the bartender for a bit.  While I would come in for the food, the setting has consistently been the impetus for my return visits...I am a sucker for nice ambiance though. Still, this isn't my choice for a romantic meal, just for special/memorable experiences.

cZQ_6IF_JHgKG-y_vB_pRA.text: Private, great fusion of dead animal cuisine, including steak, ribs, and lobster.  Awesome grilled artichoke and mac and cheese lobster with truffle sauce.

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creme brûlée with apricot honey sorbet and candied pistachios
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet mignon blue
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duck confeit

IXQiS3Hitw1TysrlBmKueg.text: What is not to like the food is amazing we love it because it is a hidden jem the place is nothing to look at on the outside but as soon as you step in the place is very posh recommend

EBCV2HbVGdVD7kP9_trJRg.text: The restaurant was beautiful and the food was delicious!   The service could have been better, specifically the bartenders.  They weren't very personable and seemed annoyed that they had to wait on us.  We had to constantly ask them for things instead of them asking us.

9SH2qXFNfkcXN9eAgXE23A.text: 2 stars- terrible service and only a couple good dishes.  The Barrymore is beautiful inside, with people singing and nice lighting. I had made a reservation for my birthday. When I arrived they told me 10 minutes and as I waited with my party, the phone at the hostess desk rang un-answered constantly. This should have been a sign.  Once seated my boyfriend was unhappy about the booth, but it didn't bother me. Then it took at least 20 minutes for anyone to come over and take drinks. Another 20 for bread to arrive. Then the bottle of champagne came out that we ordered and we were told it had been chilling, we can feel the bottle if we would like, but we may want it a bit colder. I tasted it and it was room temperature.... so it had to sit for 20 minutes in ice. The sommelier however was amazing and made me a chair out of the cage on the bottle. Then after being there an hour we got to order.  We were pressured by the waiter to all get appetizers and entrees and that they didn't come with sides just garnishments so we needed that too. He seemed offended when not all of us wanted appetizers. It took 40 more minutes for the food to come. Once it did half of the party enjoyed their dinner, half did not enjoy it. The bread, octopus and Brussels sprouts were all fantastic, my salmon was good with the hollandaise. Both of the fish dinners came with sides, the steak did not. My boyfriend's steak was charred on the outside and tasted burned, but the inside was blue, not just rare, blue. He was bummed especially since he ordered it medium rare. They also brought me the wrong dinner at first, so I had to wait a bit longer for my dinner as well.  I was so excited to go to The Barrymore and bring 4 friends. I've been talking about going for the last year and now I wished I had picked somewhere else for my birthday. It took 2 1/2 hours to eat dinner and it seemed their service was pushy when there and overall unattentive. They are only looking for you to spend as much as possible and don't care about your experience. Except for the sommelier, he was lovely.

z0fc0R_-6Ps6miI0H1offw.text: Thank you,  Barrymore for hosting our wedding reception of 30+ in the Gold Room. Everything was perfect from the room/table set-up, the service and the food...oh the food!   All of our guests could not stop raving about the food. I'll skip straight to the mains - the stand-outs were Morrocan Lamb shank and Bone-in Ribeye as a menu add-on (definitely worth the extra $15pp on prixe fixe menu)! I can't remember the last time we had a nice steak out at a restaurant...man, was it good! Heard the lamb shank was fall-off the bone tender and commented in how it was the best they'd had and we're from Australia where they do lamb right (next to NZ ;).  Desserts were also a winners - Chocolate Pot de creme and Guava cheesecake.  If you are curious,  we had Crispy Rock Shrimp, Lump Crab Cake and Lobster Bisque for starters.  Service was excellent and very accomodating and attentive - thank you Sergio, Luis and staff.  Also, a huge THANK YOU to our fellow Yelpers for helping me find this gem - without you guys we wouldn't have a clue where to go!!

ygQYab1TA3WbpHa9bzzzWA.text: I like the food here love the atmosphere great service. The lobster was a little dry.  I got a free glass of wine for yelping.  Overall okay not Wow! Kinna Wow on the bill thought lol...  check out our bill.   I don't know if we were overcharged didn't know what the actual price was didn't check assuming it was correct???

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our bill

aZHbAv74R3_VDnpVKDB9Kw.text: I had been wanting to try the Barrymore for quite some time, so we finally decided to give it a try this weekend. First and foremost, this place is tiny! You will definitely want to make a reservation to ensure that you get a table. The dining room is small and kind of dark. The weird wallpaper does nothing but darken the place up even more. The ceiling is really cool and I think with a lighter wallpaper it would really showcase the awesome ceiling.   Our meal started with the bread basket and we were not disappointed. The bacon raison bread was really delicious and the warm baguette slices were also a great touch. The parmesan crisps were also good, I even added a few to my pasta.   I started with the Roasted Heirloom Beets and was so happy I did. I love a good beet salad and they have a great beet salad. The goat cheese fritter was a really inventive touch. Everything on the plate worked well together and I tried to savor every bite. My husband started with the lobster mac and cheese. I really liked that it was creamy, but I didn't really think the lobster added anything to the dish.   My husband and I both chose specials for the night. I went with the pappardelle pasta with a pork belly ragu and escarole. The escarole added a nice bitter flavor and the pork ragu was very savory. The pasta was delicate and delicious. I was very happy with the dish and had enough to bring some home. My husband had a surf and turf special of a filet of bison and lobster tail. The bison was so tender and delicate, I really enjoyed the few bites I was able to steal.  No meal is complete without dessert, so we moved on to the creme brulee. The creme brulee was perfectly done and the spiced pears added such an amazing flavor, it really worked well. The oatmeal cookie ice cream didn't bring much to the dish, but it was still really yummy. I definitely want to eat all future creme brulee with spiced pears!  We were not disappointed with our meal and I would definitely head back to the Barrymore again...soon!

TeUxz7ypuBI2bvFnu2asXg.text: Hmm... Okay. We were super excited to go to the Barrymore because the photos on Yelp were enticing, and we felt like we were destined for an exceptional meal a bit off the beaten path. The location is very convenient to the (North) Strip but does also feel like a secret. It's in a hotel- I can't recall the name, but it appears to be one of those old-becomes-new-and-trendy situations. You walk into a big, dramatic door in the hotel lobby and the restaurant has great ambience- dark and sultry. There was live music playing in another room but we could hear it through the speakers. That's about where the experience peaked... 1) only one person per table can get the free "check-in." Okay, fine. 2) the service is best described as... Aloof. Granted, one of our party is hard to please, but she was actually on her best behavior. She didn't care for her wine, and the whole process of appeasing her was handled fairly dismissively by both the server and the man who I can only guess is the manager. Every time they came to the table the vibe was almost one of annoyance. 3) everything was overcooked. Except for the lobster mac, which was tasty, but not amazing. But between our sea bass, lamb shank, and short ribs, there was just a little too much time on the heat.  It wasn't awful, but it wasn't worth the money nor the taxi ride. In Vegas you come to expect competitive restaurant experiences, and the Barrymore was just lazy. Maybe it was just a bad night...

9h7HknwjVqGMzDIxAgl5AA.text: What a great surprise in such an unexpected place. My husband and I came here last night and loved it.  It's a nice, simple, old-school place when you're looking for something classic. We shared the grilled octopus appetizer which was perfectly tender. I had the filet with French fries and my husband had the Kobe flat iron with creamed corn. Both were delicious and cooked exactly how we wanted.  I'm a pastry chef, who normally avoids dessert, but I have to rave about the chocolate praline macaron dessert. It was a large size chocolate macaron with hazelnut chantilly, sugared hazelnuts, caramel sauce, and a tuile. It was sooooo good that I wished I would've gotten another.  Excellent place that we'll definitely return to next time we come to Vegas.

hSFMRTzDrG_6ianjXRzZwQ.text: Wow! This place was great. I went here for a fancy night out and was very impressed with the atmosphere and the food. It's a very intimate, dark setting, and pretty cozy -- I think they only seat 50.  Anyway, we started off our meal with the grilled octopus appetizer, which was superb. Fresh, springy texture yet tender and soft. The seasoning was just right and even though the legs looked charred, they were also quite soft.   For the main course, I got the duck special, which had duck breast on top of this duck and bean mixture. The breast was very moist and flavorful. The bean mixture had bits of duck mixed in and was also good, though a tad salty. My boyfriend got the Shortrib 'Bourguignon' that comes with carrots, potatoes, and pearl onions. I thought it was quite yummy. The meat was so soft that it pulled apart easily with a fork and the glaze was really tasty. Despite what looked like a relatively small portion of food, the both of us were quite sated, although we always have room for dessert....  We finished off with the creme brulee -- SO GOOD! It came with a scoop of ice cream, spiced pears, and a sweet chip on top and the carmelized sugar gave such a satisfying crunch when we dug into the custard.  The only thing was the entrance looks like part of a wall that was partially ajar in the hotel lobby of the Royal Resort and it was kind of heavy, so we weren't sure it was open. If you see this, just pull really hard and be on your way! Also this place is on the North end of the Strip away from most of the action so it's good for a quiet date.

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creme brulee
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shortrib &#39;Bourguignon&#39;
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duck breast

LgkgzoSd_4oWjf2hAOOmnQ.text: The atmosphere is fantastic but the food was just okay. I had the Chilean Seabass and it was just bland and unexciting. For the price I would expect to be wowed a little more when it came to the quality of food. The cocktails I had were done well and the service was excellent. The 3 stars is mostly based on the overall value I took away from the experience.

9aHMdvkwlLCsvhBr4TFaPA.text: Dinner was amazing! We first had the foie gras which was incredible and the bone marrow appetizers. We then had the fillet mignon which was perfectly prepared. Our friend had the lobster mac and cheese, and she loved it as well. We will be back

xLLbONIBvktMNt2yVtcZZA.text: Can't say enough about the amazing dry aged ribeye.  Worth every penny!  The sauteed spinach was even delish!  And the mashed potatoes. AND they served us at the high-boy table we sat at in the lounge so we could listen to the great singer.  AND - Yelp users - make sure you note that they will give you a free glass of wine when you check in on the app.  Loved using that!  Oh...I did walk into the dining room to see what it looked like...we're coming back!  BEAUTIFUL

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful lighting and ambiance.

r0-axCzy1grU1T1D6k_4-Q.text: We showed up for a reservation and were seated immediately for a fixed three course menu. The time between plates was extremely long and the service was not a pleasant experience. I rated 3 stars because the food was at least good.

YABOVr6D_vTuFOhVlI8h0g.text: A work group made a reservation at the Barrymore due to its proximity to the LV Convention Center. The restaurant ambiance was surprisingly intimate and unique, playing off a film theme, considering that it is housed in an aged hotel.   The food was all prepared well and deserving of 4 stars. The artichoke appetizer and the lobster mac and cheese were the most memorable.   The only downfall to our experience was the excessively slow service. Dinner took over three hours for three courses, so I would not recommend coming here if you are on a schedule.

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pistachio creme brûlée
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Entrance to the Barrymore
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside the main dining area

qGoFAvU7ZwqA0mMtp5CI4A.text: Service is impeccable food is excellent.  Prices are average for high end Las Vegas restaurants.  Lastly it's off the strip do there's easy access and plenty of free parking right next to the restaurant.

ATgHyh8xGhkCwGhof306fA.text: Last minute birthday dinner and had a fantastic experience. Gorgeous interior. Intimate setting. Prompt friendly service throughout the night.   Shared the Lobster Mac n Cheese as an appetizer. We CLEANED the bowl with the bread. It was that delicious.   Shared the Porterhouse special with double baked potato with a friend. They pre cut the steak for you and you could taste the age-ing! Often times, I can't tell if it was aged or not, but Barrymore's steaks are definitely aged, and aged well.  The double baked potato was divine! They bake, then scoop, and blend the middle and put back into the shell with cheese on top. It was fluffy, smooth, whipped goodness.   Also checked in to get the free sparkling - which I ended up order the bottle. They even got us to go cups to take the rest with us!  Again, service was great. Ambiance was great. Had a good time and good food. Hidden gem indeed.

Cp48x48gB39P7EI6HCKtbQ.text: My wife and I had an amazing anniversary dinner here. A total hidden gem that stood out in contrast to overpriced, underwhelming restaurants in Vegas. This one is near the convention center, just south of the Wynn, in an unassuming hotel. Our server, Ashley, was so attentive, thoughtful, and knowledgeable. We could listen to her describe the menu items all day! There was also live music and the singer was very talented. Drinks are prohibition-style, but they can make anything you like. We had filet mignon and a wagyu steak. Both were cooked perfectly medium rare. It's a small restauarant, so we do recommend this for an intimate, romantic meal rather than a family dinner. Can't say enough good things about this place!

1EloJlQzSQ0kaWtwLLQMmw.text: My new favorite restaurant!! Every single thing we ate was so good. Appetizers, steaks, sides, desserts... some of the best food I've ever had! The ambiance and live music was perfect!

LMttuOUz0IDTWhejYRgZHw.text: Went to the Barrymore tonight and was seated promptly. Our server, Luis, offers us the drink menu. We decline and he pushed. We decline again and he stared at us and said "no?" . We again said "no, thank you" he walked away- seemingly annoyed. We brushed it off. The food was fine. Mushrooms were good, bacon was good, lobster mac and cheese tasted off, shrimp scampi was tasty but one of three shrimp had not been cleaned properly. Realistically speaking if I'm paying 30 dollars for 3 shrimp and noodles, please make sure the shrimp is at least clean. After dinner we waited an exact hour before we saw our server again who offered us dessert. At that point we were ready to leave but he insisted that we get dessert because we were celebrating a birthday. "Please, it's on me!" We obliged and ordered the dark chocolate ice cream. It was grainy and tasteless. He came by to ask how things were and we asked for the check. He asked if we liked the ice cream- we said "not really but thank you" he said "well it's not on your bill anyway" and walked away. Look the food is fine- but the service is just garbage.

fDnwC_Et_-xAS8auyGmbqQ.text: The atmosphere is fabulous. The food ranks up there with Las Vegas Strip fare.  But they're a bit disorganized.  Waited a bit too long for our waiter to introduce himself and they mixed up the doggie bags, which for those of us going to separate residences can be a problem.  Would go back, however.

duZe_HGARcW2bTByDgsKkA.text: Came here with my husband last weekend. The service was astounding, entrees were great, and the house cocktails were very tasty. I ordered the wagyu flat iron steak and my husband had the ribeye, both were amazing and did not disappoint. We had the twice baked potato and Parmesan risotto for sides, which were also very good. One area we felt could use some improvement were the appetizers. The bone morrow and tuna tartar were honestly just average, at best. Overall, I do recommend this restaurant for a nice reasonably-priced steak dinner right off the strip.

pmgtwc0-GSlDJHa_ruRSgQ.text: Yummy!!! This place was amazing!  Great food, good lounge singer, loves the outdoor patio.   Had the Vegetarian curry and lobster corn, to die for! The salmon with bok Choy was made to Perfection  Shout out to our server , Shon!!! You Rock!

uKj1MAswjqxnWZaTnBIxLQ.text: We went to the Barrymore for an intimate family dinner. The decor of the restaurant was cozy, yet luxurious. But on to the good stuff: The food. Which was delicious, but frankly, having read the reviews and for the price (which isn't unreasonable, but certainly not inexpensive) I expected nothing less.   For appetizers we had the lobster Mac and cheese and the diver scallops. The mac and cheese was very creamy, but slightly slacking in seasoning and lobster in my opinion. The scallop entree however, was delicious, and of that, we finished every last bite. For entrees, we had the bone-in rib eye, with lobster, and the Chilean sea bass on risotto. We also ordered a side of the twice-baked potato. ALL THE ENTREES (and side) WERE COOKED AND SEASONED TO PERFECTION. That being said, the lobster was hands-down our favorite part of the entire meal. OMG so buttery I could die LOL  What really blew me away at the Barrymore however, was the service. For starters, we originally made our late dinner reservations for 9:30, however as our show was running late, we wouldn't be able to make that time. I called to request if we could push our reservations back to 9:45/10 and the hostess was more than happy to accommodate. Moreover, throughout our meal, our servers were also extremely attentive and kind without being overbearing. They truly made it a point to make us feel special and to make sure we were enjoying our meal and ourselves, which made our experience just that much more enjoyable. And to add to the already wonderful meal, they brought us a complimentary piece of chocolate cake, which was a dessert/chocolate lovers dream! (Get it and you won't regret it )  Overall, if you're looking for a place to have a delicious and classy dinner, I highly recommend the Barrymore. We will definitely be paying them another visit some time soon

Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thank you to the Barrymore for a wonderful meal and a lovely evening

9VyHx_LPgcx9hv5W1rRSbw.text: Our go-to dinner place when we come to Vegas. Great retro vibe, amazing cocktails, solid good food (lobster Mac n cheese, fois gras, bone marrow, surf n surf - Chilean sea bass and lobster), wedge salad), and wonderful wait staff, especially the waiter Luiz, who remembered us from our last visit 1 1/2 years ago. Really worth coming to!

2UBcXP76S8-D8Mfnm_eKfg.text: Wow! Visited here last month and the food was amazing and the cocktails were just as good! Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Not usually a cocktail fan but could have drunk these all night!

8fLULjaYEPOLHppVL-YrcA.text: The Barrymore was a fantastic experience, my husband & I loved it from beginning to end    Our server Ashley was so amazing & gracious, she guided us thru the menu taking her expertise to heart   Our steaks were amazing, tender cooked to perfection and y'all must order the cream corn & lobster deliciousness  Well worth the price   We will definitely be back

fw15nAD-sDS7mnZ--k6AJA.text: This restaurant is located in a small hotel just off Las Vegas blvd. We were not aware of the existence of either the hotel or the restaurant as it is easy to miss. The restaurant is a bit small but with a nice a decor.  For our appetizer we ordered the crab cake. We got one medium size crab-cake with a lot of meat.  The appetizer was very good. For our main entree we ordered the Chilean sea bass and Leg of Lamb. The Chilean Sea Bass was just average, there was nothing special to it. The Leg of Lamb was also decent but not memorable. As a side we had the Cream Corn Lobster which was delicious.  The service was also very slow, I was expecting a higher level of service. Overall, the place is just ok. There were good dishes, but not all of them were up to standards.  Note: The Barrymore has some small plates and drinks on happy hour until 7PM.

MRMGyfaabpCbwNzrK_PpYQ.text: My husband and I came here last night for our 1 year anniversary & absolutely LOVED it. The manager and the two bartenders helping us were amazing and just had such genuine smiles and happiness. I cannot wait to come back and I'm already planning on having my birthday dinner here (next May.) :)   Thank you soooo much for an amazing time, the food was amazing and my mojito mocktail rocked!

y8n9yrvoSgm3cqn7cvMoUw.text: This restaurant seems very out of place. The outside of the hotel is kind of, well, icky looking. As we were walking in all dressed up, I kept looking at my husband like "WTF are we doing right now?"  It was actually a really nice, well-decorated establishment though. The service was incredibly attentive but our steaks were overcooked. This is definately a place where you need to order your meat one level less than you really want it. (Order "rare" for "medium rare".) They would have re-cooked our meat and offered us free desert but we declined both.   All in all, I was surprised at what this place is relative to what it is.

rf9LVnmmYx2tc3csaTncpA.text: This steak house is the secret gem of Las Vegas.  The food and service is top notch. It's slightly off the strip so parking is much easier. You get the experience of a high end strip steakhouse without all the hassle. The decor is old school classy and the food is sassy the perfect combination!

jCMeXIEjKhOiLsxqplgo2Q.text: My close friends threw their wedding reception here and we were instantly taken back to the 1920's and practically dinning with the Great Gatsby himself! What a lavish dinner party it was! Please try not to mind the Royal Resort lobby too much as it is a little on the shabby side. The Barrymore makes up for the desperately needed renovation of the Royal Resort that is located off the strip.   Taking a shuttle bus from the wedding ceremony at the Aria to The Barrymore, pre dinner drinks were held at The Barrymore bar prior to seating. Once our seating was ready we were summoned into the dinning room that is lavish in royal blue table cloths, vintage gold wallpaper, a shiny gold ceiling covered with old film reels and a floor to ceiling wine cabinet that sectioned off the lounge and the dining room. The old hollywood glitz and glam vibe was spot on!   The beautifully framed dinner menu consisted of:  Starters  CESAR SALAD LOBSTER MAC AND CHEESE   Entrees  PASTA & SHRIMP ROASTED CHICKEN  SHORT RIB   Dessert  CHOCOLATE CAKE  LEMON CHEESE CAKE   Our table ordered everything except the pasta and short rib, so I was lucky to have tried almost the entire menu. EVERYTHING was exquisite! I initially ordered the Cesar salad as a starter and it was good, but once I tried that lobster Mac and cheese I quickly regretted my decision! Lol Here is where the Barrymore gets 5 stars for service; upon ordering the chicken entree with fingerling potatoes and veggies, we asked our server if it would be possible to pass along any extra lobster Mac and cheeses that might be  laying around, as a side dish. She informed us that there wasn't anything extra laying around, but, the chef could cook us up another lobster Mac and cheese! We were thrilled! And even more thrilled to be served such high quality food! Not like your typical over stocked banquet food with your traditional flavorless meat and fish options laying around in the back.   During dinner I asked the manager what the history behind The Barrymore was, as I thought there must be some correlation to Drew Barrymore and her family. The manager informed me that the restaurant isn't ran by the starlit family, but rather named after Drew Barrymore's grandfather. He also shared that they have Drew Barrymore's wine in stock! How cool is that?!   The chocolate cake was rich. The lemon cheese cake was out of this world. It had little mini lemon wafers on top that offered a zesty kick. Post dessert, heartfelt and humorous speeches were given by the maid of honor and best man. And to finish off the night, the groom gave a thank you speech. The restaurant was kind enough to select bottles of fine tequila to fill the little jarrito shot glasses brought as a present from the Grooms uncle, all the way from Mexico, and  counted as the final toast.   I glanced over at the Bride and Groom and everyone enjoying their meal. I was savoring the moment. Savoring the food and the complete bliss I had for my childhood friend-for the Newly Weds!

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Newly Wed&#39;s Table at The Barrymore in Vegas.
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Roasted Chicken with fingerling potatoes and veggies at The Barrymore in Vegas.
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The lemon cheesecake at The Barrymore in Vegas.

37meoQkiToYkbKqIAyZwHw.text: Just based on food I would give this place 4 stars, but because the experience was weird we knocked off one star. We ordered the Smoked Bacon and the Lobster Mac and Cheese for appetizer.  Very satisfying.  The bacon was tender.. so so tender and tasted so good.  The Lobster Mac had truffle oil in which I loved.  It was creamy and it had a perfect lobster to pasta ratio. For entree we ordered the Chilean Seabass and the Braised Short Rib and the Oscar Fries (fries topped Oscar style with crab and sauce).  The Seabass was amazing tender with a crispy crust and it was drenched in sauce which I like.  The Short Rib was delicious.  Super tender.. just wish they added a little more of the jus. The Oscar Fries were HORRIBLE.  The sauce from the "oscar" tasted like mayo and mustard mixed and it left you with an after taste that was not pleasant.  The waitress said it was "SOOOO GOOD".   It wasn't!  It was "SOOOO BAD".   Their staff needs to be better trained at visiting tables.  Two different employees came to our table without introducing themselves just very dryly asked "how's is everything".  Then walked away.  It was just so weird the way they did it.

5UYoTYGDUHmobBVlFq_A_g.text: Food was great! We literally ordered everything on the appetizer and entree menu. The steak is cooked perfectly, the lobster mac was great and the octopus was cooked perfectly. The only reason I do give this restaurant a 5 star was because of the party that was seated next to us the entire time. They were extremely loud and obnoxious. Not the restaurants fault, but there food should have been brought out before anyone else's as that is the only time they stayed quite enough. I would definitely relocate this to restaurant to somewhere on the strip.

VJ3DLiFFdlOO0ccrznhBuA.text: The Barrymore, what a hidden gem!   My friend and I decided to try 3 new restaurants one night (apps, dinner, dessert) and chose The Barrymore as our first destination. We tasted only a few of their cocktails and small bites.  It's located inside the Royal Resort on the corner of Las Vegas Blvd and Convention Center Dr. It looks cozy and inviting from the outside with a long fireplace against the exterior wall. Once you walk inside the Royal Resort, you make a left to enter the restaurant.  The inside is stunning. Dark, vintage like decor. Makes a very intimate dinner/drinks setting.  The hostess greeted us right away and asked if we had reservations. We told her didn't and requested to sit at the bar which was completely empty on a Tuesday night. Our bartender, Corey, was friendly and had a very impressive mustache! He engaged with us in conversation and provided several useful recommendations.  For a drink I went with The Barrymore (big surprise I know!) which is their take of an Old Fashioned ($14). Strong and tasty not to my surprise with the zest of orange to add some flavor.  Corey told us the chef created an updated menu that launched 4 days ago on a Friday. The chef changed up a few menu items and we were excited to be one of the firsts to try. We decided to order the Grilled Octopus and the pan seared Foie Gras.   The Grilled Octopus ($17) had a charcoal grilled taste to it and was INCREDIBLY soft! It was a large portion of an octopus leg and was very tender. I'm not too familiar with octopus being prepared this way (I'm used to chewier, smaller pieces of octopus and squid legs) but I enjoyed this dish very much. It came with lentils and a piece of sausage. I was a little confused with this pairing but the sausage flavor went nicely with the octopus.   The pan seared Foie Gras ($24) was a small portion of duck liver that came with an apple sauce like substance and a tiny piece of ginger bread. The taste of duck liver was very strong in my opinion and I couldn't taste much seasoning on it. Luckily the sweetness of the apple sauce helped calm down the duck liver taste.  The Barrymore is definitely a pricier restaurant to visit but I really enjoyed my experience here! - 5/5 for the ambiance and service  - 5/5 for the cocktail  - 4/5 for the Grilled Octopus  - 3/5 for the Foie Gras   I would love to come back and give their dinner entrees a try. Perhaps a steak and another whiskey drink!

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Foie Gras (new menu item)
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled Octopus over lentils (new menu item)

aI9D4VeGVN1G3_ujS-7TGA.text: Food is great here. Perhaps one of the best I have had in recent years. Extensive wine menu. Service guys and galls are great. I highly recommend it.

YOGwGuqn8YMo3iAIEc_zKA.text: What is not to like the food is amazing we love it because it is a hidden jem the place is nothing to look at on the outside but as soon as you step in the place is very posh recommend

Wz5Wydi-DUPyEkxD0hxMuQ.text: After 3 trips to the Barrymore, I'm still a huge fan (see previous review).  Amazing, amazing pork chop this time along with Parnesan risotto and a Caesar.  This was Thanksgiving weekend and I dined alone at the bar. So I want to give a HUGE shout-out to Ingrid for making me feel so welcome.  She is a gem!

GiEC3RSrVm5WsasbCz1m4A.text: Restaurant week and we went with the escargots, wagyu flat steak and the pistachio creme brulee.  We arrived at 6:30pm and we were seated immediately.  Our waiter mumbles something and we let them know that we want to do the RW menu.  Escargots were bland, and though it was an interesting concept to placed them in the middle of the potato, it was just blah. The wagyu flat steak was coated with some spice that I wish they had noted so on the menu. It was very prominent and I wasn't a fan.  If I knew of this spice rub, I would have ordered the scallops instead.  I was able to eat a quarter of my steak before I called quits. The pistachio creme brulee was good.  Conclusion:  I will not be returning.

9C1Tm_H2CEEjhbomE00Nrg.text: We finally tried this place out after hearing great things. We loved almost everything, over all good restaurant!   we loved: the atmosphere, style, decor of the place. service was attentive, and our apps and side dishes were excellent.  and the server surprised us with a complimentary dessert at the end which we loved!   we didn't love: our steak just wasn't great which is always a bummer at a nice steak house! and the upselling was a little aggressive from the server, but i get it, just trying to do his job. I'm a server too so i notice when i'm being up sold a lot.   over all good experience and we enjoyed the night!

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. oysters rockafella
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. ceasar salad
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. ribeye steak

cd391Yw2cPs6EcmmSQALBQ.text: The Barrymore is located off the lobby of the Royal Resort. Upon arrival I was expecting to see a parking valet but after a few minutes no one appeared.  I found ample parking along side the building, just a short walk to the front door. The dining room can be described in many ways. Intimate, cozy, romantic, old school, retro Las Vegas. All of these are appropriate. Velour booths, film reels on the ceiling, celebrity wall art, and bronze eagle statues are all part of the decor. The lights above each booth provides the right amount of ambiance. The background music consisted of easy listening standards and was a conversation friendly volume. On this night it was apparent the rodeo fans have discovered this place as there were many diners wearing hats.  The dining room is small by Las Vegas standards but the Barrymore is Large on service. Excellent service was provided throughout our diner experience. First on the scene our head server. Danny greeted us and explained that he will be assisted by two other wait staff members. They worked as a team and there was always someone checking on us, refilling water glasses and clearing plates. In addition the General Manager made the rounds, stopping to chat at each table. He also helped clear.   The bread basket had a variety of rolls and some cheese flat bread. The standout was the pretzel rolls, simply irresistible. The menu leans to the meat category although there are a few seafood choices. However, I believe this is a place  to go with the beef. Both of us ordered the 8 oz Filet Mignon. Mine medium rare and hers well done. The steaks were cooked perfect just as ordered. The size actually appeared to be larger than 8 oz. The grilled asparagus were grilled al dente and had a hint of smoke. The french fries were large pieces made with the skins on. Crisp outside tender inside and grease less.

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Entrance
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wall Art
Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 8 oz Filet Mignon

XPorAPRCSQUf1_NL8ibLEw.text: The best part about being besties with Nate, the Yelp CM in Vegas is that he'll drag you around to some absolute gems in his hometown. Without hesitation, beyond any shadow of a doubt, no ifs, ands or buts about it, The Barrymore was my absolute fave!  This place is stunning! Slightly off the grid yet still accessible I have no idea how this place hasn't caught fire on Yelp yet with slews of reviews. You know what? Maybe they don't want it that way. On that note, maybe I don't want it that way?! It's intimate, cozy, not overrun by riffraff from the strip and very confident in their current stance. I'd have it no other way!  The drinks are proper and the staff is beyond friendly. Blue cheese olives for that Martini? You bet your ass! A drink like this is perfectly aligned with the classy yet approachable decor and my only regret is not sticking around longer since we had a dinner to attend. You better believe that I'll be diving in head first to that sleek little dining room hidden behind the wall of wine on my next visit. This is my kind of spot!  Thanks Nate and thanks Barrymore!

_jqGm154K3lAE52c53wClQ.text: 4 stars only because I have not ate there, only enjoyed their wine selection...  Wine selection is on point for a small off strip stake house. You'll definitely get what you pay for so be afraid to sip on a 30$ glass of wine. It will set you straight.   Staff was great to talk too, each one of them. They know how to engage and educate about the bottle or just bull shit about anything else.   Parked right outside the door and walked right in. No dam huge hotel and crappy parking lot to deal with, nice experience.

6FNaH2-OAquyR0N1GqNPkw.text: Class act place. Inside it feels like you're in Charlie Chaplin's dining room. The food and service was amazing.

lD93_C-xaRx19dIxdL8BhA.text: You must eat here if you come to Vegas. I've had plenty of lobster Mac in the day in almost every restaurant in NYC but this was the best tasting lobster Mac I've ever had!  Great ambience. First class, top notch. Five stars!

photos.caption: Photo of The Barrymore - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dxiPqNL7p0vadT2uTf_k0A.text: Awesome little gem in Vegas.  The bone in rib eye was spot on at medium rare and soooo tasty.  Glad I found them on Yelp and gave em a whirl since I was staying at the Marriott.

21_pgJ70R63u17eFVV7HPw.text: Really nice classy and romantic restaurant off the strip past Encore.  Excellent food and service. The best thing we had here was the beet salad, the cream corn side, and the creme brulee. The Sea Bass and special Thanksgiving dinner was also good.
